column4: Free wifi and a fairly large room by European standards. II loved having a makeup mirror (but without lights). High tub which could be difficult for some to get into. Bed was pretty firm. You must use your key card to turn on the lights. There is very little around there. Casablanca is pretty much for commerce, not tourism.

column3: An amazing hotel in Casablanca. The best one.
column4: I had to attend to a business meeting at this hotel. Everything was perfect. Nice people, nice services. Everything was perfect from the service room to the restaurant. I have not much to say, I am only filling the 200 characters that ask me tripadvisor

Great hotel with a perfect location and really nice staff especially Aicha , Nadia and Mr Idrissi. The Service and hospitality was incredible and a big thank you to all the staff. In general it’s worth a visit.

The hotel is in the heart of Casablanca with an amazing roof restaurant. My stay was exceeded my expectations by far. Since it was a business stay, I was stressed however, the staff were extremely helpful and always available to help with everything during our event. The restaurant staff and supervisors (Ms. Khadija and Mr. Idrissi deserve to be thanked and to be highly recommended. I'm writing this review while still continuing my stay at the hotel, I honestly feel like home which contributed to both my physical and emotional my comfort.

Great location. Comfortable, beautiful view of the city, service was wonderful. Hassan took care of us, he was gracious and very attentive. The restaurants has themes, Mexican last visit, Egyptian this time.

column3: Rooms in need of a total renovation and new furnishings
column4: I'm not sure if the 5 star rating on previous posts were written by actual employees pretending to be guests (Yes, I'm calling out those with 1 contribution) because this hotel does not even deserve 3 stars. When we arrived, the front desk staff gave us a room that was still occupied. It was a non-issue so we just went back and got a different room. It turned out our new room (#501) was huge but needs a major overhaul. The fixtures have seen its days and the carpet was filthy. The hallway was rundown with wall panels coming off the seam and the worst part was the nauseous smell of sewage which the hotel tried to mask with a diffuser. Since the smell did not creep into our room and we were only staying for one night, we let it go. My husband and I also thought it was an…

Comfortable rooms and friendly staff. The restaurant on the 16th floor, Le Sezieme, offers an excellent view from which to unwind at the end of the day. The service provided by Hassan makes for an even more enjoyable visit to this part of the hotel

Thank you Idrissi for taking such good care of us tonight! You were warm and friendly and made us feel at home! Great food also! Nice atmosphere, good food choice, nice surroundings and comfortable chairs!

While some of the staff were truly the nicest I have encountered in a hotel others were completely dismissive and rude. The hall ways had a very strange smell which at one stage resembled very strong stale fish, causing some American tourists I overheard to have to move floors. The elevators are also a variable feast and one afternoon it took me 20 minutes to get from the lobby to my room (only one lift was semi-working and my room keycard had been cancelled necessitating a slow trip back to reception). The hot dishes at breakfast were usually quite cold and getting a waiters attention at the bar on the 16th foor was not easy. The business centre is also not particularly functional. On a positve side the room was clean and very quiet and the fresh fruit at breakfast was…

Honestly the whole staff is really nice. And being welcomed every morning by Aicha and Nadia really makes every morning sunny 😁 along with the help of Hassan. Also Mr.idrissi was really helpful for me and all the colleagues. Would recommend this hotel 100%

It was a pleasure staying at this Brand new property, which is 2 minutes walking from the city center. Movenpick is a nice hotel with excellent food and service. They offer complementary fruit, chocolates and coffee in the room. Breakfast is good and you can choose: Indian, moroccan continental, etc. Also the restaurant is very good and reasonably priced. Overall the experience was brilliant and enjoyed or weekend getaway a lot. I will definitely stay there again. I really appreciate the service with smiles and high professionalism. Kira & Belahbib

Good day, reader! My stay at the Movenpick hotel, which is a five star hotel situated in the heart of Casablanca, is coming to an end. I was asked by Madam Aicha at the reception (in their cafeteria) to write a review of my stay and I am so delighted with her acquaintance that I planned on writing as many paragraphs as it would take. For your sake though, I will limit myself to three positive points and three negative points. [Disappointed by] 1 - The pool is very small. 2 - Expensive. 3 - Business lounges require a better service. We had to exit the lounge several times to ask for waiters and the manager to care for the hygiene of the buffet area. [Happy about] 1 - Location. 2 - Madam Aicha and everyone in the 0 floor, really. From Hassan, to the receptionists and…

Came here for a business trip. We had a Wonderful service and Very friendly staff Aïcha, Nadia, Jaouad, Hassan, and khadija were very helpful and professional. Would recommend it to people who come here for business trips.

I recommend the hotel for any tourist. The location is near the old market and the new market. It is also near the tram. The food service is excellent. Ms Aicha is very kind and caring when she receives the guest in the dining hall. good luck

Hassan (the manager) has a very friendly staff and great service. The cosy evening atmosphere makes it a little oasis on a roof top. The beer is cold and the food good. Comfortable couches and round the pool seating make for relaxed conversation. I will be back soon.

we came as direct clients but they doubled the price for us ! When we check booking.com we found that they doubled the price, just for that night , it is really a shame to have that! We spend a good time in morocco , but when we had our last night before the plane they changed our expectations.

This hotel is real value for money. It is in the heart of the city. A little trouble to reach because of the traffic and there is no parking space available in front of the hotel. Rooms are clean and staff helpful. Wifi coverage is very good and fast. Breakfast is very weak especially if you pay 20 Eur.

Hello all I would like to advise the Movenpick hotel Casablanca to the visitors of the vibrant city of Casablanca. At the reception your Will deserve a warm and friendly welcome with mrs Lasfar F.Z or Mouna, then you will appreciate the open breakfast buffet with the good advise of Mrs Aicha,Kadidja or Nadia,on the 16th floor you will have a nice view of Casablanca city,the rooms are clean,housekeeping is Perfect,mrs Nadia or Ghizlane will always be at your service and the rest of the staff if very professional. Around the hotel there is a tramway station and also taxis are always available. Enjoy your stay and share to your friends. Kind regards. Mr NGUEMA.

I’d like to thank Mövenpick hotel in Casablanca, Morocco for its great hospitality and service. I’d like to praise the receptionist Lasfar Fatima Zahra for her competence and efficiency, as well as Saber Mourad. On the other hand, as far as dining room is concerned, The maitre D El idrissi Khaled does a great job with customers, as well as Abdelwahed in charge of hotel restaurants.

I stayed here in November 3 nights as part of a tour group. Our room was very disappointing. The room door was broken and we had a hassle getting it fixed, there was mold in the shower, broken trim and old carpet. This hotel needs some serious refurbishing. Surly there are better hotels in the city.

column3: Perfect service by Hassan & awesome place
column4: We went here for a drink with a view and ended up in a very nice Mexican event. Got drinks and some very nice nachos with guacamole. The service has been perfect thanks to Hassan who served us in a very friendly and professional way.

New, modern, spacious, elegant and clean hotel. Four Large and fast elevators. Nice spread of food in the buffet (variety & presentation) both for breakfast & dinner. Well appointed large rooms. Shall not hesitate to return.

Nounr was our server for drinks at Movenpick by the beautiful pool. He was friendly and very helpful. One of the best servers at the hotel. Hotel is top notch, clean and a quiet. Be aware that the hotel is a maze but does come with a map.

Great place to stay! perfect location great staff my compliments to: Mr Driss the night manager Mr Idrissi from room service please note the food is excellent all the reception staff is brilliant I got un upgrade - the flat was perfect!

Nice hotel in a good location, the stuff is friendly and weeling to help in any way. The restaurant manager mr. Khalid is present during dinner and supervises everything. In general it is a nice hotel and worths a visit.

We were booked into the hotel as part of a tour of Morocco. The good news first. Service in the bar was very good and the menu, though limited, was excellent. Maid service was good, but the front desk staff wasn’t that great. The rest of the hotel wasn’t that great either. The water in the bath was barely luke warm and they did not provide a washcloth for bathing. The barely warm water did not make for an inviting shower. The bathroom door wouldn’t shut all the way without getting stuck. Worst of all, there was some kind of weird techno music in the lounge from 11pm to 3 am that woke us every night. I don’t think you heard it as much as you felt the vibrating bass and drums through the walls. We try to drink bottled water when traveling, just to be safe. They had a large…

Good for short stay.. the hotel in central city excellent spot and rooms are clean but the A/C In the lobby hot.. SPA too poor .. the spot of the hotel in central city so you have to be aware of crowded street and noisy cars which you will hear.. the staff in reception are very nice and helpful and kind .. i think the hotel need some Renovation in future

We spent one night at this hoter while visiting Morocco. Very good hotel, spacious room, comfortable bed, clean and welcoming. Very generous breakfast - versatile and plentiful. We enjoyed our stay here. Merci!!!

The hotel was clean and the restaurant service great. Especially Idrissi who showed me what hospitality is all about. Amina kept the room neat and clean if you are visiting Casablanca, do not forget to spend some times the famous 16th floor as it gave you a fair view of the Atlantic Ocean as great food!

Place suits for running Business Trips to Casablanca. Thanks back to Mr. HASSAN facilitation and kind welcoming and his team on 16th Floor. I had been able to finish my dinner is a calm and suited place

Very centrally located - easy taxi ride to everything - safe around to walk. Service was outstanding - especially Said in Technique Great breakfast with the coffee made to order - not just generic standard. Really recommend it

column3: Nice Hotel, with amazing terrace bar and staff
column4: Amazing stay. The hotel is a good spot in Casablanca, centric and polished, but where it shines is in the personel: kind, professional, attentive to clients. I won't forget the treatment, including Hassan, the maitre in the incredible terrace bar with swimming pool, La 16éme, (16th floor). Heartily recommended.

column3: disappointing stay at the movenpick casablanca
column4: my husband and I were in Casablanca for an overnight stay in October. we were booked for a room with a king size bed. the room we were assigned did not have a king size bed, not only that-the refrigerator and air conditioner were not working. the refrigerator was replaced and we were told that the hotel was having problems with the air conditioning but it had been fixed. upon retiring for the evening, we started hearing loud music. we were on the 2nd floor of the hotel and unbeknownst to us this was above the lobby bar!! we attempted to sleep through the music and several complaints to the front desk(no the air was not working still), we finally asked to change our room. we were moved to the 7th floor with a king size bed and air conditioning that worked. upon check out in the…

I have no complaints to about the Movenpick! It was the perfect place for me and my husband to get away from reality and relax for the week. The Service and hospitality was incredible and a big thank you to all the staff and Mr Jamil for making sure our week was a a good as can be.

I spent the weekend in Casablanca with my family,I stayed at the Movenpick and I loved it! The service was brilliant and we had no problems. Big shout out our Host, Jamil, who was extremely helpful and made are stay that much better! Thank you for the great hospitality! Adam.

I like the place i felt comfortable in there i had a good dinner with my friends the food was delicious the drinks also and the atmosphere with a beautiful view on the 16th floor all casablanca shows up

Movenpick hotel was a lovely stay for one night in Casablanca. The staff was very accommodating and knowledgeable about where to go for dinner/breakfast and were able to grab taxis for us. We had a little mix up the next morning with our tour guide and we had checked out but needed a few more hours and it wasn’t a problem at all. They let us back into our rooms and let us stay for as long as we needed to.

We had a great great time there. the staff was awesone, the food was a taste from heaven,everything was just perfect.I personally felt home over there.We will definitely come back and invite other friends to enjoy it too...

Amazing place in the center of the city with a great view. The restaurant is very good and Hassan with the staff will treat you very well. Definitely a place to come over and over again if you are in Casablanca.

Good hotel, great terrace with an amazing view. Nice location. The rooms are very spacious and clean. Very good breakfast with some Morrocan specialties. Amazing concierge service, very helpful and kind.

I was at the hotel August 29 to 31, 2019. The vent on he roof was leaking water. Mohamed the technician, khadijah who was with Mohamed. The 2 room cleaners Hafsa and Omaima went out of their way to help me out. Got me a new room, made it a pleasure and comfortable move. The hotel staff are always ready to help you in anyway, they are respectful, kind and very very helpful. I stay at this hotel often when I am in Casablanca for work. Front desk, workers at the roof top pool, are all a pleasure to deal with. Rooms are always very clean, they respond to any requests you have in minutes. Thank you to the staff of Movenpick Casablanca.

I really appreciate the comfort during our stay with their hospitable staff and great management team. The amazing food and the pool view with a nice SPA on 16th floor. Thank you for your kindness. Great experience I will come back again.

I usually use chain hotels due to the number of people I travel with, Movenpick is always my top favorite on the list. The hotel itself is well located near the business area and close to anywhere else too. Clean and comfortable rooms thanks to the hotel maids. What makes our stay even better is the Top Notch services conducted by the reception staff, namely Lasfar & Akli. They both made sure to have an amazing stay and that my group would enjoy everything too. They are a true asset to the Movenpick hotel and I am glad they helped me with so many things during the check in and through the out stay. What made my group even happier was the buffet breakfast that was impossible for any other hotels to make at 4AM because we were flying out early. I thank you for making it…

The service is great and the staff is very helpful. Meeting room is spacious and the data show was reliable. Thanks to the banquet team Khaled and Amine for their professionalism and thanks to Khadija and Nadia for their warm hospitality in the restaurant and appreciation to Fatima Ezzahra at the reception for making the payment process very swift

I was staying this hotel for about a month, i got a room on 3rd floor, there was no view but it was fine because if you want to have a view you will have to deal with a lot of noise from the street. Food was okay, but the room service was amazing. My cleaner was very helpful and friendly, always smiling! She did her job amazing! Thanks Houria!

column3: Very good service and amazing roof top
column4: I stayed with my family last week and the staff was so nice and helpful, the room super big and clean. I loved the delicious breakfast and at night the rooftop had the perfect ambience. A very modern hotel in a very good location.

Very good service and very nice swimming pool Especially Mr. Jamil who was helping in the door very friendly and gentle for sure coming back soon 👍👍 Charming, great staff, brilliant place to come back again

Nice hotel, very good service and people. Located in the very city centre. Thanks to Hassan and all the other employees for the good stay, very professional and welcoming people! I hope to come back soon.

column3: A civilized Oasis high in the sky
column4: On the 16th floor of this great hotel, there is a nice Open Air Restaurant built around a swimming pool. I was there once before for a glass of wine in the evening. I like it. I stopped by today for lunch, and had a great time. The weather called for lunch a la Fresco. Truly a civilized place high above the hustle and bustle of Casablanca. They have a barbecue chef by the pool, made me a great sandwich. The staff at the bar were just wonderful. I will certainly come back.

Staying in the hotel the bar is a great place to hang out day and night. Personnel really friendly and helpful . Hasan Merci you are the best. In General what you need From a hotel when on business trips. Situated in the City close to everything the downside is traffic chaos.

Hello. I would like to express my gratitude to all the staff of the movenpick hotel casablanca for their professional stance, kindness and generosity. Without this staff the hotel wouldnt have this level. But also the managing directors also are professional because the work goes smoothly. I enjoyed my stay and would defunitely recommend. Thank you and all the best.

We enjoyed this wonderful hotel and had a great time. The staff treated us wonderfully specially the manager Fatima Chahid and Idris the night manager and all other staff. They were were all very helpful, amenable and kind.

Hotel well located, citycenter, street with a tram, 5 minutes from port, main train station. Rooms are comfortable. Staff very helpful. Nice restaurant at the rooftop, with a swimming pool. Special thanks to Mrs. Fadua for her hospitality at the breakfast, to Mrs. Kawtar from reception, and all the staff.

I had the pleasure to stay recently at Movempick Casablanca Hotel and, Indeed Truly Great experience. The hotel and staff were wonderful and Especially Tarik Sayed & Otman at the 16th Floor. The view was great, the food was super. Would recommend this hotel in the strongest of terms

Mr. Hasan in the restaurant Casablanca Cafe, also Salahe, the best persons in service n hospitality. Hotel excellent, rooms are very good n air-conditioning perfect. Surrounding Area is also perfect, tram station nearby

column3: Leave a lot to be desired
column4: Stayed over night and our last night in Morocco also just to be close to the airport. The property is old but clean somewhat. Check-in was slow. Room has no coffee or tea amenity, minibar was empty so not sure if that’s the standard of Mövenpick or they just forget to put, anyway we didn’t bother to ask. Only 1 restaurant was on operation, the rooftop bar so we ordered room service for dinner. Food was cold, tajine oily ( horrible after the tasty tajine we had in Marrakech and Tanger) and bread that comes with it was hard. Soup lukewarm. We are so tired from our long trip from Marrakech that we just didn’t bother to return the food and wait another 45mins for fresh ones( if they are capable of preparing decent food.) Noisy due to the night club on the ground floor so didn’t get…

Thanks for Amr Kallini the general manager of movenpick Casablanca.He is very powerful about human relationships.He solve my problem as soon possible.The hotel is nice.The roof is excellent with mint green tea.

We had a very good time in this hotel. They were very kind. Paying attention of every details, taking care about us. Reception, room service, laundry was fantastic. We are looking forward to come back and visit again. Thanks to all the staff working in Movenpick

staff is exceptional speak English, spanish and french room is said to be spacious and it is room is always clean bathroom is spacious as well food is great-moroccan salad is top tiramisu and fondant and tarte aux pommes - delicious i just cannot recommend it enough i have more than 120 nights and still counting Mr Driss of the reception is simply the best hotel officer i have ever met!

Great hotel amazing staff service A1. The location is perfect u have a lot of restaurants around, 10min away from the beach, u take a cab 5$usd also souk Habbous is 5min walk away. I recommend this hotel for everybody

Good hotel, nice rooms, the staff are very friendly, the lady who cleaned my room Amina was very attentive, always making sure I had enough water. Overall I enjoyed my stay in the hotel. I would definitely recommend it.

The hotel is no where near 5 star. Its old and has a sewage smell in rooms. Beds are uncomfortable and hard. The worst of all is that it has a nightclub with loud music until 3 am so good luck sleeping. I called them 5 times and even threatened to call the police as I had a very early morning flight and I couldn't sleep at 2 am because of the music. Stay away from this nightmare of a place.

column3: Most Confortable Stay you can experience ever
column4: Most Confortable Stay you can experience ever POSITIVE: The rooms are really clean & neat, properly maintained and comfortable to stay in. But the best part of the hotel is the staff @ reception and concierge all staffs are so humble, patient and so sweet you can’t help but smile. It was not my first time stay and I really had a great stay again. The receptionists assigned in the morning: The manger Redha Youssef, Fatimaezzahra & Somaya the house keeping are so efficients & polite, really like them. NEGATIVE: Pool Area is dated, was not clean enough & not enough sun-beds around the pool Buffet @ the main restaurant was dated and food average Nevertheless, I will return in few weeks coz it the best hotel staff in Casablanca. 😀

I’m a official guest of this hotel and I want to provide a review about the cleaner Fatna. She is always available and professional and made my room always clean and well organized. Thanks Fatna Il bar sul roof top al 16 piano è molto caro per essere a Casablanca

The best service ever so welcoming and helpful always smiling and trying to make every single client happy and satisfied i loved everything about the hotel but when the concierge service treat you well and special everything feels more amazing. Special thanks to Jamil if i remember his names right he was basically doing everything he could to make the days that we stayed good and easy for someone from a foreign country.

Don't expect the level of standard you normally get at a Movenpick. Rooms need to be refreshed, walls dirty and crumbling, rooftop pool very small, Hotel is located in a very busy,noisy section of the city. Overall this Hotel needs major clean up

I have stay 2 months at Movenpick Hotel in Casablanca. Im an airline pilot based here. I want to give special thanks to housekeeping service, always with a big smile and very good cleaning. I want to mentioned specifically Soumia Gharib and housekeeper Hajaar, always open to hour needs. Thank you!

It’s one of the best hotels I visit I am a pilot I travel a lot .... I recommend this hotel for anyone visit Casablanca amazing hotel with amazing stuff very friendly ,, help you in anything whenever & whatever you want very nice pool bar ((16 floor)) & a lot of things to do in this hotel really don’t miss the chance to visit this hotel it’s like home for anyone....❤️

good location，nice swimming pool on the roof，nice people，recommend to come my frineds to visit movenpick hotel casablanca i booked via internet with good price and i found good quality of service thank you to all teams

I was on 22.08.19 with a group in the hotel Mövenpick in Casablanca. The employee at the check in was YOUSSEF. I was thrilled with his fast and professional work. Such a smooth and fast process, you always wish. Very friendly and compitent. The employee YOUSSEF speaks English very well. Come again.

You would not wish for more: outstanding service together with high standard infrastructure and first class facilities. If you go up to the 16ieme at the roof top, you will be charmed by the the venue (swimming pool, outdoor barbecue, premuium draft beer, etc). The stuff is just of great hospitality and highly customized service. Ask for Tarik, Sayed or Othman, you won t help staying for longer and longer

Great Central location. Attentive staff. Our concierge Mohamed was amazing at helping us navigate the confusing streets and get us to where we needed to be in the shortest time. Rooftop pool was great place to decompress,cool off, and have a drink after a long day of sightseeing. Room was kept immaculate by housekeeping. Would definitely recommend.

I recently spent a couple of nights at the Mövenpick Casablanca along with my 2 toddlers and sister. We stayed in 1414, I think it's the executive suite but Im not sure. Either way it was a lovely room with a spacious bathroom and a jacuzzi. Even though I always prefer a shower when living away the jacuzzi was a huge hit with the children. It sure took a while to fill the bathtub so make sure you put the tap on early. The bedroom was nice and cozy with a blurred glas wall facing the bathroom. Big TV with a good selection of channels. The living room area Was surprisingly large. Staff is great, every single employee. However Kawtar, the woman who checked us in is a real star. Very kind and super service minded. Thank you for a pleasant stay. We will definitely visit again.

column3: 2/3 days enough to visit the Mosque, the Medina, Rick's Cafe
column4: Excellent hotel. Casa Cafe pool bar on 16th floor great fun.Great facilities. Fabulous service. Getting around is easy by taxi.- always agree a price in advance- 50 dirhams or 5€. To get to the port area, use a 'petit taxi' for good value

column3: A must visit roof top in Casablanca
column4: I think this is the only 5 stars hotel here to have a roof top swimming pool . The view is amazing One can enjoy a hookah ( witch I’m very fund of ) a drink or a light snack ( they have a barbecue right on the sixteen floor where they serve grills or shawarma the staff here is so friendly The manager runs this roof top so professionally and Tarek is so caring and helpful. I just love this place

As soon as se got there, the people were really nice. The concierge named Mostafa was really Nice And helpfull! he helped us to Made our itinerary very kindly, And gave us a Lot of recomendations of places we could go. The service was excelent And also the location because is at the center of Casa Blanca :) I truly recomind it.

This is our 5th year dealing with Movenpick casablanca as our partner of choice to all our events, the banquet service there is very professional, meeting rooms well organised, the staff is friendly and reliable. Food and drinks are the best in class.

I would like to thank all of : salem ,kaouthar ,youssef and Mr redha the front office manager for all the effort there are doing to satisfy all the guests. really it is an amazing service and I really appreciate it. i request for everyone who is going to be in Casablanca to book in Movenpick hotel. fantastic.

column3: Rooftop pool and view is spectacular
column4: Liked the location. About a 15 minute walk to the old city. Also right by a tram station (costs about 7 dhirem). We took the tram to Ain Diab beach (must change to yellow line) then walked along the boardwalk to Morocco mall which was amazing! Inside the mall there is a fountain and aquarium. Everything looked very new and modern (except the washroom which needs updating). The hotel room was good except the shower door was very poorly designed. Water gets all over the floor when you shower. Awful design! Also, I asked for an extra roll of toilet paper and the cleaning lady said you only get 2. I was shocked! I have never been declined extra toilet paper at any hotel I have stayed at! That was ridiculous! The room itself is spacious but the beds are a bit hard. Tip: if you want…

column3: Dated hotel that has seen better days
column4: Dated and needs an update. Slow reception staff, understaffed at peak checkin and check out times. Had several issues with room door not working and key needed to be reprogrammed every time. And I did not keep key next to my phone or other RFID devices. Terrible breakfast and bad coffee. Location is in the city centre but there are lots of better hotels in the area.

We had some booking issues with the hotel for our group of around 25 which caused some of our guests quite a bit of discomfort. Despite this, I was impressed by the friendliness of most of the staff who spoke very good English and were always smiling. My sincere thanks for the Concierge team, especially Hassan and Jamil, to the conference catering team, in particular Mostafa, and to the lovely receptionist Majid who greeted us and treated us very warmly.

very convenient to visit most of Casablanca's highlights...and To have a beautiful view of Casablanca, I strongly recommend the 16th etg with a nice swimming pool ..and also with a very good service from the staff of Kalid. Thanks a lot

It's an excellent roof top at Casablanca. A very nice quality of food and drinks. Delightful staff, helpful and welcoming. Best team in town. Hope to see u again guys. Won't hesitate to recommend to all.

I stayed here for two nights on 05/30 - 06/01/19. The hotel is located in the commercial district and the tram for commuters is literally right outside the front door. The hotel is large with many floors and a rooftop pool and bar. Check-in was quick and easy. The staff were very nice. I had a room on the 4th floor but it nearly drove me crazy because it was so noisy - near the street and you could hear every honking car! There is a lot of honking too! If you stay here, get a high floor. I did not have a view except of the street. Nothing pretty here. Overall the staff was nice. The breakfast buffet was not included in the room rate and it was an additional 20 Euros. The breakfast was very good and they had a better than average spread of everything you could want.…

I was disappointed with Movenpick Casablanca. This is an older hotel in need of some serious refurbishment. Pool area and furnishings very sad. Rooms ordinary. Casablanca must have better to offer than this.

I stayef at movenpick casa for busines purpose. I liked the check in process the guy humbly took care of my car and lignage and walked me to my room. It was a Nice spacious room with a cosy bed ans room service was excellent

My first room was in a very bad condition, with shower broken, curtains broken and even a table broken. I changed room and it was a bit better, but rooms are faded and need a to be refreshed. Service is ok and people try to make you happy ou to help you. Breakfast is ok, with a large offer. But I know Movenpick, and here we do not have 5 stars. This is is correct 3-4 stars.

I came to the Movenpick as a host or a large group and they, especially the 16th floor staff went above and beyond to accommodate my group! From a surprise DJ for our event to extra food and beverages, a great staff for a great hotel. The restaurant staff was delightful as well. Many thanks!!!

While we did not have a bad experience with the hotel, it is still surprising that this is a 5 star hotel. The lobby is average, the elevator is old and slow, service is dependent on who is at the counter. Even the Mint Tea at the 16th floor bar is too overpriced. Location is not that good for tourists Good things about the hotel: the bed is large, breakfast food is ok, the transportation people and the bellhops were professional. Location maybe good for those in town for business. Overall, hotel is OK but lower your expectations, it is not 5 stars by any stretch of the imagination.

The staff from hotel, especially reception and restaurant was perfect. Kawtar (girl from reception) was there for all the things that me and my colleagues were needed. Excellent location. I will come again definitely.

Five star for this beautiful place. Gharib(girl from reception) helped me a lot for everything i asked for. Soumia(house keeping) very kindly and professional lady. I will come again on this place! All the best!

Reception desk is very helpful and pleasent. Kawtar and other colleagues are so great. Hotel is clean and on good location. Service is excellent. Pool is very clean and cosy excellent for daily relaxing. Will stay again.

The hotel is horrible. The cleanliness in the room is very poor. My kid har white socks and after 10 minutes walking in the room its became black. Old furniture, smell of old in the room. The breakfast is always the same. The breakfast is until 10.30 in te morning. After 10.40. , in every morning, someone from the stuff said us we must leave the restaurant because they must prepare the lunch. In every morning after 10.00 we had to ask for water, for spoon, for glasses. Because its had missed and nobody bring others. 5 stars hotel.

column3: What makes my stay always delightful is the staff in this hotel
column4: I stay in this hotel at least twice a month I’m from Canada Very clean facilities the rooms are very clean and overall experience great what I always remember when they leave this hotel is the kindness of the stuff they are always there to make you feel right at home from the front desk Fatim azzahra ( both of them ) kawtar / Salem / Majid To conciergerie all the humble amazing men that work there Mustafa !! What a Gem And of course the restaurant bar upstairs every time I go to the 16th I’m always very well greeted by Tarek and Otmane and sayed ( who speaks English) I cannot to make a stop in this hotel without going upstairs to see them always a warm welcome and an amazing experience props and Bravo 👏🏻 To these 3 guys Sayed / othmane / and tareek They go always…

Located in the very heart of the busy city of Casablanca ,the Movenpick provides comfotable accomodation and many leisure facilities to guests including a rooftop swimming pool and a small gym.Rooms have good double glazing protection affording a good quiet environment to visitors.Room size and furniture just right to affod a cosy stay.Bed quite comfortable. Breakfast is served in the rooftop restaurant by the open pool. Reception staff very cordial and helpful, especially so the concierge .

Good, clean room Nice breakfast Wifi is good Friendly Staff Restaurants on walking distance Carrefour on walking dinstance Close to big road, you can hear traffic pretty good Fitness is there but only if you do cardio, not enough weights!

I would say this hotel is in between a 3 and a 4, but I can’t go half numbers, so I’ll have to go with the lower number. It is a up to western standards hotel that serves its purpose if you’re looking for western commodities for personal hygiene as well as for a good night’s rest. It is atypical of your big city hotel, basically is you forgot you were in Morocco you could have seen this hotel in any other big city. I didn’t take many pictures because there wasn’t anything that blew my mind away for the exception of the artwork pictured and us watching the Game of Thrones season premiere during breakfast. This place serves the purpose for a enjoyable visit to go sightseeing in Casablanca.

Clean room. Check in is a drag. No shower curtains or doors so water went all over the bathroom floor. There is a Nice roof top terrasse with pool. Smoking allowed. Accommodating for early departure. Breakfast was made for our group of 14 at 4:30 am

We have been in Casablanca for three nights and have stayed at this hotel. It is more than adequate but a little tired in the foyers. Our room was fine with sweeping views of the city. It was clean, a comfortable bed and good bathroom with plenty of products, safe, wifi etc. All that you would expect from a business hotel. All staff were courteous and helpful which was great as we have no Moroccan and little French language skills. THe hotel gym was a little small but adequate. The buffet breakfast was excellent with plenty of choice and good coffee. THe real highlight was the 16th floor restaurant and pool. It was an excellent spot to enjoy some sun around the pool whilst enjoying a coffee or a drink. We had two dinners at the restaurant and Sayed and his team really…

I’ve been at the hotel for two weeks and I have to say I’ve been really impressed by the service provided by the staff. Everyone goes the extra mile in making your stay more memorable. The rooms are really well maintained and Ms. Fatima and Ghizzane always do their part with a great smile at all times brining that home vibe; away from home. I’ve overall really impressed by the service.

The room was comfortable and well-appointed. It is not super-modern deluxe but not Third World either. The staff was pleasant, the hot water was sufficient and the bed was comfortable. The restaurant was pleasant, and dinner the night of our arrival was Swiss night, served buffet style. Movenpick was always a Howard Johnson type of hotel which became more fashionable, so if you view it from that point of view you will get the proper perspective. (it is not a Ritz Carlton, for example, or a Hilton...)

column3: Nothing worth a 5 star, below Movenpick standards
column4: Very unpleasant surprise as this hotel clearly does not meet the Movenpick standards. Where to start? Room: very old style, tired bedside lighting appliances falling from the wall but kind of new carpet and new flat screen TV. Very poor selection of channels for a 5 star (no Canal+ which can be found in some 3 star hotels here) , no Bein sport either, mostly free channels!!!) Decent wifi Bathroom: vanity mirror barely staying fixed in the wall, threadbare old towels, , chipped tiles, not very clean (chewing gum on the floor and hair in bath) Breakfast: very small room with max 50 seats for a 16 floor hotel! No SWISS MUESLI in a MOVENPICK: is this allowed by the Brand??? Only second grade cereals When requesting a bowl for fruits, a staff took the last dirty bowl (with some…

For my first (and last) tour with Globus, I arrived a day early and booked a room through an online service. I then contacted the manager asking that to occupy the same room as had been scheduled for the one-night stay with the Globus tour. I prefer this to changing rooms, and know that it saves resources (laundry, housekeeping staff). Every request was honored, including a room on an upper floor, room 1014. I stayed in a different room when the tour ended the following Friday, thus the last three accompanying photos depict different furnishings. Upon arriving that March Saturday afternoon, a doorman greeted me with a smile when opening the door. How civilized! (My high school French from 50 years ago got a workout!☺) Registration staff were pleasant, and concierge staff were…

The rooms are very clean and always offered with water bottles, shampoo, amenities. Mademoiselle Haffsa and Mme Fouzia always take very good care of the order and cleanliness of living and bathroom. Merci beaucoup. Dominik

We were booked at The Kensi hotel but they did not honor our reservation due to the king visiting and sent us to the Movenpick Hotel , telling us it was a 5 star hotel. The hotel had a bad odor on our floor, smelt like sewage. The roof top restaurant and pool were nice but all of the tables were dirty, none had been cleaned after people left. We went to dinner at 7pm and were the only people there. We were a family of 4. We ordered soup for an appetizer and our meal. By 8:15, we had not received our soup yet. After complaining, we waited until 8:30 and left. Worst service we had ever seen. This is not a 5 star hotel, it barely makes a 3 star. BEWARE

I am staying here for 3 days and stay 3 days more. Reception and breakfast was excellent. And it is near to the light train. And very good location. Rooms are also good but maintanence is not enough for 5 star. I had electricity problem. In my room when I open and if I close all light when I want to sleep. All electric is going and nothing works. In a day 3 times I informed reception to send somebody. And one night I did morning without electric. Also today the sink was bloked morning. When I came night it was the same how I left. Also no water for complimentary. And no hand towels. Maybe they came to clean and somebody call them after they forget to come back.

We stayed at this hotel movenpick for 2 nights Very disappointing Rooms odd shaped very noisy, one could hear the vehicles going up and down the street all night. Breakfast was terrible.you have to ask for everything No way it is 5 star! Dinner was great either.

this hotel is in a very busy and noisy corner. the rooms are odd shape and our room (#404) faced the next building's offices. the breakfast spread was disappointing and the dinner on the 16th floor (pool deck) was dampened by the strong cold wind entering the restaurant. it was unpleasant sitting there for a meal when the cold wind keeps coming in through the gaps on the glass panels. staff members at the check in were stern faced.

column3: A great business hotel in the city
column4: We stayed here for our last 2 nights of our trip. The rooms are spacious, clean and well decorated in this pleasant hotel that offers great value for money compared to others in its category. We opted to stay here rather than along the Corniche and that was a great decision as the hotels along the Corniche looked pretty dismal. Check in was fast even though we arrived an hour earlier than the check in time. Staff were always friendly and very helpful. Having the tram right across the hotel is a huge advantage (you can get to the Corniche simply and for less than a taxi) and there are lots of good restaurants in the neighbourhood. Try the famous ice cream parlour down the street or the burger joint just around the corner.

column3: Despite heavy pressure, the personnel still made it work :-)
column4: On one of the evneings during my stay I decided to have lunch in the restaurant on the ground floor. Apparently two large groups were also coming to the resto and consequently only a buffet service was available and not the usual A-la-carte menu. The restaurant was clearly understaffed (I don't understand this approach from the management), but Idrissi and Azekri managed to get everyine served and kept doing that with a smile and flair. Thanks to both of you, but management shoudl really take a look at the staffing when large groups are coming.

column3: Family Vacation for Chinese New Year 2019
column4: Good location in the business district of Casablanca. Design of the hotel has a Moroccan feel and I like the smell of the hotel surrounding (some kind of flowery scent). Breakfast spread was satisfying with Moroccan cuisine as well as international. The buffet dinner was similar with mixture of Moroccan cuisine and continental fusion.

column3: Very good business center and meeting rooms
column4: Our company often rents meeting rooms in this hotel and service here is always perfect. The responsible person for the meeting center is always at your disposal and helps wherever he can. (Some items were forgotten and he came to bring them back to us.) During coffee breaks, there are always snacks (morrocan cookies, fruits) and drinks (morrocan mint tea, coffee,...) foreseen at the exact timing you ask for them. I would recommend this location for all your business meetings in Casablanca.

I stayed here for two nights and was pleased with this hotel. Nothing extraordinary, but met all expectations and was comfortable, clean and offered the “little extras”, such as bathrobes and slippers. The rooms are very spacious, which was appreciated. Breakfast buffet had a good selection and was replenished adequately. I stayed as a tourist, but I see this hotel as a good business trip accommodation. Recommended.

we were a group of 8 and looking for a place to eat , some of us were tired so we desided to go in the Movenpick's restaurant, the gentlemen that was working that night was OMG so nice and so professional , kind with everyone , I will go back for sure.

Stayed as party of a large tour. Rooms are spacious, clean, flatscreen tv. Pleased to find kettle and coffee making facilities when we had been told that Moroccan hotels don’t usually provide such items. Food and service were also excellent.

Nice hotel, very well located with a fantastic breakfast. To be highly recommanded for business. Tramway is also very close. The roofbar is very nice. This is truly amazing. Only one bad thing: The hotel is an adept of surbooking. So it happened to me to be "kicked out" of my reservation and placed in an other hotel, much much further. the room are pretty old.

We had the shuttle bus from the airport drive us to the hotel, great driver for about a 45 min of a drive to the hotel. Nice and friendly check in, great staff at this hotel. Very friendly and helpful at the same time. Room was great bed and all very nice however I would recommend having adapters for plugging in our laptops from North America of Europe as a loaner from the front desk. That would be even better customer service, because this hotel had it all. Nicely delivered and I felt very comfortable.

I recently stayed in the Movenpick Hotel Casablanca during a work trip. The hotel itself is lovely and staff are super friendly and happy to help. Breakfast is good, basic and not a huge choice, but what is there is very nice and presented well. The room is great, very big and lovely big bathroom. All clean and i like that they give you the option to not have your bed sheets cleaned every day (to reduce washing/ carbon footprint etc) by just placing a small piece of card provided on the bed. It is still made... just not sheets changed which was fine by me for 3 nights. Location is really good, there is a tram stop literally just outside the station and you can walk to the mosque and ocean in about 30 mins. Close to the high street shops as well which is always handy. The…

This was our first trip to Casablanca. We arrived at the hotel after nearly 24 hours of travel from Canada. The staff were welcoming, helpful, efficient and very attentive to our needs. We ate in two of the restaurants during our two day stay. Again the staff were exceptional, when we wanted to eat in the fine dining restaurant but couldn’t because of a private booking it wasn’t a problem. The staff in the café let us order off the fine dining menu and the cafe menu. The food was excellent, the seating was comfortable and we felt very much at home.

We stayed at the hotel for one night. It’s in the business district of the city, the hotel felt and looked like a descent three star hotel, I think double tree has a better lobby and rooms then this hotel did. There are couple of restaurants close by, also cafe shops. For one night the hotel was adequate.

column3: Great location. Helpful Staff. Wonderful Rooftop View
column4: This hotel has a great location and comfortable rooms. The staff was very helpful and the free parking is a plus. The rooms and hallways were a little tattered but all the plusses of this hotel more than made up for that. The breakfast was extensive and the omlets made to order were a nice surprise. But the rooftop lounge and pool was the highlight of the stay.

We had two nights in Casablanca before heading off for longer periods in Fes and Marrakech and having stayed at Mövenpick hotels in other parts of the world booked two junior suites at the Mövenpick Casablanca. Unfortunately this hotel is such a poor representation of the Mövenpick brand. It’s decor is tired with chipped doors and stained carpets, the non smoking floors smell of smoke, the breakfast is average at best (and be prepared to eat yoghurt with a fork) and the room service and drinks way over-priced. Our junior suites on 14th floor were directly under the pool so all you hear is gurgling - it’s like sleeping inside a fish tank. But what is worse is that the staff are poorly trained, disinterested and often absent! The doormen really can’t be bothered. The concierge…

column3: Great hotel for business travelers or tourists to Casablanca
column4: Great hotel for business travelers or tourists to Casablanca. Rooms were spacious and very clean. Staff were attentive, pleasant, and willing to help with everything. Food from room service was excellent and delivered promptly. This was our first time at a Movenpick hotel. Would stay here again on next visit. Location is great. It’s at a busy center point of Casablanca. 15 min taxi ride to La Corinche, 10 min taxi ride to Hassan II Mosque. There is a light rail line right by the hotel and plenty of taxis nearby. There are two nice coffee shops across the street

We spent a very beautiful time here In the sky of Movenpick Hotel. You should all come by and try their services ... I liked spending time here and making my concert here with my friends and vloggers . Thank you Movenpick

column3: Decent Business Hotel with Great Leisure Amenities
column4: A Classic Movenpick hotel with a bit of North African touch & hospitality thrown in. A great value for money given the creature comforts and amenities the hotel comes with. The Reception area can be a bit congested and crowded but once you are out of it, you will feel fine and comfortable LOCATION: Decent location close to the city center and easy taxi ride away to most attractions and quick accss to the highway to Airport DINE + DRINK: They have a Rooftop bar that is a bit overhyped as it is nothing more than a wannabe swanky lounge falling shot in atmosphere but comes with decent views of the city ROOM: I stayed in 906, so this review is based on that; VIEW: Sweet view of the city; SIZE: Reasonably spacious room; AIR-CON: Typical Air-conditioning you find across Africa,…

This is a fine hotel centrally located in Casablanca: clean, comfortable spacious rooms with good sized baths. The price is very reasonable by European standards, and only a tad expensive by Moroccan. Restaurant buffet food is interesting and diverse. Any given dish may or may not be to your personal taste, but there's always something good to eat. The staff is friendly and speaks French well. Many, though not all, also speak English. I presume Arabic works too though I have no way of judging that. The street noise is a bit excessive, even from high floors; and front desk staff warned us not to drink the tap water; but that's fairly standard for Morocco. I doubt you'll do better elsewhere in Casablanca. So why do I call it disappointing? If the Movenpick had stopped with good…

Recently spent two nights at this fine hotel. Centrally located the room was quite pleasant, modern, clean, with big comfortable bed, pillows and linen. Nice modern bathroom. Towels were a bit disappointing though. Small pool on the 16th floor with nice views. We were on a lower floor with no view. Free WIFI. Just a great place to relax after a long day in Casablanca.

Nice hotel with all the basic enmity including a pool. Although I didn’t use it, it was very inviting. Hotel is 45 minutes from Mohammed International Airport. Hotel was clean, receptionists and staff friendly. It was a good 2 night stay

What you would expect from a hotel is that you can sleep. They hosted us on the second floor when in a first there was a wedding party with percussion instruments and singers that ended 3am. Upon returning from the tour we returned to stay, asked to be allocated on a high floor, at breakfast we took a bowel infection that took us to the hospital on our return. I fainted 4 times on the flight. The facilities are good, but as they know we will not be back so early, they treat the tourist horribly.

The roof top Bar ls very modern with good selections of spirits and food The only remark i had is the service is very poor compare it by the same flagship movenpick in middle east like Dubai . Need more training on customer service

Pros: can’t get enough of their fresh orange juice and fresh pomegranate seeds at breakfast; WIFI is steady and reliable; room was a good size for 2-3 people; 2 comp water bottles per day; there is a bar on the top floor Cons: not close to any walkable tourist attraction; the gigantic Mosque is 30-40 min bus ride away depending on traffic; shower is either too cold or too hot and water temperature fluctuates so drastically several times while in use. Maybe they have a shortage of hair dryers because on 2 separate occasions we had to call front desk for a hair dryer. On our 1st night all the lights were working fine throughout the room but the electrical outlets are not working so we had to call technician who reset the circuit breaker so we can plug our chargers. We…

The hotel services and description is not as advertised on expedia. The hotel is situated on the main road, all far from the tourist areas of interest. The room standard is poor, although the description says iron, kettle, tv provided in the room, this is not true. The tv did not work, there was no kettle in the room although there were tea cups and tea bags, the minibar was completely empty, and there was no iron only the ironing board was provided. The ac did not work, the bathroom extractor did not work. We repeatedly reported these areas to the reception, but nothing was done. When we checked out the reception charged for full stay although we have already paid via expedia. We had to point out that we have already paid for the stay, they also asked if we had anything from…

Visited Casablanca in May and stayed at the Movenpick for two nights. Location was great and the size of rooms spacious. However, the images on the website don’t reflect the reality, hotel was clean but in if refurbishment, definitely overpriced ant not value for money. Good breakfast and roof top with pool offers spectacular views over the city. ❤️Casablanca

we did stay in many 5 star hotel but not realy like that one the hotel is old , so the room are not so nice as like hotel 5 stars the noise , the service too well i think the management must do some work to make the service better and the room as well.

This hotel lacks the basics relating to proper hospitality management. They are ill equipped to deal with large groups and the food is of very low quality. The rooms were dirty on arrival, toiletries half used were strewn everywhere and the mini bars were raided. I would recommend you do not stay at this hotel.

I don’t know how this place has scored those reviews. It’s a shame the movenpick group has put its name to this place. The reception and customer service and the standard of the rooms is just looks with no substance. I have stayed at Club Val de Anfa before and it is by far better than this poor place. I will never stay here please don’t be fooled by the Movenpick sign.

My sister and I made the Mövenpick our “home-base” while exploring the area with a rental car. The valet service is great, the staff is very helpful, and the food is delicious, however, there were a couple of hick-ups: (1) our room was not available on arrival and we were down-graded with to a smaller room and a king sized bed ( we asked for two twins). Our room was available the next day and we were moved. (2) Light bulbs in both rooms were flicking (3) Hot water kettle was broken and it took five attempts to have it replaced (4) Beautiful 16th floor pool environment was diminished by loud, hideous techno music. Overall, it was a nice stay but not equivalent to a 5-star experience.

Thank you. It was a great hotel I strongly recommend. Thank you. You are the best at the top. I recommend it. Wonderful services are available in any time. Excellent cleaning. Here is my personal opinion. You have the right to experiment.

Excellent customer service! Upon check-in we received a complimemtary upgrade! Our room was great and the bed very comfortable - it was the best sleep my husband had during our entire trip. Great rooftop views, I took many aerial shots. Our only critique would be the set up of the pool - it's a little crammed with people facing you as you swim, but we still enjoyed our time in the area - the amazing views made up for this and there is a bar if you are so inclined. We walked about 35 mins to the Corniche area, but the hotel is very close to the old town and souks (which we didnt have time to see). Tram stop outside the hotel and plenty of taxis. We need to mention that ALL staff made our stay phenomenal, reception, concierge, restaurant - but extra special mention to Driss at…

Amazing breakfast,lovely and supportive staff. All food items were good specifically green tomat dish. Fresh fruits, salads and juices are amazing. Restaurant staff is very friendly and supportive. Merci.....

Movenpick is a good hotel and well located. The beds are very comfortable and the shower is very good as well. The team at the restaurant is nice , however, one day the breakfast included omelette and the other nobody showed to prepare any meal . The front desk is very helpful and kind.

My friend and I stayed here for an overnight layover. The staff was really friendly and they have 24-hour room service which was great after arriving late. The breakfast that's included far exceeds any hotel breakfast buffet I've ever seen! They even had fresh juices like beet, carrot, and green juice in addition to the ubiquitous jus d'orange. After a short hang at the pool, I went to the spa for a hammam. The woman who provided my service was so nice and professional and even held my phone for me when I forgot it in a rush to the airport!

Good hotel we stayed for 3 nights in Casablanca. Centrally located and the staff is very helpful. The morning breakfast is good. Rooms are good sizes as well as modern touch. Look forward to going to Casablanca again soon.

One of the worst stays ever in any hotel. Movenpick Casablanca claims to be a 5 star. All doors are broken, water leaking from bathrooms, flooding bathrooms, stinking rooms, stinking passageways, horrible housekeeping, stern and rough reception, very rude and poor quality staff. This is the last and final time ever we have stayed in Movenpick. Our child got locked in the rooms since he doors had broken handles After 30 minutes the housekeeping team came for rescue ! Reflection staff stopped attending to calls inspite of calling 20 tines. The duty manager was extremely bad and arrogant. When I said I shall complain they said DO WHAT YOU WANT ! This is very very bad for any hotel chain.

We are well travelled family of three and having been across four countries in the past 3 weeks we thought we would have a relaxing luxurious end to our travels before heading back to our Abu Dhabi home base. So we booked an executive suite at the Movenpick in Casablanca who advertised the usual extra benefits of spending the addition dollars on executive privileges. Sadly they did not deliver on the basics let alone the expectation of 5 star hotels. The issues: 1: Doorman was to busy smoking, to acknowledge us or even welcome us 2: No functioning executive lounge (see photo’s) 3: Minimal breakfast- one day we had an omelet chef, next day no omelet chef; no bowls; no spoons; no coffee and tea offers… 4: Room service- no answer on the phone for 50…

column3: I 've enjoyed my time here. Good breakfast menu and nice staff.
column4: Very good customer service and especially the breakfast that I 've enjoyed it was nice experience. And the staff are very nice and helpful.looking forward to visit the Movenpick Casa soon.Thank you so much.😍

Very nice buffet specially breakfast . And good staff.like miss hajjer.and mr idrissi 1007/506/201 thank you for the good service.we are so happy to experience such a joy in your hotel we hope to come back again thx

column3:
زيارتي لفندق موفنبيك الدار البيضاء
My visit to Movenpick Casablanca
column4: انني اعمل مديرا لشركه ايكسون موبيل للزيوت والشحوم دائما اسافر الي الدار البيضاء أحب الإقامة فى فندق موفنبيك حيث اشعر أننى وسط عائلتى و يمتاز الفندق بهدوء و الاطعمه المتنوعه التى تناسب جميع الأذواق ذو المذاق الرائع وايضا الغرف الواسعه النظيفه ايضا يمتاز العاملين بالفندق بالابتسامة الدائمة و تقديم العون للضيوف و كل هذه النجاحات بسبب اصرار مدير عام الفندق السيد /عمر القليني للارضاء الضيوف وسعادتهم اتمني لأسره موفنبيك دوام التقدم والنجاح صلاح السكري I'm the chairman of Exxonmobile lubricants and whenever I travel to Casablanca I love to stay in Movenpick because I feel surrounded by my family and this hotel have an advantage of quietness and variety of delicious food that fit all tastes. Also, their rooms are huge and very clean and the workers there are always smiling and…

column3: Good location, nice re-designed bathroom but the service...
column4: I spent 2 nights in the Movenpick for business. Centrally located downtown, we were able to walk to our business meetings without experiencing the petit or grand taxi. Rooms were OK but need some remodeling and refurbishment, except for the bathroom. The problem as other hotels in the region is the level of service: a large number of waiters in the breakfast area discussing among themselves without really paying attention to client needs; a restaurant on the rooftop when you wait forever for the menu: mustard and mayonnaise never came. Obviously could do better ....

Though the room was nice here, the service was pretty average. We arrived there at 12 and hoped to check in early as many hotels, if they have a room available, will give it to you. We were told that if we wished to check in early, it would cost us 600 dirhams. In addition, the housekeeping staff intruded our room at 8am on the day of our check out, whilst we were still in bed. Not impressed.

I just walked out of the breakfast room of this hotel. Wonderful great food, lots of choice and great service. Kindness and smiles are all over this place. Tell them I sent you! Now with a eggs and pancake area with a special chef making great omelets. Might try the pancakes and waffle tomorrow!

column3: Stayed there on our last night as a way to be close to the airport
column4: This is a very nice western style business hotel. The amenities are exactly what you'd expect from a solid business hotel. Very nice rooms - clean and modern with all working amenities. A very professional staff that clearly cater to an international business clientele. The business center works well - very good wifi, etc. My only complaint is that the restaurants are super expensive and definitely not worth it. Very bland and boring food. Walk a couple of blocks and eat elsewhere. This is not a fun or interesting place for a vacation vibe. It's no nonsense, high-end business - and it does that very well.

If you are on a business travel, this hotel is perfect. The location is good. The tram station is just in front of the hotel. There are always taxis and they offer you to arrange you a taxi if you want. The staff is really polite. But if you are a tourist, you are on wrong place.

I only stayed one night, so I didn't get to experience some of the attractive amenities such as the roof top pool/bar. The room was quite comfortable and the staff was helpful. Best of all was the restaurant on the lower level of the hotel. The dinner was the best I had during my entire 12 day trip.

I am on a business trip for a week, the people are very friendly, the food is great, and the rooms are very comfortable and quiet, there are many nearby restaurant that are a walking distance from the hotel, everything you can all for in a hotel for an enjoyable stay.

Not the best hotel experience - roof top pool/bar area definitely the best part with such an amazing view over the city! Me and my boyfriend visited 5 days last month. The service was ok (neither slow or quick) but it was always an item missing when we ordered food/drinks, no joke every single time - however this could of course be a language barrier. The location however was brilliant as its a walking distance to most tourist attractions in the city. I also forgot an item in the room, in which we emailed the hotel about but never heard back unfortunately. Otherwise friendly staff and nice rooms + good room service.

My husband and I booked the Movenpick for the last night of our honeymoon. We were looking forward to a relaxing evening before an early flight the next morning. After taking a cab from the train station, we arrived at the front desk where we were informed that the hotel was overbooked and our room was unavailable. Keep in mind that we had already booked and prepaid our stay THREE MONTHS in advance. The gentleman at the front desk was incredibly rude when I pushed back, even raising his voice at me. He then informed us that a Movenpick staffer would drive us “5 minutes” to a different hotel that would accommodate us. This was all after we had been traveling from Marrakech for several hours and were exhausted, and had already paid a cab to Movenpick. Well, after more like 20…

I often stay here and the breakfast is very good - the only advise i give if you want to have a full range of dishes available you should go after 7h30 a.m before that let’s say some missing will be :) but overall 👍🏼

This is the fifth hotel to try in casablanca during the last nine months, finally i found a comfortable stay, clean hotel, welcoming staff, satisfying breakfast. I highly recommend this hotel to feel the sense of Casablanca

The most unpleasant staffs service out of all Morocco! After a long trip. We checked in the hotel at 1.30 pm, the first in welcome greet from the staffs was"check in time at 3 pm! " Not at least a comfort words to say maybe we will check and get back to you or anything. We sat and wait till spot on 3 pm. Second..we asked for help from the concierge to get us a taxi to Quartier Habbous which is 7 mins by car. The guys talked to the taxi drivers in Arabic without knowing that we understand. We asked for help as we assumed the driver speaks French. Taxi driver told him 30 Durhams and the concierge guy say make it 50 Durhams and he can have 20 Durhams for himself. Just before we leaving. We just asked at the horrible reception again if they have any small changes for us to…

column3: Beautiful Hotel Complex With Some Service Concerns
column4: The Movenpick Is a very large conference / convention hotel. The location is great and the overall ambience is pleasant and quite impressive. Our room was large, pretty and had a serene feel to it. There was a welcoming balcony as well. The food was the best that we had had in Morocco. Although the staff was nice and plentiful, at times they were nowhere to be found. Overall, this is a fine place to stay in this magnificent city.

We were in the hotel during Ramadan. The hotel had closed all three of their eating facilities to guests that we staying at the hotel. After complaining and venturing around the hotel for thirty minutes to find somewhere to eat. We were forced to eat off an appetizer menu in the business center.When you are in a country where you don't speak the local language you stay at hotels and rely on their services because you might not want to venture out by yourself. This was a total disgrace to the Movenpick brand name and I will never stay at another one in my life.

When we booked breakfast was included but it was not. we had to pay extra for it. It was good but a little sour after the "mixup". Service was poor to average with lots of staff but no organization at all.

column3: Mixed Thoughts - Clean and Close to centre but...
column4: We were satisfied with our stays at the Movenpick, but not overwhelmed. Maybe we were expecting too much. The biggest plus is location. It is not far from the city centre and most major sights, and right beside the tram line. Location is definitely an advantage. The rooms were variable. It seems like perhaps they are going through renovation. We had rooms on two different floors on each occasion. A couple of the floors were nice and the rooms were good. Other floors seemed rundown and in desperate need of repair. One floor was positively icky. If they are in the midst of renovation, be sure to ask for the newly renovated floors. There is a very nice rooftop deck with a small pool. Drinks were predictably expensive but it's a rooftop bar in a western-style hotel so we pretty…

The hotel was fine itself but upon check in they told us we were upgraded free of charge and breakfast was now included. I had confirmed the breakfast was free since our original booking did not have that. The receptionist had reassured with the upgrade it was. Next morning we have breakfast (definitely not even worth it) and they charge us 400 and tell us we were making it up. Reading previous reviews it seems like they scam people all the time with the free breaskfast and then end up charging everyone. Biggest scammers in casablanca. Choose another hotel as this one scams you and you can’t even feel safe.

Really have an excellent service, but my room with no good view and no smoking areas and air conditions not working But all in all is very good and good place at center of the city and excellent staff atitude

An excellent service and awsome staff Big spaces room and an excellent pianist player with winderful restaurant with diffirent types of breakfast . Help in place and airport pickup service is nice . .

We’ve spend a night booked by our agent which included a meal and a breakfast. To our disappointment we found out that the groups were placed at the old rooms , not the renovated ones. Our room no:302 was quite spacious though with lots of amenities but the materials are old and tired. The biggest shenanigan was kept in the breakfast. Although we were informed that all meals are taking place at a large hall in the ground floor, next morning we were guided to the first floor, where the so call breakfast buffet was offered far less products and quality than the one in the ground floor. There wasn’t even honey or scrambled eggs a bare necessity even in a two star hotels. So be aware group travelers, choose carefully or deal better with your agent.

It’s not 5 star and the rooms are dark and in need of updating. The ONLY positive is the SMALL rooftop pool and bar. Stay elsewhere. There is also a sewage smell in the rooms and halls. It’s covered with fragrance in the public areas.

Decent hotel in the modern section of the business city. Room was spacey enough, with a king size bed with good mattress, a desk and a comfortable couch; well functioning air condition, free WiFi. Rich tasty breakfast-dinner buffets, local-plus-international; friendly stuff! Gratuitous bottles of water were just what needed best on arrival!! Thank you!

column3: Very good hotel close to the center
column4: Don't let the outside of the hotel confuse you. The hotel is good. The rooms are big (at least the one I had) and the bed is comfortable. Different pillow choices which is always a good point. Water and toilett amenities also provided of reasonable quality. The breakfast is very good and there is a gym open 24h which is also a plus. Nice rooftop terrace with bar and small swimming pool for the summer. I would come back again for sure.

hotel is located in the central business district-you will need a car or cab to get places. expensive by morocco standards. the room was noisy and stuffy. the toilet was unflushed when we arrived and stank. front desk staff were pleasant. breakfast was overpriced. I am sure there are better choices.

I booked my stay through the hotel website and had taken the early check in option. However when we reached the hotel they didn't have the room ready, you can assume the frustration of not having a room after a 8+ hour long flight. Having said that, the reception staff who was initially 'cold' did upgrade my stay in to a two bedroom apartment. The apartment itself was nice, no real view as it faces the building next to it. Room service menu was pretty limited in choice. They have nice little bar by the pool on the rooftop, again decent nothing great. In all it is a decent place to stay, they have a car park next to the hotel so if you decide to hire a car this could be a plus.

I tried the breakfast buffet. Good breakfast. Everything was fresh and the coffee was really good. Everything was well preapared. The staff service was great and very pleasant. I received many coffees services. Very clean hotel!

column3: Always love coming to this hotel!
column4: My boyfriend and I love coming to this hotel. The rooms are mini suites and modern. The food is great, either in the restaurant or room service. The pool area on the rooftop offers an outstanding view of Casablanca. The cleaning staff are always very nice and do a great job replenishing our room. We always feel very comfortable and happy to come back. Special thank you to Khalid and his team at the breakfast restaurant who always take such good care of us and offer amazing food, to the guest service manager who is always there to greet us when we arrive and to the cleaning staff Fouzia, Soumia and everyone in their team who clean our rooms very well and are so friendly. Thank you all for taking great care of us!

column3: A very good hotel with great breakfast
column4: I stayed in Movenpick Casablanca for a business trip in Casablanca and I have to say that it was a very pleasant stay. The staff are nice and friendly, the room was spacious, clean and relaxing. Wi-Fi in the hotel is very good and reliable which was a great thing for me. The breakfast in particular was great with a lot of varieties and amazing staff who are willing to always help you with a smile, specially Khalid who is a very decent and welcoming person as well.

Very nice place to spend time for your holidays and work. The pleople are so nice and available. Very good atmosphere for breakfast restaurant and the bar at the last floor. The guys at the bar are funny and very kind they are very lovely. Really racommanded for cocktails and food.

The hotel itself is great. Breakfast its so good. You can find everything you want. Fruit, meat, eggs, bread, sweet, juices, coffee, teas...and a plenty of varieties so you can actually feel like you are at home. The personal working is so kind. Its my second time in this hotel and the waitress just give me the coffee without asking what i want. Thanks to all staff on the hotel!

column3: Nice hotel with excellent service minded staff!
column4: The rooms are big and the facilities of the hotel are great with a beautiful roof terrace and a well equipped gym. However, the most outstanding experience of my stay here has been the super friendly and very service minded staff, especially at the breakfast buffet. The buffet has a good choice of different dishes and the staff always meets the guests with a very personal and warm welcoming. I've had a great and comfortable stay at Movenpick hotel and would definitely recommend it.

The hotel gave us an ineffective room key. We went back to the reception to check and finally could go in; however, the room they gave us had already occupied with someone else, we could see the ocuppant's luggage and belongings. We went back to the reception and asked for someone to accompany us to check. The hotel refused. Bad experience.

column3: Amazing service during breakfast and nice staff in the restaurant !! Recommended
column4: The staff are very cheerful and helpful, Mr Khalid represented a high standard of welcoming the guests with his smile and approachable attitude.l will come back again and i will recommend to my friends also. Recommended Amina Thank you

Great location, polite and helpful staff. One big let down is the slow service in all the restaurant. The bar on the 16th floor is great to relax and enjoy the view but the service was awful. The concierge guys are very attentive and couldn't be any better.

Nice and clean, with great dinning place and pool. New, comfortable. The location is ok. Not too far away from the airport..⊂^j^⊃ 换中文吧。万一能帮到同胞。。。。哈哈哈。酒店挺好的，是连锁，想着上次在其他地方住过的体验不错，所以这次直接定了这里. 算是当地的五星，感觉算是国内四星的标准吧。但是比较干净，不陈旧，还是不错的昂

column3: Good hotel. Breakfast one of the best.
column4: I enjoyed my 4 day stay and would like to return again. I found the hotel staff fairly polite and helpful and the room was very clean. Except for the shower which I found abit small with little space to move.

Cleaning well done! Thanks Sofia! Nice hotel and superb topfloor terrace with a pol and lounge seats! Fine food at the casablanca café! Unfortunately traffic makes sleeping hard as the maroccons have a habit of honking there horns, the window blinds are also not very dark adding to the uncomfortness!

We were a group of 12 from sri Lanka business men, i specially enjoyed the buffet with red meat, ANAS really doing a good job in the morning with smiling face at buffet , and the wellcome guy" big daddy" always greets me by my name and i like it , i wish i would get a chance to visit again Casablanca in near future,

Very well located business hotel. The staff are very friendly and efficient. Reception staff very professional and give a warm welcome. A special mention to Fatima Akci and Salem who gave me an upgrade.

This hotel would be OK if it was advertised as a high 3* or a low 4* but to call it 5* is delusional. The worst issue is the breakfast. A poor choice, badly cooked and lukewarm. I arrived as a large Chinese tour group had fully depleted the limited breakfast buffet and the staff were unable to replenish it promptly. There was virtually no food, no coffee, no milk, no plates, etc. If the buffet had been of suitable 5* quality to begin with, the tour group could have been easily accommodated without leading to problems for other guests. But the buffet is so far below expectations, there is no way it could cope. The management here need to visit other 5* hotels in the region to find out how it should be done. I notice the manager responded to a previous complaint with a…

This hotel is really confy. Lot of space in the room and clean. Breakfast and food are good. Thank's to Idrissy who reserved to me and my friend a very good welcome in his restaurant and give us good advises. Thank's to all the staff, everybody was sympathic

This Hotel does not have a enough parking space in the front and it is located on a busy street corner. I was traveling with a group, and we were ready to board our bus heading for the airport but we could not do it because there was another bus parked on the only space available, the driver did not want to move his bus, no matter what.
