We were outside for 45 minutes while the two bus drivers were arguing, Finally We have to move out all of our suitcases out to the street and wait outside in the middle of a very cold morning for our bus, we even have to argued with the police so we could board our bus, it was a very bizarre situation, The manager of the Hotel did want to help us, He could request the driver of the other bus to move it out since it was on the Hotel property,…

I would like to recommend this hotel for anyone who would like to see the hospitality in its right way I would like to thank all the staff for their professional attitude and great support for their guests Everything was perfect starting from reservation, front office ,concierge, bellmen , restaurants , banquette,room service and Cafe Special thanks to Mrs.Maria (corporate Sales director ) Also my great appreciation and thanks to : Ms Mounia (sales) Mr Tarek (Reservation) Khalid , Said , Edris ,Mourad & Hajar from Restaurants Casablanca Sayed (ground 16 floor ) Jalila , Fatima Alzahraa,Fatima Alzahra , Najwa ,Salem &Hamza ( The great front office staff) Jamil ,Moustafa and the other helpful concierge Staff Finally Mr.Amr ( Hotel director ) Regards ,

column3: Good hotel, a bit noisy, beware of scammers
column4: Stayed in the hotel for one night. The staff at the check in counter spoke English and was helpful. The hotel is located at a busy intersection with a lot of car traffic, but we were on a high floor so the noise from the street didn't bother us. What bothered was the noise coming from the 16th floor (we were on the 14th floor). The hotel has a lounge/restaurant located on the 16th floor so I suspect that was the source of the noise. Entire night we could hear sounds of people moving things or rolling things around on the floor above us. Needless to say I didn't get a good sleep. Be mindful there are some shady characters in the area trying to take advantage of the tourists, so don't accept anyone's unsolicited help.

Stayed there for a 4 day-workshop. Staff was very professional, and rooms clean and nice. TV however didn't have interesting channels...not a problem though :) The top roof terrace is nice and offers a beautiful view on the city. The hotel is very central but has no parking; I had to leave my car in the street, which was a bit annoying due to the absence of security at night The restaurant was nice, and staff helpful, but the food was 300% bad and not always fresh: potatoes from the day before, hair found in my plate twice which means people in the kitchen were not wearing caps, not enough food for everbody; we happened to enter the restaurant and find empty containers and we didn't have time to wait until they were refilled, lunch was always cold, fruits were not fresh...…

An exelent hotel with an amazing pool in the roof top, the rooms was clean and spaced . Even the location was very good. And the personnel was very welcoming specially concierge service (Jamil was so helpfull ) . I had an amazing experiens and I will advics my friends to visit it .

Dirt everywhere. Our bathroom was broken and dirty. Poor buffet and breakfast with bad food quality. Not friendly stuff. This is not even 2* hotel. Very expensive and nothing to offer. Never ever again

The hotel looks pretty old! The Junior Suite was spacious for 3 persons so ad the toilet. I'm happy that they prepared whatever I asked on the email I sent before arriving. The breakfast choice was limited. For the service part, I commend them for assisting us when we arrived but the thing was I sent them numerous email regarding my upcoming stay but they won't reply and acknoweldge that they read my email. Even before I book the room I already had problem with them not responding to my email which was really frustrating but still I decided to book with them. Lastly, good job to them for making our stay pleasant or I don't know maybe because of my numerous complaint even before arriving that's why they're so attentive to our needs during our stay.

Not as expected for a 5 stars hotel as our room was locked and poor efforts were made to compensate. The design is very old and several equipments did not work properly: safe, missing iron and broken mirror. Never again.

column3: Great rooms and good location but poor Staff service
column4: POSITIVES: - WiFi was strong and did not need any password - Good location - Room and reception smelt lush with aromatic fragrance, beds and pillows were super comfy and was spotlessly clean NEGATIVES: - Concierge was rude and kept on hard selling his "taxi friends" to use their taxi leaving us with "no choice". Also the concierge failed to inform the taxi driver on the right location (we were supposed to go to Basmane restaurant which the concierge booked for us that day, but told the taxi driver to Le Petite Rocher restaurant instead) so we ended up at the wrong restaurant - Hotel had a money exchange service at reception. However they did not even have sufficient money to exchange our money from Pounds Sterling to Moroccan Dirhams, and said the smallest change they had to…

Nearly impossible to pull in or make use of the valet. The portico in front of the hotel fits precisely two cars. Hotel is dated, dark and dank. If that weren't bad enough, it is ridiculously overpriced for what it is; and we purportedly got a corporate rate. Stay clear.

We stayed at this hotel as part of our tour group. It was the best hotel out of the lot we stayed whilst on tour. The hotel is modern with a roof top bar and pool overlooking the city. Food was on point as well as the service. We were able to catch a cab outside the hotel with no hassles to get around. Would definitely recommend and revisit.

Very bad Room Service and Food Quality. All of us got sick next day. Even kids could not eat the food that was served. One it was late, second it was smelling and stale. You all cannot even make a Pizza right - our groups order was easily more than 2000 MAD - so significant - almost all of it was discarded and thrown away.

The hotel is in one of the busiest and top locations in town, but traffic is going to be your enemy. Comfort is there, and staff welcoming. Rooms could be a little cleaner though: our floor smelled "bad" for 4 days (our whole stay). Don't choose breakfast: overpriced, as quality is average and the room is always crowded.

The room was clean and spaced. the hotel location was very good. and the personnel was very welcoming. I had struggled a little bit with the pillow and the street noise. but the experience was overall excellent.

We stayed 6 nights in this hotel, nice location, comfortable and spacious rooms, friendly staff. We enjoyed our stay as the hotel provided necessary amenities and services we need during our stay in Casablanca. The breakfast needs an improvement in terms of variety and quality of items offered. But staff are very attentive and ready to help and assist guests when needed. The 16 lounge is a great place for gathering and enjoying music, watching football match and enjoy freshly prepared food. We recommend this hotel for family or business travelers Thank you Movenpick management and staff for making our staff enjoyable and comfortable. Special thanks to: Front desk: Laila, Oumaima Housekeeping: Naima, Fatima zohra

the location of the hotel is good, around 10 mins from the train station. we arrived at 245pm, not sure is it a strict check in policy or what , it took us 30 mins to get the room key, I have expressed to the reception that I'm not feeling well due to the long flight and still nothing has been done. later we got into the room and had a quick shoeer, realised the hair dryer is missing hence I gave the reception a call. the woman was reluctant to help and she only said the housekeeper will come later, and yet the housekeeper never came. we were having jet lagged so we really can't be bothered to call the reception again. the breakfast is really good though, lots of bread choices and they served breakfast starting from 6am, good news for those who is having jet lagged ! the room…

We stayed there for 2 weeks. Location is good. Next to tram line, 2 stops away from medina. Tram will also take you directly to the beach. Some good restaurants just few minutes away (walking distance) from the hotel. We had excellent service for which special thanks go to wonderful ladies Ghizlane and Fouzia. Room standard is OK. Very comfortable beds. From things to improve - breakfast. Very good roof SPA service, outdoor pool and restaurant. Overall a good stay.

This is a very good hotel in Casablanca. The location is good.Quite a few cafes around. The rooms are good and clean.The housekeeping is excellent.The ambience very good.The concierge is excellent. A good hotel to stay.

At all fantastic anf very very good staff Service On time Body language Etc I hope to thank every one Every one read my words now is signed by my thanks And follow up from reception team and service Regards

It was a nice hotel but not in a good location. The buffet breakfast would have cost 20 euros per person. We walked across the street and had a good breakfast for much less at a place called?? Red Cafe or ??. The hotel was not close to the train station. We stayed three nights in Morocco (Casablanca - Marrakech - Casablanca). If I were to spend three nights again I would skip Casablanca. It was a very big city with little charm. I liked the movie much better than the city! We used Roundtrip for Hotels in Casablanca to get to and from the airport. According to the hotel staff, it would have been cheaper to use taxis.

column3: Friendly business hotel of international standard
column4: I really appreciated the frielndiness of the staff, the location, the room in itself, though it is a little bit noisy... but that's Casablanca! The Spa is excellent (massages, gommages etc): good value for price. Concièrge services could be better, specially concerning restaurant adresses etc. The business rooms are good. Everything is very clean. However, it was a little bit cold in the lobby and common spaces (draft air), doors were often open. Overall a good experience! I recommend!

The rooftop bar at the swimming pool is an amazing place to be. It is quite unique with exquisite food, good services and a great DJ that is offering great music. The whole hotel is quite pleasant and a place to be.

i like to mention that the service in the restaurant was one of my best experience in the hotel, the breakfast and lunch were amazing, the excellent customer service from the team in the restaurant was amazing and made all of us feel important.

Second time in Casablanca, this time I stayed for 18 nights on business, and decided to try this hotel. I have a very big concern with the breakfast experience, it was very bad specially in terms of service. other than that everything was OK.

We just had an amazing experience in this hotel during this week. The food is perfect, the staff is awasome and makes you come to live the Movenpick experience. Thanks to everyone, especially the guys in Conciergerie....You guys are the very best !!

Let's start by saying if you were thinking about staying here, PLEASE think again. I don't think it's much to expect a double occupancy room to have a bathroom door that I can close without having to wrestle with. It would also be nice to have two bathrobes and not one. Breakfast looks quite nice on the face of it. However, once we sat there was nothing nice about it. Fried eggs were burnt from one side and raw from the other (definitely not what i asked for), pastry was from the night before at best. Had to share salt and pepper with one other table because there wasn't any more of that. Asked for a spoon the moment I sat down and did not get one at all.. Below par service appears to be a theme at the hotel. I asked for an electricity adapted several times (each time being…

The hotel is clean. I had no complaints regarding my room. It was very good. Spacious with king bed. Others who are with me on this business trip had complained about sewage smell in their rooms or very small rooms. Luckily I didn’t. Casablanca in general has “apparently” sewage infrastructure problems. Walking in the streets means you have to smell sewage all the time. The food was just ok @ the Movenpick ... nothing extra. Very friendly staff. Location is close to everything (1 minute from tram, half an hour waking from trains station, and Marrakesh gate... half an hour by taxi from the airport)

Professional and courteous service, large clean and comfortable room with all the amenities. A first time traveler to Casablanca will appreciate this oasis of calm in the middle of a bustling city. Service is professional and we had some very good experiences with the staff. Remember to tip at least 20 MAD for the people who handle your luggage or park your car and you will be set for a wonderful stay.

thanks Manal for your great and professional house keeping services. I was really fascinated with the way she handles guests all the time she comes in for her services. hope to come for an other stay based on the good services I received during my first stay

I stayed at the Movenpick back in September, and had a really wonderful experience with one of the staff members at the Movenpick in Casablanca. Badr was our server up at the rooftop pool and patio, and he took such good care of us. He was very attentive and welcoming to not only the hotel but also to his country, and even shared the beautiful story of Fatima's Hand with me. Thank you, Badr, for sharing your culture and for making us feel at home in a new country. The Movenpick and it's customers are lucky to have you on staff!

The hotel is above average, but not at par with the Movenpick name. The location is great, lots of things around. Rooms are awkward and the furniture is old. Breakfast is rather poor, although the service is OK. I would go back if used just for sleeping.

The hotel is situated near the public market, tram and most businesses. The food is good! Room service was fast pleasant. Pool on the top of the hotel is my favourite but during off seasons it’s used to cater to conventions and meeting groups. I’m left to eat in my room or venture out. Hotel itself has old shag carpeting which smells.. I’m surprised the Moevenpick group allows that to happen.. Otherwise it’s it’s a nice place to stay.

column3: Nice and Convenient Western Style lodging in Casa
column4: Before we moved into the Riad type of lodging experience in Morocco we decided to check into a western type hotel. The rooms are very specious and clean and they have some energy savings options: when you leave your room all lights go off.

AWESOME ! This was my third visit to Casablanca this year (2017) and I must say all was great at Movenpick Hotel !!! But I will like to give special thanks to Fouzia in house cleaning. She is sooo pleasant / professional and with great spirit. Always smiling and ready to serve. Thanks Fouzia for all... I will never forget you -Ali Bashir

column3: Booked A Triple Room but got. Double
column4: Triple was Double Room, brought in a narrow cot for an adult. All room aminities were five two. Doorman couldn’t taxi. Service in restaurant didn’t have the printed menus. Had to leave to another one in hotel but Services were robatic not Friendly.

Hotel and rooms are nice. The rooftop pool is nice, but not many lounge chairs - the view of the city is amazing. The hotel is not near the tourist sights, and it's not really a walking city. Spa experience wasn't great.

Avoid this hotel, not well kept, not well equipped to checkin, very sorry rooms. Sink and shower drained trickling down. Hornets mud nest on top of the bed on the ceiling on the fire alarm. Painfully slow and chaotic checkin.

For short business trip this hotel was perfect, especially it was very close to our offices. The lobby and reception are small but I liked the room size and design. The breakfast was below expectation with very poor service, maybe due to the number of visitors the hotel had when we visited. But in general it was good choice for a short business trip.

Stayed in this hotel for an evening before catching a flight to Lisbon. Nice poolside bar in the rooftop, and room service was good enough. I am not sure I would return to Casablanca, but if I were to I would certainly consider staying here again.

Stay at your hotel was mediocore . Breakfast buffet was poor. However, bed was comfortable. Front desk staff was not guest friendly. Bathroom was adequate., Do not think I would recommend your hotel too highly. Thank you

Not recommended for any type of stay.. The hotel is in a very busy and noisy cross road. Pros: friendly staff, beds were clean and AC worked. Cons: it took 15-20 min to check in which caused chaotic situation with some people with local guides trying to cut in; Sink and bath tub drained very slowly (10 & 20 min). Hotel claims to offer airport shuttle but told us to take a cab; discovered a hornets nest on top of the bed in the morning!!!!

We had a confirmed booking in this hotel and had got it reconfirmed in the afternoon. At the time of checking in the front desk told us , after taking copies of our passport and other details, that for some technical reason they are not able to check us in and that they are moving us to a different hotel. I don't think there was any technical difficulties for they did check in 2 other guests. I think they were overbooked. Looks like we were not the first to experience this. I just saw another review in Expedia who had the same experience. Front desk staff was very indifferent and were not even sorry for the inconvenience caused. The hotel that they moved us into was ok. At the time of checking in the front desk in the new hotel asked for our credit card for room rent. When we…

It is a well located hotel in the centre of the city. The parking is very difficult in front of the building. The pool is smaller, than we expected (from the pictuures). The staff is very polite and helpful, teh breakfast is OK.

It looks beautiful from inside and the staff is nice. However, the English skills should be improved. The receptionists ran out of cash, when some of my colleagues wanted to exchange money. The painting on furniture of the rooms is rather old and in some places is missing. The breakfast is good with much assortment.

was only for 2 nights but it feels like home, as first impression when we get in! every body welcome u, its very clean Hotel and the Employees are sooooo friendly specially the Skybar, were so active and always around to serve u with a pleasure plus the music was fantastic 😀 i will recommend it to everyone will visit Casablanca ! really best quality of service. ill be back soon again 👍👍

I stayed at this hotel for one night and although I encountered some issues with my room, the staff was good to resolve. The quality of the breakfast and variety of food was poor and the service was lacking. Had a minor issue with ants in the room (by the window) which I did not report since I was only staying for one night and because I had little time to do so during my stay.

Value is decent. It's pretty clean and rooms are updated. However, the service is very poor. It required a lot of time for basic requests- which were not fulfilled at times. Checking in took forever. Also, the food is not necessarily recommended either.

Movenpick was the worst hotel I stayed in during my vacation in Morocco. Food was surprisingly bad for a 5 star hotel and some of the staff looked tired and disinterested. I got in quite late and we ended up ordering room service. The food we ordered were salty and lukewarm and basically the worst food I had in Morocco. There was a big Chinese tour group during my stay and when I went down for breakfast at 8:30am, most of the food was gone and tables were uncleared. Room was big and clean but this is the only good thing I can say about the hotel. My advice - don't stay in Movenpick

column3: Bad service, unbelievable it is Movenpick Standard
column4: I and my family have booked this hotel via a travel club. We have 60 rooms total. Our group of 17 pax with 9 rooms are arrived first at 1 pm. I have asked for 3 couple near by rooms (2 rooms near by each other for 3 families). The receptionist said the hotel is fully booked. We went out for lunch and we're back at 3 pm. They asked us to wait until 4 pm, we got the room key which shocked me. The service in this hotel is very bad when I have asked for anything house keeping, never come? Today I have asked 3 hot water in the bowls, I need to ask from 3 different waiters. And took more than 10 min. Last waiter just gave 3 empty bowls with rough action which made bowls drop from the bar. When our tour leader talked to the last waiter, he said too many guests. I told him that it is…

The hotel is perfect: clean, full of nice details, well placed. They had a very nice gesture with us as they upgraded our room because it was our wedding. Awesome breakfasts! Going to the roof top is super pleasant. Awesome memories for me there. Fully recommended.

column3: Service with a twist - no service
column4: The overall service was so poor I wouldn’t stop here if I was homeless. The staff approach was negative, poor communication and staff were rude and argumentative on reception. The breakfast was appalling, lack of choice, staff were half asleep. If your desperate give this hotel a go. This is not what you expect. This hotel group in other countries is great. Local staff mentally around customer service centres on rudeness.

Overall it was the staff that set the hotel apart. It is a little dated, but clean and professional. The food and service was fantastic. One thing I'd say is missing from a top notch hotel from the room side is there are no USB power ports anywhere. If that's the worst I can say about my stay then it was really pretty good.

column3: Terrible service such a rip off!
column4: We booked this hotel for our first night in Morocco, but instead, the front desk told us that the hotel was oversold and he had to place us at another hotel nearby. We refused but there was nothing he could do since we were the last to arrive. It was an extremely long day for us coming all the way from NY. We did not understand why he had to take our passport if the hotel was oversold. We booked this room very early so we had a good rate and I think they thought the price was low, so he rathered put us in another hotel that he can make more in their own instead. He later offered us free breakfast and transportation back to their hotel. Even though we did not really want that, but that was the best they could do. We left unwillingly and were forced to stay in a so called…

column3: DO NOT BOOK! AWFUL! SMUG, POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE!
column4: I apologise for the lack of syntax in the review below as I've written it just after it occured! Believe it or not, I have a degree in English! After an 8.5hr drive from Ait Ben Haddou, we arrived at the Movenpick Hotel at 745pm to check in, just in time for our 8pm hammam & massage. The check in guy, Ahmed took our passports and returned them with the news that our booking had been changed and they would be moving us to another hotel. First of all, I was dumb founded as to how this happened. Ahmed, glibly told me that they had a technical problem, I said, What do you mean technical? He repeated, we have a technical problem! Uh? He certainly missed the training session on customer recovery and stared at me with a glib smirk! I asked to speak to the manager and was told that…

Some little issues with the room reserved (bed size or TV down) but managed quickly by the staff... and i was finally upgraded to a Suite. Very good moments there ! You should try Maroccan Restaurant (-1 floor) but eat before the music show if you want to discuss with your friends ;) Then i recommend a last drink on the rooftop Bar. Great.

Ideal location for business, very nice and helpful staff, lovely maroccain cakes for breakfast (but with the help of mr. Idrissi and mr. Badr you can get them at dinner as well!!!) We always choose Movenpick when traveling to Casablanca, so well done and thanks

I have decided to review this hotel as I go along. After a long journey we were checked in swiftly and our bags were taken to our room swiftly...much appriciated... but I belive the special request was missed...but overall so far it's good...I'll update it day by day or event by event...thank you

Our stay at the Movenpick Casablanca was wonderful! The staff are all super kind and helpful. Our room was spotless and so comfy and spacious. We had the yummiest dinner at the hotel. Our waiter was Badar. He welcomed us and gave us the best service we could ask for. He was wonderful. The food was super delicious! All in all our nights stay was great.

I can tell u that was the best hotel I've ever stayed in property of all the hotel my room was amazing, the view of from the 16th floor just waw!!! I was touched by the professionalism of the stuff especially Wafae at the housekeeping manager she solved my little problem in 30 mints I advice this hotel for sure Hope to visite this place soon

We stayed here our first night in Morocco to get acclimated. It's a good size hotel with high quality standard features. Valet parking made getting in easier. Rooms are comfortable and clean. Good location in the middle of the city.

Arrived at 8am and they had our rooms ready. Was only here for one night on a tour of Morocco. The breakfast was rough. I scraped together some breads with butter and a chicken dish that looked like it should have been for dinner. The location was good and the pool bar on the 16th floor was pretty cool. I would probably try another hotel if I visited Casablanca again. Staff were really nice.

Check in at the Movenpick was quick and easy, we were greeted kindly. I had booked a room with a great view of the city as I was celebrating a milestone birthday. We were placed on the 6th floor and the view not so great. The room - the room was okay, nothing over the top great, there are some lipstick and mascara mistakes but not anything really bad. The bed - one word "great". The windows cannot be opened and there are two sets of windows (rather disappointing) The bathroom - clean no real issues except when you have a shower, it is open concept and a lot of the shower water lands up on the floor. The really nice thing about this hotel - The 16th floor (the roof) is amazing, the pool is beautiful and clean and the view of the city is exceptional. The buffet - not…

As always, nice hotel to stay at for business. Great personnel, perfect location. I Always enjoy having on beer on the top floor. Looking forward to my next visit in Casablanca. All it needs is a more reliable airco in the rooms.

Stayed at hotel prior to joining a group tour. The rooms were spacious and clean. The pool area was very relaxing! I mostly stayed in the hotel to adjust to jet lag so do not know much about the area surrounding hotel.

Nice hotel. I am a regular at the bar on the 16th floor, great view of Casa, nice rooftop swimming pool, great service, Said, Khaled and the rest of the team are amazing hosts, always a delight! Thanks guys

The hotel itself is great. The rooms are modern, clean, big enough, the AC works fine and mine had a nice view. They are also equipped with an iron and a mini bar, unfortunately a hair dryer was missing. There is also a WIFI network available which worked fine. Check in and out procedures were unproblematic and quick. It is located in the center of the city so the major sights of Casablanca are easily reachable by foot. The personnell at the reception was also nice and helpful, they recommended an excellent authentic Moroccan restaurant and helped us planning our one day trip from Casablanca to Rabat by taxi. The rooftop bar and pool on the 16th floor with an awesome view over the city itself is pretty nice and stylish. It was one of the main reasons we chose this hotel. The…

Good sized rooms. Older style hotel. Good housekeeping. Breakfast - good variety. Really good staff - attentive with tea, coffee, plate clearing. Rooftop bar - 'club vibe' - picturesque at night time. Plenty of cafe style seating poolside. Bar service a little slow. Helpful concierge staff. Tram at the front door to take you to the beach or downtown. Small convenience store opposite which sell cold beer which is uncommon in Morocco. Great Argentinian restaurant nearby a must!

Take care with your belongings, you can't leave it alone not even for one hour in the room (sunglass disappeared after staff cleaned the room when my father was taking his breakfest). Really sad to have such experience!

column3: A bit expensive for what it is
column4: Service at reception could be better, more enthusiastic. Staff at the pool bar did not acknowledge us in 15 minutes, after which we had to go and get the cocktail menu ourselves. Also, it is a shame that the windows at the pool level were filthy. Although Casablanca does not particularly offer a breathtaking view, it would still be nice to look outside through clean windows. I received a wax treatment at the spa, it was excellent, I never had it made so well. However if I was concerned by my privacy I would have been horrified, during the time I was getting waxed( including full Brazilian) 2 other members of staff came in the room without warning, and the treatment was made half by one, half by another one. They were both very nice and efficient, but I just think they should…

I had traveled to Casablanca in July'17 for business meetings and had booked this hotel as it was in the core of the city around 25-20kms away from my office. Idea behind booking a hotel away from the office was to get a chance to explore the city while travelling to and from office and then stop by interesting places on the way back :). I stayed in this hotel for 12 days... the rooms were very clean, service was good. The best thing that i liked was the room was pretty silent given that the hotel is on the main road junction where you have at least 6-7 roads meeting which means lot of vehicles + trams passing every 5-10 minutes. Breakfast was included in my stay package and the food quality was good. Connectivity and access to transport options (Tram just 50mtrs, Taxis - just…

International Name Ugly Lobby Ugly Rooms Ugly Facilities The furniture is super Old. Nothing nice in the Hotel except for it's Swiss name. I'm sure I'm not the only one to write negatively about them.

As a brand new visitor to Morocco I formed my first impression of Moroccan hospitality at this hotel. Everyone was very helpful and professional and ensured a comfortable and enjoyable stay. A very special thank you to Najwa at Guest Services, who took very good care of me and answered all my questions and gave me a beautiful room, Khalid for the repeated excellent service in the restaurant by the pool, and Mohammed Nouaa, in the Cafe Casablanca for his excellent service!

Hotel is very clean. We tried two of the three restaurants, they were nice. The roof top bar and pool were very nice and a great way to relax and cool down in the Summer heat. The hotel is located close to some great restaurants in Casablanca.

Was good and comfort would come back to this hotel i had made it twice in less than a week however, the hotel is convienient to close to all business offices would prefer it and recommend it to anyone

column3: Disappointing experiences at Movenpick Hotel Casablanca
column4: Customer or guest should be the priority to be served. Commitment of the Hotel to its guests must be honored and fairly executed. Value of service must be considered first all the time than value of money or worst at the expense of the guest.

the services was really bad & slow. But the hotel is clean. the pool side cafe is very slow & expensive. We ask for some to go breakfast they could not provide us. If you have to take a early morning flight, then it's very convenient location.

Ok so we stayed here for 4 days recently. All I can say about this hotel is that if your used to the standard of hotels in Dubai then you will be disappointed! It seems Moroccan standards are not the same as the same brands in the Middle East/Western Europe. We have stayed in marrakech and Agadir and finding this at Sofitel and other good hotel chains. The staff were friendly enough and room ok. The rooftop pool is very small and more like a bath tub. This hotel is situated in the heart of Casablanca, a heavily polluted city with not much to do, but great if your on business. My advice if your looking to holiday in this area is perhaps to stay in Anfa which is much nicer, and commutable for shopping mall, mosque, ricks cafe etc. The breakfasts were limited with only 2 cereals…

i used to travel a lot to casablanca for buisiness , it is my second time in this hotel , i find worst than first time , i 'm really disapointed with cleaning service , breakfest and some waiters unprofesionality , definetly never i will choose again . 1 during first day , i find long black hairs on the bathroom floors , tthey were there during all may staying despite of room cleaning 2 times !! 2 toilets at reception and restaurant are really dirty !! 3 i had bad feeling and gastrointeritis after sandwich eating , was ordered at bar near swiming pool on top of hotel. 4 some waiters are not really profesional . 5 Staff overdone and noisy during breakfast

column3: Do not come to this hotel
column4: Escape and never book in this hotel. They don't have a health care service. The pool and towels are very dirty and not cleaned daily. In a little pool increadible loud music. The front office manager Mourad El Meliani doesn't respond to client request. Cannot keep calm, just show off and no solution. No any respect to foreigners. They don't treat foreigners as it should be. Very low english level. They never understand what you want to say. They should hire a front office manager who speaks clearly english at least.

Special thanks for Casablanca restaurant staff from day to day they are more and more polite and friendly. I was travelling a lot visited many hotels but never experienced so professional and friendly behaviour as here! I wish u all the best! Your Nutella friend 💪🏻

Very good hotel in general despite sound proofing issues. Other than that, service is quite good actually. The rooftop pool is a welcome addition. If not for the soundproofing issues in rooms I would give this a 5

column3: mid july stay at mövenpick hotel
column4: I had a very comfortable room. The breakfast is also very good. However, the quality of the service (whatever the order) needs improvement: it can be more pleasant, welcoming and reactive on the phone. Moreover, the food served for the room service can also be improved regarding its price.

The location of the hotel is very appropriate for a multipurpose stay in Casa. The overall experience is satisfactory but I will emphasize on some issues. I had to ask several times each time for my room to be cleaned. When the housekeeper passed in the morning (everyday) and I was still in my bedroom, I’d ask her to come back later on (that was usually at around 8-9); I’d come back to my chamber at 3 pm sometimes and find it not done yet. The room is quiet spacious, real nice, but lacks mirrors. A cover in the closet fell on the first day uncovering the electric box of the room. When I was leaving the bath tub, I was close to slipping because the bottom of the bathtub is 10 Centimeters higher than the bottom of the floor. There was only one soap in the bathroom. To be fair,…

Good service. Hassan the concierge was very helpful. Jalila the front desk officer was very good too. Staff were friendly and polite. Roof top was beautiful and refreshing. Good experience overall. Would like to visit again

column3: This is an overpriced 3 star hotel
column4: Terrible service, disgusting breakfast, inefficient front desk...avoid this hotel that would hardly deserve a 3 star rating. Too much to improve on. All the staff has to be grateful to have a job instead of being sulky and rude

Pros: 1. Friendly staff 2. Location - quite close to Twin Center - about 10 min walk - close to quite a number of nice restaurants 3. Close to the tramway station - Ad Hassan II 4. Strong wifi 5. Small but decent pool Cons: 1. Though the room keeping staff are friendly, they refilled different room amenities every day but never refilled the whole set. 2. The food and beverages at the pool restaurant are way overpriced. 100 durham for a glass of gin tonic and 140 for club sandwich (the taste was below average) excluding the service charge. 3. Breakfast was decent but with limited choices. Tips: If you don't want to be ripped off by taxi drivers, you can take the train to Gare de Casa Voyageurs. It costs 41 durhams. From Gare de Casa Voyageurs, you can take the tram to…

Why movenpick don't provide hair dryer in the room? Because the customers are baldness? I can not believe it. Even request from from desk, they don't response after 2 hr. How expensive hair dryer can be?

We really enjoyed our stay. Its located in the heart of the business area of the city close to everything basically. We walked fir 7 minutes to the big Eurooean shopping brands. Wide range of restaurants and coffee shops. But above all I'd like to note their wonderful service in the pool, room service, reception and concierge all very polite and helpful.

I found the hotel very cozy, close to all business, cafes, shops, us consulate . Also clean, nice staff, however even parking is free but it's very tied to drive in and park. My wife also enjoyed the stays as this was our second time to stay at this facility

One of my best hotels in Casablanca Ever ... if i return back sure i will stay their again Room Quality is amazing Hotel staff was so professional and decent, the only problem was that the pool was so small

column3: It's a Gamble -- If you have a problem during your stay, you'll have to pay for it
column4: Like the other negative reviews state, as soon as an issue arose, the staff became unpleasant and only had their best interest in mind. We were told at checkin that breakfast was free, but after breakfast, we got a bill for 66 Euro (other breakfasts in Morocco cost us less than 10 euro). We explained/argued our case to 4 different employees (over two hours of our vacation gone), but every reply was essentially "We never said breakfast was free, it is your fault for thinking it was free". To avoid this issue, we should not have trusted the hotel's word, because they denied it, and we didn't have proof. We should have gotten the statement in writing, or checked it against the email we received from the time of booking that breakfast wasn’t included. At hotels that charge this…

We stayed in this hotel for two nights. We've stayed in several Movenpick's in the past and felt this one was not up to the standards of their other locations. The room was dated and worn---curtains were loose from their hooks, sloppy paint job in room, stains on carpet, hallways smelled musty...just an overall lack of care. The rooftop bar has a great view and the staff are wonderful. But, the pool is in the middle of the bar with tables around it. If there are children in the pool, the serene setting changes quickly into a water park complete with splashing.

Great location perfect for business trips. The Moroccan Bath is a most have at the Spa on the 16th, nice complimentary breakfast and good overall customer service. Rooms carpets are dirty on the edges and sloppy construction job in the bathroom.

It was ok. Reception staff was friendly but some staff in restaurant area was not the same. you need ask few times to get something. Room cleaning was good. Rooms were ok but not up to movenpick standarts. For morocco its good but I was expecting 5 star quality which is not delivered. Breakfast was basic and everyday they serve some of the items from previous day. Hotel was located in front of a busy junction which was very noisy due to continous car horns.

Everything was ok expect for washroom design , it was very bad because there was no Curtin or anything which can stop water from shower to go on the floor I had to stay with sense of embrancment because I felt really bad that any poor cleaner will have to clean the mess for me and i couldn't do anything it was just the stupid design , rest everything was ok but still not what you expect from this chain

Potential to be a good hotel but needs improvements. Experienced Very poor service & quality of food in 16th floor have consequently discovered that total in invoice & credit card charges do not match

We arrived very late and tired (2.30am). The person at reception was very efficient and nice. He upgraded us and our room was just what we needed after a very long day. The Concierge people were also friendly and professional. All in all a good stay.

rooms are very noisy, i had to change rooms two times. Breakfast is not that good, they had flies on the cheese. Very poor quality, also please do not ask for coffee since it really has a bad taste. The staff was ok with my complaints and they managed to give me a quiet room in the end. Overall it was an unpleasant stay. I would not stay here again. The only good thing is that it has a good location.

High Standing Hotel but no coincidence with reservation price and bill. It was on Dirham, and the bill go up 373dh from the original price i has accorded. Not too much but enough to feel unconfortable.

This hotel lookes nice and organised, but isn't worth the money. The staff is untrained and unskilled and and some are even rude and ignorere you as a guest. They do not live up to the standard at which the hotel appears to be.

Hi ; we a family of 4 ... 2 adults and 2 kids staying for 5 nights at this hotel. Room size and amenities comfortable; location- fair . Lots of supermarkets and eating places within walking distance as well as the tram n taxis. The breakfast however is much to b desired for a hotel in the Movenpick Group . With a Boulangerie right opposite the hotel it fails me why is the bread at breakfast so stale n sad. 1 type of cereal on offer . The chef has no idea on frying an egg or making a decent omelette. For the exorbitant price charged for breakfast rather save your money and eat at one of the lovely cafes in Casablanca ; for between 25 and 50 euros you can get a fresh meal.

We were not impressed by this hotel. My mother and I arrived late at night after a very long train ride from Tanger, and the hotel had given our room to another guest. We had to wait for our local tour guide to give up his room so we could have a place to sleep.

I stayed two days in that hotel. Wifi was not good. Breakfast is so so. Rooms are clean and good enough. There s a small pool on the roof. As a Matter of fact ı can stay again in that hotel if the price s less than the other hotels.

This was my first stay at a Movenpick hotel. I thought it was a standard 4 star business hotel, but instead it turned out to be a 3 star tourist hotel for discounted tour groups staying one, maybe two nights most. Nothing wrong with these hotels, sometimes people travel in large groups. I don't. The service matches the hotel's type. We arrived early for an extended stay of 6 nights. Most hotels are happy to have that type of client, but not here. Since we were staying for so long, we reserved and prepaid for an upgraded deluxe room to have the extra space. When we got up to the room it a standard. Not a good way to start. I complained, they said it was a deluxe room, I said it wasn't (if you want to deceive your guests, stop putting pictures up on your website of the…

Check in was so fast. Lobby was not that specious. Room was average size with comfortable bed. Bathroom was specious and clean. Staff were so friendly and helpful. Complementary internet was provided. Location was a big advantage as the hotel is located just few steps from tramway station. Check out took just few seconds.

The hotel is nestled in a central area of Casablanca, where you can explore by foot some nice neighborhoods around. Breakfast is amazing!! Many kind of breads and cheese! The rooms has a good space and amenities are nice also. Breakfast has not so many varieties, but it's ok. My room was very clean and as I noticed most of the guests were there for business, I believe the others rooms are the same. The food in general is good, speciality the Moroccan food. They have a delicious Tajine that you won't regret to ask. Their past wasn't good, not salty and made with a industrial tomato puree.Bed was also comfortable. Wifi is free and open, and in my room the signal was very good! Unfortunately, my visit was during the Ramadan - when the local people aren't so friendly despite of…

Service quality is great, Warm hospitality, especially from the Front Desk and their Manager, However, he has a crowded entrance due to its location in the heart of Casablanca. So, it's better to use valet-parking if you are arriving by your own car and poor quality food which make me quite disappointing in a such a 5* hotel. Regarding rooms, it has a simple decoration, but a very comfortable bed and pillows

Very poor Breakfast and Dinner Buffet for a 5* hotel chain as a Movenpick. it's really a big shame, it was the all group opinion. Fortunately, you have a very qualified and professional reception and Restaurant staff.

column3: Amazing staff and great city view
column4: I happened to stay in Movenpick in my first ever trip to Casablanca. The hotel staff, first of all, were very kind. I can strongly vouch for a very nice gentleman called KHALID he was in charge at the restaurant, the first day he noticed i did not eat bread and he offered this traditional pastry that looked more like "chapati" . He made sure we were attended to every time we stepped foot in the restaurant, good thing about him he is multilingual so communication was easy for those of us who did'nt speak Arabic. Soukaina and Khadija were awesome too. Manal made sure my room was always clean she was not speaking English but you could see the sincerity and kindness in her expressions!! I would recommend MovenPick any day in Casablanca, location is central easy to go to the bank,…

The location was excellent, service and cleanliness could be better in parts Pool and SPA is clean and very nicely located on the roof top of the hotel. Good match for sight seeing and recreation. Friendly staff

Great location, nice rooftop, spacious bedroom but there are rooms of improvement for the food and the service. Mostly, the diversity of the meals and the price vs.quality of those are not satisfying.

Nice hotel, beautiful view from the top. It's a pity that Smoking is still allowed inside. Furthermore the list in the bar was inaccurate, non alcoholic beer was not available for instance. But very friendly and helpful staff. Overall very good hotel

When we checked in we asked what the dining options were , and were advised that there were 3 restaurants, but that the sushi bar was unavailable that night due to a private function. So we asked the front desk to cancel our reservation at a restaurant outside the hotel. But when we came to dine we found that in fact all 3 restaurants were closed to private functions, so we were stuck in a lounge area and offered a menu with 10 simple dishes. OK, but then when we ordered most of the dishes were unavailable. The staff did not have a clue what they were doing, and when the food eventually arrived after more than 1 hour it was not what we ordered, but we ate it just so we could leave. And the wine that we had waited for so patiently arrived just as we finished eating .. Whatever…

The location is very good. Nice employees. The room was quite and big enough. The manager sent me a welcome basket with biscuits and fruit. I,ve appreciated. Unfortunately the swim pool area was not able to receive any guest that day. I would have appreciated if I was informed before the check-in or at least when I checked in. Thank you for the hospitality though.

The best: The location of the hotel, is in front of one of the best beaches, next to the most commercial streets of the island. Breakfast; enough. Nothing fancy but basic. The toilet, very good. Special mention to the ladies of the toilet, very cheerful, always with a smile and do their work very well. Congratulations! The worst: there was dampness on the air conditioner. The first day it rained heavily and water filtered through the main window. The bathroom is very small, in fact could not fit the paper, you could not close the door. And it could have windows because the infrastructure allows it. What to improve: there are very friendly staff, with that sympathy that one believes characterizes the Colombian. Another does not, show disinterest and disinterest.

Incredible that, for all the luxury hotels in Marrakech, there is not a single top quality hotel in the commercial capital. The Sofitel is probably the best followed by the Hyatt and Movenpick. This Movenpick falls way short of what might be expected of the brand. True, public spaces have been upgraded to a more contemporary style. Bathroom fixtures in the bedrooms have been improved (but no walk-in shower, still a tub). However, it looks like the old carpets and furniture in the bedrooms have been retained, the level of cleanliness is not what it should be and sloppy paint work is widely evident. The rooftop pool is much smaller than it appears in the photos. When I visited the rooftop cafe for a lunch snack, the pool was dominated by five or six big guys who didn't seem to…

One of the good hotel to stay.This was my second visit to Casablanca and again I preferred to stay in MOvenpick, the reason for this is good hospitality, good service, good location, good staff and I can say this time also same comments

column3: Service does not correspond to the level of the hotel Muwinpik.
column4: Service does not correspond to the level of the hotel Movenpick. We stayed in Germany at the hotel there the level of service is very high, in Morocco at 3 points. We were settled in a room where the sewers on the top floor very much rustled. To sleep under the sound of running water is terrible and certainly not possible. After the complaints, we, of course, were resettled, but why it was necessary to settle in this number of people already at a young age is not clear. I had to drag all the things to another room at night. The night is broken and of course the mood is very bad. Also in the hotel regret shampoo, gel and soap for residents. Save on breakfast with fresh vegetables and juices, very small choice.

We scheduled transportation to the airport through the front desk of hotel the day before our departure. The pickup time of (3:00am) and price were confirmed and agreed upon up front. The hotel staff introduced us to the driver the day before which was nice. The hotel also gave the driver a written note with the pickup time and agreed upon price - which was all great. On the morning of the pickup the driver loaded our bags in the car and then stated that there was a problem that he needed to speak privately about. The driver needed to increase the price to the airport by 40% due to the time of the day. This would be a different type of situation if the driver would not have been recommended by the hotel. But since the driver was recommended, took our bags, and then…

Great hotel and wonderful service. The room was large and had comfortable bed..The rooftop deck had a gorgeous view of the city. and a place to relax.. The staff at the front desk were very friendly and helped us in every aspect.

I had a female moroccan visitor, we were only allowed to stay at the lobby. I had wanted to take her to my room but I was not allow by the receptionist. She told me that if I want to take her to my room unless I pay a sum equivalent for a room per night. So I paid the money and then we were allowed to go to my room. The reason why I paid the money is what I did not understand, because no new room was given to us... It was just a pass fee. Please allow people to come with there visitors free of charge, no matter the nationality. If you do this, it will help to make the hotel's condition of service user friendly.

Very good stay at Mövenpick Hotel with a very good facilities and a very good location to visit the city. All services were very appreciated with perfect quality. We shall keep very good souvenir of our stay at Mövenpick Hotel Casablanca.

column3: Even if you have a reservation, you might not get a room !!!
column4: I arrived at the hotel with a confirmed reservation and I was told that some other guests decided to extend their stay and I have to go to another hotel!!! So Even if you have a reservation, you might not get a room !!!

I like the hotel and the welcomeness of the staff but the Food is not as good as a 5 star hotel should be the taste is not nice and the variety is not enough and the room service menu has not seen an addition or a change within the past year .

Excellent good foods comfortable bed and nice staff location is not bad the staff speaks good English I had to leave early because of my passport dated 16 may 17 it expires. I had little issues with that I've explain to mr tarik kerdoudi about it and he promised me he will do his best to resolve it and I won't be charged for 4 nights I have left photo copy of my passport and e mail from booking .com and copy of my adjusted airline tickets showing that going back on the 16 may to England I would like to thank u for corporations in this matter best regard Walid manasfi

column3: My stay at the Mövenpick Hotel
column4: I must say that after a very short stay at an other well known hotel (I'll not mention it here) it was a wonderful reception at the Mövenpick! Clean and well equipped reception is a good start. The doormen are very helpful and kind. The room (suite) was lovely. Large bathroom with a bath (shower in also in the bath but there is a glass splash sheet that avoids the water going all over the place. Amenities are fine and so are the towels. The beds are good and the pillows are perfect. Breakfast is very nice. Gets hectic when busy, but quality is above par. I used to be a busboy, they could use one. Coffee, tea as well as mint tea are served. Buffet with fresh food and different kinds of yogurt are available. I would not mind a newspaper... Restaurants on the premises are nice.…

column3: Movenpick Casablanca sold my booked room
column4: Dear All Pls take care because Movenpick Caablanca sold my booked room without any prior notice to myself and they booked a cheaper hotel (and not the same level) for myself which was an unacceptable act for me. Furthermore I was not the only one suffering from it and I discovered that there was sseveral clients discussing for same issue with the reception. It was unbelievable, I propose to avoid booking from this hotel in order to not have a catastrophic situation and finding you without a room in the evening time

We arrived with our reservation but were told the hotel was full. We were moved to another hotel. We lost over 2 hours before getting our rooms (bad synchronization between the 2 hotels). We were promise a shuttle in the morning that never arrived. Finally got an upgrade for the same price for the remaining of the stay. We tried 2 restaurants including the Moroccan one. Food expensive and average compared to what you find in local restaurants.

column3: One night stay in Casablanca on the way to a bus tour.
column4: Very nice 5 star hotel , rooms were big and clean, well furnished. Breakfast in the morning was excellent. Check out no problem, fast and efficient. Good exchange rate ( better that at the airport ) . Service was very good. Location was ok within a short taxi ride to most places in Casablanca. taxis are very inexpensive in Morocco. Not much within walking distance. The pool at the top was nice , but could not use it as we got to the hotel too late and it was getting a bit cold. Bar had everything you wanted to. Great hotel overall.

Good hotel with nice food and service. The breakfast was delicious. The staff was helpful and sometimes was a bit dramatic discussing loud about their issues in the middle of restaurant what can be funny at the start and strange when it never ends... The room is good and confortable.

column3: Beautiful architecture and..THE destination for electric vehicle drivers in Marrackesh!!
column4: This is a beautifully renovated hotel with multiple buildings spread out over amazing grounds, with pools and greenery. Also, great breakfast, with extensive choice of food and very enthusiastic staff& food & beverage director/deputy hotel manager. And well equipped and appointed rooms, with various spa choices etc. On this occasion, we were on our way to Ourzazate, driving an ev and for that we required the assistance of the the hotel's technical staff (ie. the director of engineering and his team), who made a great effort to arrange electrical charging for our car. You can find the full story online. Overall, this was a very enjoyable stay and we look forward to visit again!

column3: Resting up before an international flight
column4: Great hotel. Nicely decorated with spacious rooms. Room service was prompt and the food was pretty good. The staff was very friendly, especially the housekeeping staff. I particularly appreciated Soumia Gharib's kindness and attention to detail. Thanks for helping!

Good location for business and for restaurants etc Pleasant rooftop pool and bar area with good views. Ideal for business travellers. Taxi rank outside the hotel, but take the red ones - they are the cheapest.

column3: Im rating the restaurant in the 16th floor
column4: I visited often this restaurant in the 16th floor, why i come back ? because the staff is gentle and the view around casablanca is unique, and they have a pool. Only think its food, its really not good, you can eat better in any other small restaurant, its like the chef dont care . too bad! but for a drink or tapas, its good enought!

Thx for quality of services Clean and comfortable beds and rooms But unfortunately very poor breakfast amd small restaurant. Roof top pool was also great and bar and view was good. Staff always helpful.

Nice staff , but overall disappointed . Quite expensive for average product. Business center very limited , rooftop restaurant with little choice and very slow service. Breakfast choice average. I was quite disappointed for a 5 star hotel

I am talking only about the restaurant in the lobby floor where I had breakfast. The rate was 280 MAD. According to my experience with the food, it is not worth the money.In Insense in Kenzi hotel, you pay 200 and the food and service is better?

column3: Very good business hotel in Casablanca
column4: This hotel is a good value for money. The hotel is well equipped, the rooms are spacious and nice a quiet. Their staff is helpful and speaks English very well. They have a nice roof top swimming pool and bar and an included fitness center with good and modern equipment.

The location is very bad, the front desk personal was very rude, the internet was not available during the stay, even when it came back it was not working . The restaurant personal was no help at all to figure out their menu. Overall, never ever again.

Old hotel but good sleep quality and breakfast. Close to tranway station Hassan II. Good location.Rooms have enough space although everytjing is very old.Good bed. Breakfast quite good and good service.

Actually I am totally not satisfied with the case happened as well as the management reaction regarding the problem I faced during my stay at the hotel which is experienced successfully in lot of other hotels

Great attention (although if you don't speak French you can only communicate with a few people). Very close to the financial area and 15 minutes walking from the medina following the tram livery. Very nice pool bar on 16th floor.

Great Hotel, very clean, lovely rooftop bar and pool. Great rooms, very clean and nice. We only spent one night in this hotel, but everyone from the staff was very friendly, helpful and going out of their was to assist. We would go there again any time.

No complaints, everything smooth. Check in took some time as staff seemed too busy - always on telephone. Could someone have been relocated. Bed once and comfortable though sofa in bedroom not too comfortable. Hotel location good, right on the very convenient tram line which is very easy and cheap to use.

column3: Decent hotel, but still have to watch prices
column4: I stayed in this hotel twice in the matter of 10 days. On my second stay, when leaving, I was charged more than I thought for the "city tax". Turns out they way overcharged me for this "tax". Very disappointing, I had considered the hotel a safe haven from having to haggle over money, but you need to be aware here as well.

column3: Great Choice in money for Quality
column4: Modern hotel, very confortable and well locate, acessible through different means. Great breakfast and service quality, very pleasent stay. The last floor however could see a small redo arround the pool to maximize the panoramic view.

Amazing staff ... the little time i spent there they made me feel that i had been there since ever. The manager revenue took responsability to assure my stay although the hotel was fully booked. Definetely it will be in my priority options for my next visit to casablanca.

We pay more than the bill which we booked in hotels.com.it was the first time that i have faced it.all our request was rejected by receptionest.they didn't pay attention to guests at all.the breakfast was good.it is not worthy to pay and stay.

column3: Average hotel, small rooms, more of a quick stay at center hotel
column4: Stayed here for couple nights Service was good Rooms are claustrophobic and small It is in the busy traffic area with a OT of activity around, driving in and out can be an issue including parking Food was ok

column3: 2nd time here and always good to be there
column4: The roof top 16th is a nice place to be in, a bit small but not usually overcrowded. They serve good Sushi platters and must try. The evening they turn into lounge music not too loud but good to chill. The Wifi in the 16th Floor lounge is not stable. need to change the Access point as connection keeps on dropping. The room I was given was a corner one, not the great view, but it was a sizeable one with plenty of space (#904) and bed comfort was good. The breakfast was good and there is a balance between fruits, cheese, bakery, eggs, and meat. Although poached eggs already made in quantities on the heater, but unfortunately they are well well done. Not an experience of one day but multiple.

I stayed here last week, on the last nights of a Moroccan tour. This is not a five star standard from outside need paint Job floor corridor need paint job .nice staff clean nice roof top Swimming pool,location nice.

my main concern is always cleanliness and comfort. this hotel has both, besides many other values such as location and staff and great service including food and room accessories. i had some minor issues with the maintenance of the furniture and some other accessories but as i said, minor... i recommend it to all

the elevator is suddenly stopped, guest has to walk from 16 floor to 2 floor. when guest check out, reception couldn't recognize guest was checked in and charge guest as no show. check out guest paid in cash, and meanwhile credit card was charged again. double charge. service from reception is very poor.

column3: Average hotel with a few issues
column4: I stayed here twice, on the first and last nights of a Moroccan group tour. This is not a five star standard and i have outlined the issues that swayed me to mark the hotel down to average. PROS - this was the only hotel that we stayed at in Morocco that had an iron and ironing board in the room - aircon worked( it didn't in 3 other Moroccan hotels) - beautiful toiletries - tea and coffee facilities in the room( unlike all of the other hotels that we stayed at) - staff were helpful with printing off my boarding passes - buffet breakfast was adequate - close to tram station - ATMs located around the corner - comfortable beds - good free wifi - comfortable room CONS - incredibly lumpy and uncomfortable pillows - the hairdryer in my room didn't work and asked for a new one as…

column3: Good Location, Elegant, Large Rooms & Quite
column4: Hotel needs to take care of the following:- Room: 1. Not hold a deposit on the credit card, because it is inappropriate. 2. Replace the pillows with more comfortable ones. 3. Provide the ironing board with a water sprayer or replace the current ironing machine with a water spraying ironing machine. 4. Make the curtains easer to open and close with a handle, or maybe replace the whole curtains with modern ones, which are easier to move. 5. Replace the bathtub drain to allow better water drainage. 6. Install a better bathtub partition or curtain to prevent water leaking down the floor of bathroom and hallway. Room service: * Changing the way and quality of cooking the same meal on menu when ordered again over a few days seriously makes the guest DISSATISFIED. Breakfast: 1.…

The hotel is located in a very central location in Casablanca and it offers a very fair value for money, teh breakfast i sjust excellent staff is very freindly and know their job well overall a very fair value for money

Nice and clean hotel. Good location central to town and easily accessible via taxis. Very helpful front desk staff and friendly staff at the restaurants. Only wish is that the pool was heated. It is beautiful but we didn't have a chance to enjoy it due to the chilly temperature. Overall a great visit!

column3: Worst stay i had in my life
column4: Bad service, no one answers the phones. In consistent messages when it comes to opening a second room. Breakfast is terrible. Staff are always busy talking or sleeping instead of helping the clients .

Very good place, can be noisey some time so maje sure you get room away from the noisy side, hotel is well located , food is great ...just do not use Uber if you are here to avoid being attacked by taxi drivers hotel can not do anything about it but it can be an unpleasant experience

I was recently in Casablanca and stayed two separate nights (March 19 and March 24). I stayed in the Classic King room and it was very spacious, the room was clean, the bathroom was beautiful and immaculate. I was very comfortable and had a salad at the bar up in the terrace on the 16th floor. All the staff were very polite and greeted me with a smile. I felt very welcomed and would stay at the hotel again without hesitation and recommend. The lobby is spacious, and smells lovely, adding a special touch when entering the hotel.

I did not get the doble room with doble bed I had booked and paid for and with 1.85 cms and 1.95 cms height one of us ended up sleeping on a supplementary bed with no adjustment whatsoever to the rate of the reservation we had paid for.

The plus: The movenpick has very spacious bedroom, with extra large bed, with big war-drop...spacious bathroom... Comprehensive breakfast Good wifi Gym club within the hotel The cons: -The restaurant is not for vegetarians... They are supposed to have a few dish on their healthy menu... But when you order those, the staff tells you the dish is not available! -The pressure of the shower is not adequate and you cannot wash without spilling water on the floor. -Poor TV quality (snow on Tv) -Service in the restaurant varies depending on who is delivering the service ... Some young waitress are not very professional.. In the top floor restaurant, they come to greet you when they have time; So I went to them to place to take the menu and place my order. The persons who serve me…

It's an average hotel , not the best but also not the worst , for me I don't think am going back to it, especially with the good hotels around that area. To be fair, I had an issue and the staff were very helpful and understanding, but the venue itself needs an urgent modernization

I was fortunate to spend the week at The Movenpick Hotel Casablanca. We had a company conference there and used it as a base. The rooms are well appointed and clean. The bed was comfortable and the shower warm and wet. All staff were excellent, polite and efficient. A credit to the company. Over the week we ate in the three Restaurant, Cafe Bar and Bar, all were very good; however I would recommend the buffet in the Cafe Bar and an authentic evening experience in the Restaurant. Thank you for taking care of us all week

Unfortunately previous good "Trip Advisor" ratings did not reflect reality. It's true that we all have differing opinions and some people may like what I do not like. In the case of Movenpick Casablanca I believe that it's average, if you need somewhere to sleep and everywhere else is booked up then go for it, however, I'm sure that there are much better places to stay else where. Internet was on/off for the whole stay, sometimes I managed to load a whole page within 5 mins! Breakfast was disorganised, no spoons, no glasses, no plates ,no muesli and tea / coffee was hit and miss whether it was offered or not. Tables cleared away after each sitting were still covered with breadcrumbs from the previous guests. The downstairs restaurant , "Seven" offers a traditional Moroccan…

I would deffo visit this hotel in Cassablanca. Service is great and the rooms are spacious.you should deffo include breakfast as it is worth it great selection and the staff are very friendly. Great location.

column3: They are cheating on tourists even in so called "5 star" hotels here
column4: It was my first experience in Morocco and I would appreciate to have a better one! I would recommend to the management to change the "Moroccan" client experience approach, which is - announcing prices to the clients, when the service is already delivered, meaning that client has no other way, than to pay. No amenities announced when checking-in, even if we thought that breakfast was included in our reservation, appeared that we didn't have it, but nobody informed us, we learned about it, when waitress asked us to sign a bill, during the breakfast with equivalent of 52€ for two person, (sorry guys we are not in Paris George V hotel!!!) Wi-Fi was cut 3 hours in advance before the check-out and has never been restored, even if promised.... If you try to take stairways from…

After doing reservation directly with website of hotel during my business trip I was forced to cut my staying from 4 nights down to 3 however they charged for all the nights of my reservation despite I informed about it at check in time. They are charging one extra night but losing a customer for ever.

Nothing to complain. Probably the best alternative in town if you are not willing to pay 300$ to a fancy hotel. Rooftop pool and bar is nice. Main restaurant is average. Location is very good. It is a pleasant stay if you are on a business trip.

Good hotel to stay.felt like staying at home.Thanks to the hospitality by the hotel staff.Good work by house keeping, very responsive.Enjoyed each and every moment.Hotel is location is one of the best location.Near to the tramway makes it more special.

the hotel was perfect, clean and confortable, exept the night shift staff, the reception girl was rude, asking documents with no smile, and the room service kept calling in my room to pay the meal down in the reception, when i had dinner in my room.

Very Old furniture, drums music noise inupper floors shaking room windows, lobby staff are very soseroious as if in ploice station. Problem on front desk , some rudness of employee but manager solved eventualy. good Security and parking for car. Nice beds and bathrooms with tubs. Internet quality fine. Several cafes arroound.

Staff is very kind and helpful rooms are great and clean andin the afternoon free chocolate :) Hotel is well located but a taxi is easy to use and not expensive. Breakfast is very good. We had a very pleasent stay.

Overall experience and service was great and although the interior of the hotel was lovely, the rooms are in serious need of a face-light ! I would stay there again though, as location and access to other part of town was convenient. Oh! Watch out for the Red Taxis, some of them were rip-offs, absolutely ridiculous what they were charging hotel guest who were non-the wiser!

column3: Great business hotel for short stays
column4: I'm a regular customer at the hotel (working in Morroco) and I always enjoy staying there for a few days. Great service, kind employees and clean, spacious rooms. Only issue is the noise from the streets on lower levels and from other rooms sometimes....

Overall nice hotel. Good for family. Pros: + Clean and spacious room, with extra beds for kids + Reception, concierge, and house keeping staff members very friendly and helpful + Valet parking Cons - Breakfast restaurant "greeter" ignored us ...

column3: Rather not recommend for that price
column4: Safe should work Shoes cleaning service should work (as is written in the wardrobe) Bath tube should not be blocked up Room should have a hair dryer (if not installed to the wall, at least a remote one) Room should be similar to the one on the picture (booking.com) For that price in 5 star hotel I feel I should get 1 bottle of water out of charge each day Would be nice if concierge has umbrellas for hotels guests in case of rain (as you have in Movenpick in Istanbul).

column3: Excellent Luxury Hotel in Central Casablanca
column4: I really enjoyed my time at the Movenpick Casablanca. The staff were very professional and courteous, the room was recently refurbished and immaculate, well appointed and had a very comfortable bed, the breakfast and dinner I had there were delicious and cooked to a world standard. I also enjoyed the roof top lounge/resturant , great music and views. Finally, the location of the hotel is very central and you can access all the city from it. Overall a great stay , thank you Mr. Amr Kallini and team for a memorable stay, I will definitely come back.

Poor service at check in. Two girls who didn't show any care or hospitality during the process. Had to take my own bags up, not 5star service. Hotel is clean and located at a good place to go to all the major places within Casablanca. Red Taxis are very cheap in Casablanca. Between £1-5 takes you everywhere. I would advise to book without breakfast as there are plenty of nice places to eat outside hotel especially if you are traveling as a couple. Overall hotel is clean but staff hospitality for 5 star lacking.

Stayed at movenpick for 4 nights last week, we had a few events planned, the staff went over and beyond to ensure we had a good time, the room was nice and all the staff members were amazing, Jalila was so friendly, Mourad and all the waiters that helped us in room Casablanca on 12/2/17 were so calm and helpful. The door men and concierge team were fab. Hotel has currency change facilities much better than airport exchange rate. Thank you for a great time 👌🏾👌🏾

Fantastic service, everyone was very pleasant and helpful. Huge thanks to Salma and the rest of the team. I celebrated my 40th birthday at the hotel and all my family members and friends are delighted with the service.

Good hotel facilities, nice room, friendly and helpful staff. Poor selection of tv channels especially lack of sports but would recommend to friends and would definitely stay in this hotel if I travel to Casablanca in the future.

column3: Great hotel in financial heart of Casablanca
column4: Great hotel within walking distance of most of the banks. super service, very comfortable stay! Perfectly assorted breakfast. Ultra clean and modern rooms, all accomdations one could wish for. I definitely recommend it

Nice and smart hotel, in modern style arrangements, absolutly clean and quiet Good place for doing business, good value at this time of the year Well equipped, with spa and gym, top floor bar very attractive

Stayed at movenpick hotel for two nights in two junior suites,nice spacious rooms,cleanliness of rooms ain't that great but location of the hotel is excelent,the medina is walking distance and the Tram is just outside the hotel,very centrally situated,room service was good but housekeeping needs great attention,language is a problem with the staff but very friendly

Ask for a upper floor or have good earplugs ! Check out is complicated, even if you speak French Breakfast is average (do not ask for scrambled eggs) in conclusion, it does not worth the price you will pay.

the hotel is old despite the renovation. Bathroom is old fashion. door handle gets out of place. mattress is not good. corridors are dull. location is ok being in the center. concierge was helpful in securing transportation.

Recommended Hotel in Casablanca near all banks and companies and also near old souk and also Hobous Market where you can find all antiques. Quiet and clean hotel Good buffet on breakfast Staff are very cooperative

It was one of the unique experience i had in those last 2 years i started visiting hotels, i payed more i assume but the experience was unforgettable ,the staff welcoming and serving while smiling and saluting in every step to the room , the pricing is high ,but for the experience i do not regret a dirham i used tp pay , one more thing i would like to use the pool every time time of the year therefore will be nicer if a heated pool exist

column3: Nice business hotel in the heart of the city!
column4: A good business hotel, nice rooms, decent food, business facilities but a woeful breakfast menu. WiFi is free and good though. Rooms are quite spacious and well contained. Service is prompt and good. Staff is very courteous and takes care of the guests very well.

awesome experience in Morocco and Casablanca especially nice staff and lovely place a highly recommend the 16eme for a neat Ambiance Thanks to everyone who made this stay memorable i will come back soon

The centre of Casablanca is not ideal for holidaying but if you want good transport links and a reasonable selection of restaurants then I can recommend this hotel. The hotel is well kept, large comfortable rooms and all the staff are very helpful and friendly. The buffet breakfast is a bit chaotic for my liking but there's a good selection of food. We had one meal in the basement restaurant which was good (did get a bit tired of the looped music though). There's a bar, a little pricey but pleasant and a small pool area on the roof with good views.

Was staying in king size bed room . Room was pretty good. Surprisingly had to remind housekeeping daily to provide water bottles. Used conference rooms on 15th floor and they were perfect for meetings. Breakfast is same daily and less variety of food items,hotel's management needs to re look at what all to be served every morning.

column3: Very Nice Hotel, Amazing Restaurant Staff
column4: While the hotel rooms were very nice and comfortable, the purpose of this review was a promise I made to the restaurant staff from the Casablanca Cafe (on the lobby floor). They comped our entire dinner bill and provided us with an ice-cream cake when they found out it was my father's birthday. I've never had an entire bill comped before anywhere, even here in the US.
