I apologize that I don't remember the staffs' names, but they were awesome, and we were very grateful for it. If it helps at all, I believe they were working the dinner shift on January 3rd.

If you want to be in the heart of Casablanca, this hotel is it. The view from the rooms on the top floors are wonderful. We had a suite which was very large, had a huge bathroom with windows over looking the city, great bath and very comfortable beds. Breakfast was fabulous, lots to choose from and healthy options as well. The gym was well equipped with a four treadmills, bikes, rowers and weights. Did have the morning breakfast smell to it though. Nice roof top pool that was far too cold to swim in though. Good children's menu and room service In all this is a good hotel for a stop in the city. Its not 5 star, but its a good 4 star.

Movenpick is located in the middle of the hustle bustle of Casablanca. Conventionally located near public transit and major financial area of the city. The lobby is grand and have ample seating space of guests waiting for check in. The staff is extremely courteuos and ready to assist at all times. The room was spacious and well appointed. High quality soap and toiletries are used which is a testament to the hotel's commitment to take care of their guests. I am thoroughly impressed!

A really nice hotel with excellent staff. My room was clean and nice and I have zero complaints, would stay here again. One note - breakfast is overpriced so I would skip it. The rooftop bar was a great place to relax, wish I hadn't been there in winter so I could have used the pool.

The hotel is in a nice location and overall satisfactory. Considering the star level and the price, it is actually not impressive and perhaps even disappointing. Nice bed, large room with a couch made my stay comfortable but I was annoyed by the clogged sink that collected water in the tub and made washing hands/face a pain. The room was a bit noisy. The carpet in the room and room furnishing are due for an overall rehab. Staff needs training in being available but not intrusive.

Good base to explore Casablanca - rooms nice/functional, though fairly anonymous - location praqctical for both business and tourist visits - did not try restaurant - rooftop bar looked interesting - would go back

On our visit to Morocco recently, we visited the city of Casablanca and stayed there for couple of days. As we have always had a good experience with Movenpick. We chose to stay in Movenpick Hotel in Casablanca. The hotel is centrally located and very convenient to travel around the city from there. Our check-in happened quickly and efficiently. As we were a family of 4, we stayed in a big room. The room was very spacious and had the view of the city. Loved the size of cupboards, bathroom and other amenities. All the facilities like swimming pool, gym, spa, restaurants etc were great. We had a wonderful stay.

I highly recommend Fatema for promotion as she made our stay a lot better. Otherwise we would have complained and asked to speak with the General manager. Front Office - service a bit of a hit and miss.

I have spend 2 days in this hotel when I was on a 2 weeks trip in Morocco. We have booked via a tour agency in Hungary. I dont how it happened exactly but at the reception we received the key for the casablanca junior suite. It was really funny to stay in casablanca at casablanca hotel, in the casablanca junior suite, drinking casablanca beer in the jacuzzi, but it was a really funny story and somwething I will allways remember.

column3: Not worth your money! A HUGE disappointment for the Movenpick hotel chain.
column4: We were two couples traveling and we paid for both rooms. Knowing that Movenpick is an excellent hotel brand throughout the Middle East, I had very high expectations. My first and last impression of the hotel staff is that they're trying their best. However, the hotel itself seems a bit outdated. We were looking forward to the rooftop pool that turned out to be quite small. Nevertheless, we tried to enjoy a meal at the restaurant, which turned out to be a very expensive endeavor. We were provided no menus whatsoever so we had no clue what the prices were for anything. The meal was so large that we should have shared it. In the end, we asked to have it packed. The staff was VERY hesitant to do this. For the prices we were paying, I would expect Heaven and Earth to move!…

Overall good, the rooms lack a balcony and the service at the restaurants and cafes are really slow. Room quite and clean, the staff are very helful and the spa is great. A bit expensive but good value for your money!

A very well located between city centre and the see side area, very close and accessible to all attractions and areas of interest. Staff were very pleasant, knowledgeable, and professional. Hotel is fairly new and very clean and organized. I would definitely recommend this hotel for friends and family, and would consider it to be my choice of hotel to stay in Casablanca or any other city in Morocco.

The hotel is well positioned in the center of Casablanca, close to main financial and touristic áreas. The personnel is correct, and in general romos are well sized. Swimming pool is a plus, though the wheather was cold during my stay. I enjoyed the fitness center, well equiped with mills and training machinery.

column3: Great Hotel at a Very Central Location
column4: This is quite a good hotel. Rooms are spacious and most importantly it's quite. Instead of double pane windows to filter out the traffic noise, they put 2 layers of windows, which is pretty fine with me. Internet connectivity is very good as well and they have pretty decent TV shows which kept me entertained when the weather was sour. The only complaint that I have would be during check in and breakfast waiter. A little smile does go a long way!

Great hotel, perfect location close to our branch office, great service, prompt room service and attentive staff. If you're looking for a place away from all the noisy tourists around the Corniche, this is the place.

Fantastic service and attitude . The best in every hotel I have ever stayed . very comfortable room and nice room service . I will definitely consider Movenpick hotel for my next traveling and very likely to recommend this hotel to my friends .

Good hotel, nice bar with view of Casablanca with a limited but ok menu for dinner. Lots of choice for breakfast with very friendly and helpful staff. Rooms are clean, well equipped and sufficient for a few nights. Good wifi as well.

column3: A great a place to stay in casa
column4: Very central located hotel in Casablanca. Friendly staff, nice rooms everything was great. Nice bed, table, wardrobe and amazing bathroom. I stayed for 6 days and it was amazing. I highly recommend it.

column3: Excellent Hotel with Excellent Housekeeping and Guest Service
column4: I stayed at the Hotel in mid late November 2016. The Housekeeping staff was amazing. Big thanks to Mrs. Fouzia, Mrs. Wafaa, and Hafssa for a wonderful stay and for providing great service everyday. Whatever I needed they provided quickly. Extra towels and etc

Great room, felt misled by staff. 30 Euros for a cup of coffee a pastry and some fruit for breakfast. Sorry but that's egregious. Food at the restaurant was sub-par and service wasn't great. I am sure that there is better value elsewhere in Casablanca

This is an excellent Hotel, in a great location with very good and polite staff. The rooms and the bathrooms are very clean and the quality of sleeping is high. Very nice food in general with great breakfast buffet. In front office Mr Mourad was extremely professional and helpful during our stay. Well done!

The hotel is nice and the staff is spectacular. They went above and beyond to help us find a taxi, buy tickets for the tram (and walked us to the pick up location), and recommend restaurants. -Central location (about 15 minutes taxi from mosque/Ricks) -Good wifi -Amazing staff Cons: The only major con was that it was incredibly noisy the night we stayed. I think they may have been hosting an event on the roof. We were on the 2nd floor and kept up until 1am by drumming. Breakfast is also really expensive.

Wafaa is an amazing massage therapist. I have been carrying stress in my lower abdomen and she immediately detected it. She has great sense and great way of massaging. Moreover Ghita who performed my exfoliation was so thorough. My skin feels like a baby's bottom. the exfoliation of your body and the steam room are so relaxing and very healthy for the overall skin organ. There may be cheaper places out there but these ladies accommodate you to keep your expense down and give you a very calming, relaxing, health filled experience- On another note Mourad in reception is great! He accommodated me by doing a price match! Concierge help is also really great. By the way it was not noisy at all! Ask for a room on the upper levels -a quiet room and voila -you're taken care of! Enjoy!

We stayed a week at Movenpick hotel Casa and it was a great experience.... +friendly reception staff, good food, good location, super friendly bartender Hassan at bar/Resto 16 -pool was not heathed, concierge was not helpful with picking up my friend from airport. Overall very good and modern hotel compared with other hotels we visited. (Four seasons no alcohol, Hyatt horrible service, Sheraton very old). I will book this hotel again...

Good location, but for a 5* Hotel the Movenpick was disappointingly, and surprisingly, noisy. For most of my stay, I did not enjoy a single, uninterrupted night's sleep. Disturbances varied from loud music and inconsiderate guests, to room service and maintenance staff working in the evenings. There just seemed to be constant, and annoying, noise which I found, at times, uncomfortable. The housekeeping staff, although nice & friendly, were too noisy. An example of this were housekeepers and their supervisors shouting down the corridor to each other. I might be knit picking, but this hotel is not cheap. When staying in a 5* hotel you shouldn't need ear plugs! The sound insulation in this hotel is very poor. You should not be able to listen to conversations from the room below! …

The hotel is right on the road and its too noisy...breakfast was also ok. The return transport provided by the hotel to the Airport was one of the worst car I have traveled in recent times...1980's model with smelly seats and broken here & there although they charged normally (. I won't stay here again for sure.

column3: this is the most friendly hotel
column4: Just having breakfast before check out but I will be back. I have used other good hotels in Casablanca but this is now the one I will return too. Great atmosphere , rooms good size and the sushi is excellent, go for the hot sushi it was great. The Skybar is excellent , views , space and service But what makes this a great hotel is the people. Everyone is friendly , hospitable , helpful and attentive. Thankyou. Special Thanks to Mohamed in the Skybar, he kept the beers cold and was the perfect host. Also thanks to Mohamed Elmsioui. I will seen you again.

Very good conditions and friendly personal of hotel. We would like use the swimming pool,but was can not for any privat party... So, if we come back at Casablanca anytime, we will return to Movenpick sure!

Good location, Great service breakfast was poor and very friendly staff very helpful and give advise they make fill home and also call you by your name I will definitely come back to the hotel and advise my friends and colleagues to do so.

Its a clean and well organised hotel with lovely staff, I like how warm they are in welcoming and farewell. There food and services are excellent. i recommended this hotel to be used. The rooftop restaurant was amazing

The hotel was nice, the location was very convenient as I reach everywhere in no time , the check in and out process was fine , the hotel staff were helpful , the hotel experience overall was good....

column3: Home away from home - always with Mövenpick
column4: Excellent as it has to be at Mövenpick! Great an very quiet room a 9th floor, perfect pillows, restaurant with usual good service, wine served per glass, concierge very helpful for reconfirmation of tickets and taxi organized to the airport at 0315 a.m. Thank you!

Good Location, Great Customer Service, Buffet style Dining Room, extensive choice of food, Helpful staff, made my Business trip worth the stopover. I normally avoid Casablanca, this hotel made me want to come back...............Thanx Movenpick

I am glad to choose MovenPick hotel for my first stay in Morocco. Easy to find and best location I would say. The staff are nice and passionate at their work. The hotel service is good. It provide a very good image to me, about Morocco, Casablanca overall.

We stayed for one night in Casablanca at the Movenpick. It's in a good central location within ten minutes (taxi/tram) of both the main train stations. Check in staff were friendly. The room (a queen double) was a decent size with a small sofa and a large comfy bed. The room was very clean and comfortable. Plus points... nice,clean modern room with an extensive 24hr room service menu. Food was excellent. Gym, although small 24hrs too. Bad points.... any time in the Spa has to be prebooked including sauna/steam and is not free. Breakfast in the restaurant was poor... staff slow to serve and kept disappearing with an average selection of food for a top hotel. The room service breakfast menu was extensive so maybe I'd take it in the room next time. Overall, very good would stay…

Movenpick Casa is good hotel for business In city center and near from Tram station Hotel room are big and clean Covered with all services and free WiFi Hotel resturants are very good quality Recommend the resturant at -1 level with traditional Morocon food On the roof, nice view with nice pool, Also very good SPA Prices little bit expensive depends on the timing

The hotel is located in the business centre of the city (banking district) and on the cross of main roads and tram line. it is slightly dated in room decoration and all carpets should be replaced or at least properly cleaned. The rooms are of a good size and have all what you need. The breakfast has very reach selection of cold and hot dishes and also good selection of starters, fruit and sweets. There is a very well equipped gym which is not much used, so no problem to choose equipment. The swimming pool on the roof is small but as water was rather cold (late September) not visited but nice to use in the morning and late afternoon to refresh. The towel is provided by spa staff. The staff strictly close it at 7 p.m. which is early. The hamman and other spa services are…

not bad not good decent hotel in the city centre without any big experience to be named. confort of the room was ok but the cleanness of bathtub was very poor. the restaurant on the rooftop was nice however took long time to get the dinner.. shushi which is cold food and took about 40 minutes.

We stayed here one night upon arriving in Morocco, before joining our tour. As we subsequently discovered there are many bad hotels in Morocco but for the price we paid for the Movenpick we expected a much higher quality. It is very expensive for what you get. The mini bar is exorbitantly expensive - about $7 AU for a small can of coke or a big bottle of water. The rooftop restaurant menu range is limited (sushi?) and the downstairs restaurant looked terrible. We ended up getting room service which was pretty good. The Red cafe across the road does an excellent breakfast special - thoroughly recommend it. All in all - not recommended. We're currently staying in a Riad in Marrakech which is beautiful and half the price. Perhaps explore the availability of these in…

It has a small lobby you may not like. Restaurant is perfect. Breakfast and dinner buffet is good. Rooms are big and nicely decorated. Good toiletries and amenities. Housekeeping is good. Internet speed is not that good.

column3: Nice roof terrace! Functional, clean, spacious rooms!
column4: While on business stayed in this hotel. Location is perfect if you want to walk to some major attractions and/or restaurants. Room was spacious and had a separate room for the closet / storage. Bathroom contains a bath tub. Beds is kingsize and is comfortable. The skybar is a great place to relax after a busy day. Provides a nice view of the city!

i did stay in this hotel for the first time ,and i was really wowed by the quality of service of the front office staff: professionnal & quick check in, Rooms are clean. special thanks to Mr Meliani the rooms division manager of his effeciency and professionnalism.

column3: I had an amazing stay in Movenpick casa
column4: The hotel is wonderful has the best amenties, really it was an enjoyable stay over there, and the staff were lovely and very professional I would like to thank all of them specially Mr. Elmeliani for been kind and helpful and for making our stay unforgettable

Very nice hotel, great room, exciting roof terras for evening drink and sushi. Friendly and professional staff. Valley parking inclusief. Very recommended to stay, when visiting Casablanca. Swimmingpool (smal) on the rooftop.

In the heart of Casablanca, the staff of this five start hotel is dedicated to provide excellent services. We stayed from September 20 until October 4, 2016. The breakfast was included in our price. From the door men to Ms. Soukaina at the 16th floor terrace restaurant and pool, from the ladies cleaning the room to the personnel serving breakfast, the team works very hard to make sure you enjoy your stay. For example, at the breakfast where the choice is excellent, you can ask for different things that are not on their buffet. If they have it, they will provide them to you at no extra cost. Our room was large, modern and beautiful. When we arrived, the internet was not working in the room. They made the adjustment by switching to alternate internet connection available…

column3: 5 star rooms but poor food and service
column4: Lovely rooms, almost exceptional. However the food at 00 level was not that great, it was expensive and service was virtually nil. A real shame as this could be a blockbuster place to stay. Breakfasts are good with a selection of everything from local to international foods. Venue is within walking distance to most venues and the tram is right outside. As a five star hotel it was a shame the food and service was not up to scratch, but there are plenty of good quality restaurants close by, so try those. The fact that the restaurant OO was empty should have told us something.

Average service at breakfast. Poor cleanliness of china and cutlery at breakfast. The rest was good. Value in relation to price unfortunately below average and not a mövenpick standard. I do hope that this comment will help this hotel to improve.

We stayed here for a break from more rustic accommodation and were very pleased with our choice. I read some reviews that the food was not good but we had an exceptional dinner in the restaurant on the ground floor. The staff were truly friendly and very welcoming.

column3: Good hotel that needs maintenance and to improve the quality of service at restaurant
column4: The hotel is well located but in urgent need of maintenance. Service is average except in restaurant where service lacks the necessary expertise and experience. The quality and presentation of the dishes is good but the choice is limited. The prices of wine are out of proportion.

We went there as a travel group and we were sent to an improvised restaurant on the 00 level where the service was very poor, they didn't change the tables and they didn't replace the food. A very bad experience!

column3: The location of this hotel is good right in the centre of Casa. Their restaurants are below average but expensive.
column4: Their rooms are dated we stayed there for three days, door knobs were broken you could not lock the restroom doors. Restaurant for breakfast buffet is super expensive with very poor service I suggest stay away from eating there food quality was not good either. Hotel staff was polite and helpful.

The hotel is central in Casa. To have a quiet room either take a room in the higher floors and one to the back. Everything is clean, and rooms are large, but not luxurious. The difference comes with the friendliness of the people. That is the part I enjoy the most. For dinner, the Arabic restaurant downstairs is very traditional. But the food is good. Breakfast buffet is fine. The restaurant upstairs has nice views, but not so much charme. Since Movenpick took it over, the hotel improved quite a bit although major renovation work was not done.

We stayed here for 8 nights its location is in city centre, right by the hotel there is tram station which takes around 30mins to take you anywhere around the beach and attraction sites...return tickets cost around £1..nice restaurants around too.. restaurant has decent bar and pool with spa on rooftop...The hotel itself is a five star for Moroccan standards and if you are coming from western countries I wouldn't give it five stars for me its a four stars quality maybe the need to refurbish the building but its service is one of the best around... If i was to recommend it I would say go for it...but better hotels are around..e.g. Four seasons

column3: My Bad Experience at Movenpick Hotel Casablanca
column4: I have stayed at previous Movenpick Hotels and this one in Casablanca was the worst hotel experience I have had. From the moment of check-in, the queues were long and there were only two check-in staff members that were at the front desk. I had to remind the staff member that a security deposit was already taken from my account and was very surprised that he was not aware of this. They ended up taking 2 security deposits from my account as their machines were not working and I am now awaiting for these funds to be cancelled from their end with an email they were due to send me as confirmation that I still have not received. The room they provided me lacked cleanliness and had a horrible sewage smell. I reported this and it took them 45 minutes to have someone come to my room "to…

The swimming pool picture is deceiving - it is much smaller. The staff were friendly enough but this was not a five star hotel experience we were expecting. The restaurant food options are very limited.

Besides the fact that the rooms are very tired to say the least, and do not reflect 5 star qualify, I had 2 very unpleasant experiences at this hotel : 1- At my arrival I went to the rooftop pool straight away, since it was one of the reasons I picked this hotel over the sofitel or fourseasons. At my arrival to the pool I asked the bar tender "soukaina" for the menu so that I can order some drinks. She did bring the menu and last minute decided not to serve me because it was "eid" and that it was forbidden to serve moroccan guests, I showed my US passport and I assured her that I am not muslim, but she would still refuse to serve me and went on a personal conversation about my faith and my name that sounds "moroccan" or "muslim" , she was serving other customers which felt very…

I liked casablanca because of this hotel. I would sure come back to this nice hotel. Miss Fatima in the reception was so friendly and professional. Everyone was so kind and helpful. Nice food. Restaurants in the hotel was perfect and prices sooo good compared to other 5 stars hotels

I liked the politeness of staff, the cleanliness of the rooms, the welcoming of the front door staff, the closs locality to the city centre and Casa port. I liked my room upgrade, it was much better than the room I enitialy got. I liked the roof top pool; an excellent bonus to a business trip. Wifi was excellent in the rooms too, which is a necessity in today's era!

column3: One of the best hotels in Casablanca
column4: I would recommend you all to stay at movenpick Casablanca and you all will experience yourself the facilities service and atmosphere of the hotel is truly amazing. I'm looking forward for my next stay just in few days as its a homely feeling for me to stay at movenpick Casa

Stayed for just one night at Movenpick. Staff very friendly and got an incredible room. Had a great dinner at restaurant and had an incredible breakfast on the next day. Found price reasonable for what is offered.

The stay was with family for vacation in Morocco. I would say I was NOT impressed at all on the service. This is just typical hospitality (or lack thereof) you would expect from Moroccan. The room size was small and the room was marginally clean and prepared. Breakfast was very minimal, very long wait time for ordering anything (espresso, omelet, etc) and the taste was very plain, given the general Moroccan cuisine are rich on spice. Definitely won't stay again in the future

We arrived by rental car from the airport. Surprise : valet parking. I had reserved 2 standard rooms (4 people). At the check-in we got 2 communicating rooms, one of which was a luxury room. Beautiful room, swiss cleanliness. Breakfast was superb; fantastic buffet. All staff was extremely helpful and friendly. On the rooftop, small pool, excelllent late night food service. Sushi and tapas. The hotel has several different cuisine restaurants, one of which is Moroccan. Unless you are a fan of moroccan music and belly-dancing, we advise against. A classic tagine will cost you more than 20 €. Final note. This hotel deserves every one of its 5 stars.

column3: Very Nice Hotel. Food Over Priced.
column4: This is definitely a nice hotel. We enjoyed everything about it. However, the food is ridiculously over priced. We made the mistake of getting the breakfast in the restaurant. All the tables were dirty. Crumbs on the tables, smudges on the glasses and cups. Not what you expect from a 280 DAR breakfast (about 50$). It was a buffet style breakfast, but they ran out of eggs, so we didn`t get any. we stayed until the end and they never filled up the egg stations again. We had to eat our yogurts with a fork because it was impossible to get service to request a spoon (no spoons on any of the tables). I mean, if we had paid 30 DAR for this, we wouldn't complain, but charging 280 DAR each person, you expect much more. We got much less. Very disapointing. So too bad for us. So we…

Very nice, clean and comfortable hotel with a okay location The style of the lobby, restaurant area etc was just after my head If I go to Morocco again I will defiantly stay on this hotel again, thank you

The location is very strategic. Near from almost everything in Casablanca. Both business, shopping and touristic areas. The room was large, clean and comfortable. Staff were very friendly and helpful. The breakfast has good variety.

The rooms are a good standard, the lobby and rooftop terrace are very welcoming. I would have enjoyed my stay if it hadn't been bothered by countless little annoyances such as the daily struggle to get a spoon at breakfast (supply seems short!), getting a wake-up call 2 mornings in a row when I hadn't ordered one, the surprise to realize that you are only offered drinking water in the room on the first day (for some reason), the swimming pool closed because of a private event, etc. It's been ok but next time I would try another place.

Awful hotel, from staff to cleanliness, passing by food and amenities. You don't get for the value of your money (rooms are very small, towels are so dirty that they are grey, breakfast is very poor and you still pay 25€ for it...). The wifi is not working well in the rooms, you book a king size bed and you get 2 tiny beds... No early check-in if you arrive early morning and you have to pay a full day charge ... This hotel doesn't deserve more than 2 stars! Some staff members (the receptionist Abdelmadjid and his manager Mourad) are very rude, unprofessional and do not care about customer satisfaction . I will never book ever again in this hotel...

Stayed here because it had a roof top pool, which in the end I didn't use as it was small and overlooked by the bar and many staff waiting around. Views were good though. Room was fine, clean but not very spacious. Fridge didn't work well. Fine for a couple of days.

I have been in the same hotel one year ago It is still amazing in all aspects. Staff is smiling & very helpful. Rooms are very good & clean. Restaurant during Breakfast is excellent. You can try the spa & massage above they are great & professional. i love this hotel & will stay there again & again.

Location is good, but I was very disappointed, this movenpick doesn't have the standards from other movenpick hotels. Air conditioning problems in the hotel, very bad smell, room not clean. Check in very long, only one receptionist, was waiting 20mn everytime going to reception. Breakfast was fine, but not enough staff to serve ppl, dirty and again bad smell.

We are a family of 3 and staying for 1 night to transit back home .The room is modern and the bed is comfortable , with complimentary water. Everything is fine until we realise its not ready for 3 people ( adults ) There is only 1 king bed and a sofa( not sofa bed) , two cups and 2 sets of towels, and 1 pair of slippers .Obviously it's not ready for us to check in , so I called reception for all these issues and he brushes me off and said okay I will bring everything up . So we left the hotel expecting it should be fixed by the time we come back . Later that night it was still the same and I have called the reception 3-4 times and none of these calls got through. Another odd thing was that at around 10 pm 1 room cleaner open the door as if she is checking on something . Having…

Stayed here for 4 nights The hotel is well located in the center of the city which means that the attractions are quickly reached with the red taxi. The staff was mostly friendly and helpfull. Be aware that you get a room on the higher levels or on the back side of the hotel because on the street side the noise of the street is loud. For the price paid for the breakfast i should have expect a bit more to me it was a bit basic and every day the same. The service could be better it is a bit disorganised. From the swimmingpool on the roof you should not expect to much it is there you can swim but thats it. The fitness room is good and was during the times that i was there always quiet. The parking of our car was very easy and free of charge. The wifi was working very good and…

There must be more arranged taxis and tour guides to the city. Also, family tour must be established. Fixed prices of taxi must be listed too. I think the price didn't match the value of the stay. I thought there were 2 swimming pools though!!

Hotel was located well, staff were very friendly and helpful and the breakfast was very good. The tram was located at the front door with short trip to downtown. The tram was clean and cheap and easy to use.

column3: Great way to end my trip
column4: The staff are amazing, the food was awesome I can not fault anything. From the moment I arrived, the staff could not have been more helpful, the level of customer service was brilliant. I would definitely recommend the hotel to anyone I had an amazing 4 days - I didn't want to leave

Really really really good. excellent, rooms, awesome pool, great location, family friendly, and good for singles as well. Great value for the price offered, 5/7, would go again if I was to ever visit Casablanca again.

We stayed over a week in Movenpick - very nice hotel with good restaurant, gym and very nice splash roof pool which was the best thing for kids. The gym was reasonable with functioning equipment. The location of the hotel is very good and central. We used taxis initially but then discovered the tram and then no more taxis. Good and friendly staff. The only complaint I can think of is the extra bed we received was not comfortable and they couldn't replace it with a new one.

Hotel was comfortable and affordable. Breakfast was okay. Not a full range but basic and tasty. Staff were friendly and helpful. Room was clean and neat. Pool area was a little small. Lovely bathroom. Wifi connection was not working on the floor we stayed but management did offer to change our rooms. Overall we enjoyed our stay.

Except for location, everything was really good. Its a good value for money.You wont find any restaurants within walking distance. But other touristic destinations are within reach and easy-to-go from hotel. Moreover, in-room hotel menu doesn't have variety and food is not that good.

The service was excellent and the staff are very welcoming and polite, but the food was very bad in the restaurant and the In room dining I wish you could change this as it impacts on your hotels quality

column3: Hotel Movenpick Should be 5 Star Rated
column4: I recently stayed at this Hotel which provides a high degree of luxury with excellent service and a restaurant that provides a delicious buffet breakfast and diner. The rooms are excellently appointed with luxurious bathrooms and all rooms have good wifi and are quiet due to the double glazing. The staff are a great team who make you feel really special. It is excellent value for money.

Friendly staff and clean hotel. However, rooms are over priced and food lacked variation. Location is excellent. You can easily access all the central attractions in Casablanca, many of which are walking distance. Taxi fare to and from the airport is reasonable!

nice location, quite, good food, quite atmosphere. the room is a good size, bed is very comfortable. amenities are good quality. most of the staff are friendly, vey helpful and easy to deal with. the pool in the roof is overlooking the city. thank you!

Would recommend this hotel for a business trip but not for a tourists There's other hotels with same price and more touristic facilities. Regretted staying there after seeing and visiting other hotels.

Centrally located. Very Good Rooms. Awsome break fast to start your day with great comfort. Suggest to have more option on food menu especially for lunch and dinner both in room as well as resutrant dinning.

column3: Comfortable hotel in a good location
column4: There are no complaints with the hotel, however Casablanca is not something I would associate with pleasant, friendly or welcoming. If you have to go there, then this is a good hotel to stay at. It's conveniently located near shops and eating places, but I wouldn't rush out to eat or shop. Not the hotel's fault however.

The Movenpick is very well located just opposite a tram station. Rooms are clean and spacious. Breakfast is not on par with European hotels, but overall a good experience. The only problem I faced was on checkout. The bill presented included a number of items from the mini-bar that I had not consumed, although the staff were helpful to sort this out.

We enjoyed a nice and short stay at this hotel. The rooms are clean, the food was good. They have a pool and lounge bar but we couldnt enjoy it as we only stayed for a night. Location was good also to the main attraction points.

column3: Great place to relax in a busy city.
column4: Nice hotel with friendly staff. Swimmingpool and bar area at the roof of the building is fantastic. Clean rooms and comfortable bed. Good location. Would highly recommended to friends and family and definitely would stay in this hotel again.

We arrived very late at the hotel and without a reservation. Mr. Tarik Kerdoudi, Director of Sales & Marketing was at the front desk to greet us. Exhausted from travelling, Mr. Kerdoudi made us feel incredibly welcome. He provided us with a beautiful room at a fantastic rate including breakfast. The room is very comfortable and quiet. We certainly got a great night's sleep. The breakfast buffet was exceptional. We enjoyed our stay so much that we booked our last night in Morocco there. My daughter loved the pool. Thank you so much. Next year, we will return for a longer stay. (Tarik - Best wishes to your boys in Florida on a new school year!)

+ : - good location - roof top pool - restaurant meals - cleaning of the room - : - slow service - front desk not efficient (Fatima) certain issues (had to wait half day to get a crib). Night shift man was helpful - slow service at the bar - valet service was very busy, had to park my car by myself and I had to pay two guys because hotel parking was full - breakfast was showed as included in the price but front desk asked us to pay 36 $ cad per personn - no wi-fi in our room only in the lobby or at the pool

everything was perfect, including location as it was next to a tram station. nice pool on the roof and spacious rooms with very comfortable beds, good wi-fi and air conditioning working very well and quiet. only minus i can find is way too high prices for drinks and food not affordable for ordinary guests.

It was a traffic challenge to get to the Hotel since it's in the middle of the City. Staff are nice. And they speak English, since I don't speak French. Room is nice and clean. View was great, Took the City view. Food choices is Ok. Restaurant is relaxing. I would recommend the hotel, for a few days only.

Our family (ten of us) stayed at the Movenpick Hotel Casablanca for nearly a week. The staff is superb in their level of care and consideration! From the doorman to the chamber maids, Movenpick Casablanca chose caring people who went above and beyond their job to help our large family enjoy our first time in Morocco! Housekeepers, Zinab and Naima, worked especially hard on our joint suites and did a fabulous job with ensuring we had clean rooms and fully stocked toiletries. Will definitely stay here again if we go to Casablanca again.

column3: Certainly not a five star standard
column4: We arrived at 11.30pm after travelling for 5 hours. There was one staff member at reception, Ahemd was his name; who proceeded to tell me that the hotel was actually fully booked and so they did not have a room for us even though I had received a confirmation email from the hotel 3 days prior and they had taken the money out of my account the morning of our arrival - something which they later denied; thank god for online banking is all I'll say. He then told us that there was a room available in another hotel not too far from where we were. However, he would not tell us the name or the address of this other hotel; at this point, I asked for the manager. We were told he would be 5 minutes. The manager arrived 35 minutes later; which meant it was now 12.45am. The manager…

At check out the front desk Sefianclaimed that he has refunded to us tge deposit while he did not. We felt really humiliated. After examing the Cameras it proved that no refund was given back. Therefore they refunded to us the deposit after 2 hours wait.

excellent area close to train and everywhere ,nice and caring staff and the breakfast was excellent it is truly five star hotel i would re command to anyone specially families. i had a little problem using the internet since there were no computer to use

I booked direct and was pleasantly surprised to find the rates comparable to Ibis, which is a budget hotel close to Casaport. This is more like a 4-star hotel. HIgh end spa, lovely rooftop with a swimming pool. The resturant staff on the rooftop were the most pleasant of all staff. They allowed my friends to use the pool after closing time for a quick swim on a very hot day. The food from the grill was great too, authentic Moroccan sausages and meats. I got $20 off by booking direct, but I had to remind the checkin staff as well restaurant staff about the discount (they apply discount towards breakfast). Check in staff also placed a pre-auth on the credit card for 50% more than the room rate. I am guessing its standard practice in Morocco, but they didn't inform me about the…

The hotel was good, the staff were nice and rooms were clean They have free parking and the wifi is decent not the best speed There not a lot of things to see by foot in the surroundings you have to take a car to see some good places

very good hotel. rooms are very big with a very confortable bed. It is King size. Gym is fantastic. The terrace with its swimming pool is very chic. Maybe check in could be more cool. In general very good Hotel to be in Casablanca.

80% of staff was friendly but as i said you have to review the mini bar price and the security inside the room coz its not secured you cant keep your stuff without lock coz maybe it will be stolen as what happen for the mini bar but hopfully the front desk they solve the issue

column3: Not good for business trips, not fit for the 5-star rank
column4: I spent two nights in the hotel for business and while the room was quite clean, the washroom was not, as the toilette showed signs of pee spots on the floor from previous guests. This is unacceptable as the housecleaning must include washing the floor of the toilette every day. I don't compromise for hygiene. And the second day it was the same which means that housekeeping staff wasn't simply having this duty in their check list. The first day only I found complimentary water, not the second day: another disappointment. The restaurant where I had breakfast was without AC or anyway AC was not properly working. In the corridors and in the whole hotel there was an annoying stink of dirt. From business perspective, the wifi is very terrible, so it's quite difficult to work and…

column3: Never again! Poor service and no wifi!
column4: No wifi in a business hotel. Lobby staff are not equipped to handle business travellers. Service was very low standard. Breakfast was okay. The service in their Skybar was extremely slow. A business guest I was entering waited 35 minutes for a drink.

my 2nd stay in this hotel and it was a very good experience , preferred hotel in Casablanca , the over all atmosphere is good and pretty much in the center of the city easy to go to anyplace in addition to the welcoming attitude of all the staff

I had visited Casablanca for 6 days. At the end of my stay, I had an issue with my flight back. The flight was delayed for a long time and the gentlement on the front desk has help me a lot about the issue. The whole stay was very comfortable.

The 16th floor is very good for dinner ! I would like to stay again if I visit again ! The location is also very convenient for the guests but the parking lot or parking service is not yet solved. Hope to see you again !

The hotel is well located in the financial district in casablanca. Always greeted by concierges with a decent service. The rooms are well maintained however room service starts to decline with every day one spends at the hotel. Although there are signs saying that unless you place this sign on the sheets for them not to change the linen, they still don't change the linen! Been staying here for a week and have marked the sheets with a pencil, only to find that it is still the same! Different days, different items go missing from the room such as spoons, glasses, bath carpet, toilet paper, hair dryer! Unfortunately in morocco every driver seem to be fascinated by the car horn... this doesn't go very well with single glazed windows that give you the feel of being in the road even…

One of the 3 decent hotels in Casablanca, but very poor service at breakfast and diner. Room service and room quality quite good, and very clean hotel. But exceptionally disappointed with service level.

The hotel is classified as 5 star, in my opinion its only 4 star hotel. There isn't that much facilities in the hotel for entertainment moreover the food prices are very high. Paying more than US$30 for a breakfast is too much. Moreover, i requested one night extension; they charged me almost double. I had some relatives there and I tried to bring them into my room for 2-3 hours;;;; they refused and one of the staff follow us in the elevator to tell them its not allowed. He is even polite in how to convey the message.

It's the second time I visit the hotel. I was there last year and liked it but this time I'm surprised by the emprovement done: - Room: confort & cleanliness of first class / room maids very freindly and always smiling with welcoming attitude / Very good quality of towels and bathroom amenities (offering more amenities than before) - Reception: larger and more representative desk / Cozy / Clean with great staff, very friendly and helpfull / I liked the new staff uniforms which are more representative of the good service that Movenpick offers - Main restaurant: Cozy and offers good breakfast quality and variety / Staff friendly and very helpful - Spa: Clean and relaxing atmosphere with nice chill out music and great service. Bravoo Thanks to all Movenpick Team and its Managment

Staff at this hotel are very friendly and helpful. They go the extra mile to help you. Rooms are not that big but are of a good standard. Shower part of bath is rather small which leads to water on the bathroom floor. Rooftop pool is small but also well maintained. Food and drinks are of good quality.

We had a triple room. The windows were so filthy you could barely see out of them. The curtains were all falling down. The hairdryer in the bathroom was not working. Had to get another one from reception. The one afternoon we were sitting at the pool and at 4.30pm we were asked to move from the pool as they wanted to make tables for the Ramadam meal that they serve to private guests.

column3: Great place to stay in casablanca
column4: My friends and I had a great & enjoyable stay at this hotel. The staff provided great service. The hotel is also close to few cafes & convenience store to buy some essentials water etc. Also close to tram station

Hotel is clean and team is very friendly. The pool on the roof is a little bit small but very clean. They have a big tv screen which was great for watching euro soccer ! Price are similar from Europe and could be cheaper for Morroco...

Well located facility (close to tramway) in Casablanca - Sense of hospitality - readiness to help. A bit disappointed though by the dinners I took in my room : plentiful but quite savourless (though maybe not the best place to enjoy a... couscous ;-)

Spend 2 nights i this hotel recently and overall it's not a bad hotel but nothing really stand-out. The hotel is ideally situated if you are conducting business as it is in the Business District, the downside to this unfortunately is it is quite far from the many restaurants in the city. Rooms are quite comfortable and spacious, beds are very comfortable and linen is crisp, clean and changed daily. The windows cannot open which is not ideal if you want some fresh air in your room Staff are friendly and attentive making the guest experience quite pleasant. The ground floor restaurant is nice, has a good ambience and lovely decor providing a good atmosphere. The Cigar/Piano Lounge and bar in the mezzanine level is unfortunately quite dead and lifeless; no atmosphere,…

column3: Great hotel in the heart of Casablanca
column4: Check in was very easy, I got there 2 hours before check in time but they allowed me to access my room. I didn't have the correct converter and I was able to borrow one from the hotel, which was wonderful. The hotel is within walking distance of the Palace, Cathedral and other tourist attractions. An easy cab ride to the mosque, etc. The gym was great, very clean! Room service and the lounge was fast and delicious. The room was excellent. I highly recommend this hotel.

Exceptional service, every employee was friendly and helpful Room was clean, I had a nice evening on a Ramadan event and so forth. Because I wanted to watch a soccer match the hotel opend up bar early.

My wife and I stated here for 2 nights while we were in Casablanca. It was a nice place to stay but there wasn't anything overly special, just a relatively upscale hotel thats business travel oriented. The room was clean, location was ok, we walked to most restaurants that we had interest in going to.

column3: Very good for a short stay
column4: We only stayed in Casablanca for 1 night before moving on to Fez though with hindsight we would have stayed for 2 nights as Casablanca as a city has more to offer than we had anticipated. Hotel itself is more of a business hotel than for tourists but is well placed to walk towards the magnificent King Hassan II mosque in one direction , maybe 30 mins (unfortunately we were too pressed for time to go inside on a tour) and the old medinat area in the other direction (20 mins). Room and bed are nice and comfortable as is the shower. We only had breakfast which was fine and the reception staff are also helpful. Unfortunately the concierge was not very helpful suggesting higher prices for cabs than was the case and in one instance when I was haggling with a cabbie trying to…

Very good hotel especially for business trip, literally street crossing from the major Moroccan banks headquarters. Good service in general, nice rooms even though not very spacious (normal double room), good breakfast service. The wifi was not working though in my room, and the laundry service staff leaves quite early (could not get a jacket ironed one day before my meetings by 07:30pm!, managed to get it ironed early in the morning but had to pay express service for that...).

Good hotel but the room triple its not good because they give a portable bed and you pay as well for a good bed The hotel is very good and have a lot of facilites to discover and take your Time do relax

It is a fair hotel for a short stay in Casablanca. There are a few things to improve, but overall it was a fair experience. The room is big enough and it is clean. What I did not like at all was the noise during the day. I arrived in the morning after a night tiring flight and the drivers in Casablanca have this bad habit of honking very fast at the traffic light: So...extremely noisy.

Short trip to Casablanca for business. Hotel is very clean and has excellent location. Within 25 minutes by tram to the beach, within 15 minutes to Casablanca train station. Room was little bit noisy which was expected due to central location

column3: Central to the city; great stsff
column4: This was our first stop on our Morocco tour and after a very stressful 24 hours coming in this was a pleasant surprise. The staff was very helpful, our room was spacious and clean and we were dead centre of the city. Rooftop bar and pool was quite nice aside from the traffic you can still hear twenty stories down. Restaurant had a lovely breakfast buffet.

I prebooked, so had to stay a second time on way out of morroco. WiFi was intermittent at best. Rooms looked fancy, but lots of things wrong or missing (e.g., fan not working in bathroom, room directory missing). Second stay the phone labels were missing, so I called reception to ask to be out through to room service. They were annoyed I didn't dial directly and told me to do so next time. Location is not great. And getting taxi from train station is a rip off. Tip: exit station (you'll see ibis in the right) and go directly straight across little car park to tram. Take tram in direction you just walked (away from station, right side entry). Get off at Avenue Hassan II. When you get off, you must walk right to exit, then go back left and it's about 10m away on the corner…

This is a very nice modern hotel with good amenities. I arrived in Casablanca via train and took a taxi to the hotel which after much negotiation was able to get for 40 MAD. Many of the taxi's will tell you that the meter is broken so that they can charge more but I found 40-50 MAD is the standard rate. The hotel is situated in the business part of town so it's far from restaurants. The hotel is also about 15 min taxi ride to the Casablanca Mall which is by the ocean. The hotel has good size rooms with your standard emmeneties. The beds are comfortable and clean. The hotel has a rooftop pool with a bar, a spa as well as a restaurant which is on the pricier side.There is also a small fitness room with treadmills and free weight which is free to use. Be prepared to pay a city tax…

Stayed in this hotel for 3 nights n the horrible experience started from day 1. The staff named Jalila (or Julila I forgot exactly but I have her photo if you want) has bad attitude towards guests with no smile and unhappy working attitude. Rooms booked through booking.com was said to be not found in the system and she asked us to call booking.com by ourselves. She was holding our passports and asked us to wait. She couldn't solve the problem and asked us to look for a solution and stay somewhere else! What a suggestion, yeah? But it's true. The front desk manager only works until 5:30-6pm, so if you have any problem after that hour, you can only talk to staff like Julila and her colleague Fatima (who is also as unfriendly as her). Internet in several floors is hopeless. They…

Kindness, smiles and attention to detail. I found the room very neat and tidy room, value for very good price, the location for those arriving in Casablanca for business perfect. The indications of the staff to get around the city have always been useful and accurate, and therefore very important for someone like me, he comes in Casablanca for the first time. Thank you

Ok hotel. Small rooms, but cleane, and good rooms, comfortable beds. Very quiet hotel. The pool is ok - but a little small, and only 4 sunbeds avalible. The breakfast is ok - but unfortnatly some of the staffhave problems understanding english.

column3: A real pleasant place to stay
column4: In town, very clean and confortable hotel ! Restaurant at the top Issy good, with a pleasant view on Casa. Breakfast is too expensive but with various meals. Don't expect to swim, too small but nice for a drink around.

Standard hotel. Conveniently located, by the tram line - though taxis in Casablanca are cheap and convenient. We had very slow check-in and check-out. The breakfast was crazily expensive - and the price was unknown until we got the receipt.

I have been staying in this hotel since last few years, repeated it not due to good quality but due to the fact that it's very close to my workplace in Casablanca. Rooms were of good size, however this hotel has always kind of smell, which never went away despite, the name change.

column3: Good western hotel in a average location
column4: It was a pleasure to come to a Western hotel after staying only in Riads all over Morocco, but this hotel was a little disappointing. The lobby is rather small and cramped, breakfast was not as good as in the Riads, and there was no view from the room. The bed was comfortable though and the small bathroom was very average.the location a little far from the center and one had to walk around 15-20 min to get to the old Medina. Overall it is an above average hotel is a mid - location.

Excellent location and friendly staff good value for money The rooms were Clem but carpet at Casablanca needs to be replaced by new carpet or preferably marble or wooden floor which is more hygienic option

column3: It is not a 5 stars hotel
column4: The hotel is not so bad but when you choose an "occidental" hotel chain as Melia, Hilton, Sheraton, Hyatt, Sofitel or .... Mouvenpick it is because you expect a "guaranteed quality" mainly in countries as per on the North Africa where local hotel chains compete in the medium to high end. I have been at Mouvenpick Berlin and here in Morocco and quality is not the same. INternational Hotel Chains must take care of this if they want to remain at the forefront of popularity and customer fidelity.

Nice Hotel thanks to his staff in particular HICHAM who assist us to fix our car during our stay,,,he speaks perfectly Spanish and was very welcoming and present during our 2 days in this nice Hotel..

i had paid to be treated well in a five star hotel.. but unfortunately your hotel in casablanca was terrible... starting from the front desk one of the receptionists his name is abdelhamid and he was very very rude... i was complaining that there is a bad smell in my room and my sister room but no body cared to take an action and solve my problem.

column3: Don't be fooled by pool picture
column4: This is not a terrible hotel--it is a centrally located, comparatively reasonably priced hotel with rooms that are average sized and reasonably comfortable if a bit dark. But for a tourist I think there are better options, and I had a couple of annoying problems: 1. The internet had huge problems during my visit (they say they are fixing it and gave me an alternate transmitter for my room). 2. They wouldn't let me into the breakfast buffet wearing a sleeveless shirt, and barred my entry in a very embarrassing public way. this was particularly rich given all the people in track pants and the dirty table sitting there without being cleaned even as clients sought to find someplace to sit down that wasn't dirty. After that every morning involved some anxiety over whether we were…

Comfortable hotel in a very good location for business purposes. Very clean and safe. No wifi at lobby but good connection in rooms (at least at mine). Very comfortable bed. Bathroom amenities on average.

Stayed one night at the Movenpic but I have to say i was a bit disappointed. The lobby was small and needed freshening up. The hallways , carpets and definitely the rooms needs some attention or maybe replacing. Obviously this is a older hotel that has been taken over by the Movenpic. Its expensive but central. Would i stay here again.. if i had to for the right price.

We stayed in the Movenpick for 1 night. The check in was not terribly organized but worked out. The room was comfortable with flat screen TV and WiFi. We ordered ice for our drinks in the room and it was delivered quickly. The location is excellent. Right in the city centre. We went to Rick's cafe where the original movie is said to be filmed. It was a fun filled place with the movie Casablanca playing on a big screen TV. Good drinks and snacks.

very good central and quiet hotel. nice personnel clean rooms good service nice emplyees good hotel fo business well loicated and quality service many employees at your disposal good information service

The staff is very kind and helpful. The room is clean with all what you need. The pool and the bar at the roof top are very charming with very beautiful view. I recommend it more for business trip because during the week , you can't sleep more than 8am because of horns.

This location is conveniently located at a stop on the tram. It is a twenty minute walk from the medina or a three minute tram ride. It is a bit far from the boardwalk which is where all the nightlife is. It's about a 25 minute tram ride and five minute walk from there. It' s a beautiful hotel with a gorgeous rooftop restaurant and pool that sees the whole city. The staff is super nice, from the front desk to the service in the restaurants. I would stay here again especially for the price!

windows room cannot open an air ventilation was bad in the bathroom . we are very happy by arrival and almost everything was perfect then a again location was perfect/ staff very friendly an proffesionnal. thight hotel! excellent

Top-notch European style and luxury. Great central location. Staff are attentive, friendly and welcoming. Roof-top patio, pool and restaurant a very cool place to hang out. Concierge was very helpful and accommodating.

Excellent hotel. All facilities are well maintained. Big and confortable rooms. Nice bar on the 16th floor beside the swimming pool. very well located in the middle of the financial center of Casablanca. Very quiet although this is a very noisy area because of the traffic.

very clean . staff are very helpfu and pleasant .l . centrally located to go elswhere especially to the sea port or to to the magnfesent souk alahbas. I strongly recommend it .the food varieties are great , but we chose to eat in ouside resturants . If I have to go again I will make sure that my package do includeat least breakfast .

column3: Very good but not a perfect 5.0
column4: Stayed here 6 nights and overall it was very good. Breakfast bar is superb with international and local foods. As lunch/dinner also impressive. Very good wifi and attentive service overall. My disappointment was clogged sink basin and bath that was not fixed after 2 notifications. Also front desk staff were either culturally inept sometimes or rude. Either way they were not s friendly as dining and door staff. This is why I would have preferred a 4.5. I would not avoid this hotel in the future. It's a fine business hotel and convenient. Absolutely great roof garden/bar that perfect for relaxing.

We had a great experience, we did like the hotel, the staff were great and helpful. The room were clean, the hotel is located in the downtown Casablanca, walking distance from shops, coffee shops and restaurant The bar at the 16 floor has one of the nice view of the city.

You get a lot for the Price. Staff always very polite and helpfull. I am staying there for 2 years regularly. The breakfast has a lot of variety. From the bar in 16th floor you have a nice view to Casblanca.

The Moevenpick Hotel Casablanca is an excellent value for the money, especially if you choose the pre-paid room with breakfast. The hotel has a decent gym, restaurant, and roof top bar with a great view of the city.

column3: Lovely fragrant lobby, fantastic staff and roof terrace to die for !
column4: The first thing that strikes you on entering the Möwenpick lobby is the wonderful sweet smell ! Staff are super-friendly, efficient and helpful. My room was spacious and spotlessly clean, as were the other areas I visited. The 16th floor bar, restaurant, terrace and pool area is fantastic, although the drinks and food are quite expensive. Choice and volume of background music was great. Don't forget that, at breakfast, you can also order omelettes and other items that are not out on display. I found that several taxi-drivers did not seem to know or understand the name of the hotel - my client told me this was because it used to be a Holiday Inn, but that didn't seem to work with the taxi drivers either ! "Rond-point Hassan 2" seemed to work.

Everything is great in the hotel, but I recommend you change the windows glasses to a double glass type ( double vitrage) to minimize the noise coming from the cars outside in the morning. The rest is great.

Good location. Rooms are clean and spacious. Staff are extremely friendly. For those who are looking for a good gym during their stay (with weights), this hotel is not the right pick; however, you will manage. Breakfast was so so but you will expect a better breakfast in such hotels. Wi-Fi is free but annoying as it kept on disconnecting. In brief, this is a recommended hotel and I will consider visiting it again

The most valuable asset of this hotel is doubtlessly its people : everybody is soooo cheerfull and smiling! Ready to help at anytime on any occasion. Receptionists, concierges, waiters/tresses, are great professionnals and they obviously love their jobs! The hotel is fine though it needs some refurbishement in some areas. Paintts are getting old, curtains also, but it is ok. Lodging costs are fine but any other service is quite expensive, particularly the food and beverages : a coke would cost you 10 times its price in the closer shop... Our group of 5 visitors was charged around 90 Euros for a transfert from the airport which I found somehow expensive...on return we had 2 taxis for 60 Euros! If you do not smoke, don't try to reach the lounge, on the roof top : you will…

Overall a reasonably good experience. Breakfast is quite good. Dinners in the buffet are not consistent, some days much better than others.. Moroccan sweets can be more fresh. Overall a fair to good experience.

The hotel was on the surface a great looking hotel, however the service didn't meet expectations.. From the point of check in, to service at breakfast to the check out process the staff all needed to be retrained.. Having experienced impeccable service at the Riads in Marrakesh and fez.. We were disappointed that movenpick just missed the mark

Overall good hotel, front of house staff very helpful and friendly. Rooms clean and décor OK with comfortable bed and pillows. The biggest disappointment with the hotel was the dining experience both for breakfast and dinner, service slow and quality of the buffet

This is a nice hotel in a decent central location. Unfortunately for us, the 14th floor seems to be below either the washing machines or some other machinery which was very noise late into the night. We complained and the management offered a change of room and provided a free breakfast, but it was a blt disappoining for a hotel of this calibre.

column3: What a way to celebrate my son's birthday
column4: Great hotel with really exceptional guest service. It was my son's 13th birthday on the day we checked in. The registration person noticed this (from his passport) and secretly ordered a birthday cake sent to our room. My son was surprised and, of course, psyched about the cake. At dinner, when my son advertised that it was his birthday, the manager sent us cookies with a candle to the table. Again, really wonderful and memorable experience! Besides this, everyone went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable.

It's one of the most beautiful, calm and nice hotels I have experienced in my life, I thank all the stuff starting from the reception to everyone one on this kind place, the place you feel a real home with a very high hospitality, good food and service. I recommend it to everyone visiting Casablanca

First time for me in this Hotel, Very professional and Clean . I will suggest this Hotel for business people. Its not exactly for the family. Very nice view on the 16 floor with a restaurant , swimming pool and Spa. Perfect for 3/4 days. Easy to get Taxi. ( very important )

really noisy during the day and the night, you can't find a parking spot beside the place. Also don't try to take a walk during the night . Good food nice view ,should visit their swimming pool .Staff are okay .

had the pleasure of staying at Beach Movenpick Hotel Casablanca this weekend and enjoyed a fantastic time. From the moment we entered through the front door we found ourselves in a bubble of relaxation and attentiveness, a far cry from the hustle and bustle of the city around us. The concierge and front desk team give you a warm welcome or farewell each time you enter or leave the hotel, the bar team were superb, attentive and very knowledgeable and the Breakfast was fantastic value either for continental or cooked. I would also like to thank the GM Mr. Kellini for his attention during our stay and also for his kindness and professionalism. We were in Casablanca for the first time. I didn't recall mentioning this during the booking process but we were delighted to find a card,…

This is maybe the 6 time that I stay in this hotel.so far one of the best hotel ever in casablanca. Great Location,great service .room are very spacious and clean staffs is very helpful and kind .grandiose pool and terrace.I recommend everyone business or family trip to stay there.

Hotel is just excellent, staff is very professional, welcoming and always ready to assist. Thanks to Mr. Amr, the General Manager and the front office team Fatma and Mustafa for their great support. The food is at high quality and the rooms are very well equipped with all what is needed. The location is also perfect at the city center.

column3: Nice hotel for business stay but perhaps not suitable for children
column4: This hotel in Casablanca is best marketed as a business hotel. If you are traveling on business it is functional and meets the requirements but with children there may be better facilities available elsewhere. The location is very good, a short walk to the Medina and a tram stop outside. The Breakfast service left a lot to desired, they were slow at refilling the buffet and it was took a lot of cajoling of the waiting staff to get a cup of tea. The rooms though were spacious and well catered. The bed was comfortable.

column3: nice hotel in the center of town
column4: i stayed here for 3 nights with my family in March 2016.we enjoyed our stay thoroughly. the rooms are modern, clean and spacious. the rooftop pool is beautiful, and offers lovely views of the city. the breakfast was great, with alot of variety and good service. we had dinner once at the hotel, which was pricey, but very nice. there are plenty of eating places within walking distance of the hotel. there is a tram right in front of the hotel, that can take you to the Corniche or the old Medina.

Arriving to the hotel we prebooked a special car from the airport.Cost 600 and it was an excellent limousine service. Upon the return to the airport we paid the hotel 600 for the same special car to the airport but were stuffed into an ordinary taxi which costs 350, as the driver informed us!

We spend the week end in Casablanca and we found peacefull in the hotel. Easy to find and the people were very kind. We loved the breakfast. Peatty that we could noy enjoy the swimming pool as it was opened but they told us that not been the hot season they did not have chairs.

Great staff, and great services... Big thanks to the FO team Jalila and Mustapha. And the rest of the team the hostesse of the breakfast, and the security guys. Nice hospitality and nice quality of sevices.

Movenpick Casablanca is a nice hotel at the business district of the city. The room we stayed at is very nice and spacious. The services of the hotel are very good including the gym, spa, and extremely nice swimming pool at the roof. The staff are friendly and will take the time to attend to you.

column3: Good location, modern design, great service
column4: Even though this hotel is at a busy intersection, it is surprisingly quiet in the rooms. The hotel and rooms are very modern with European styling. The bathrooms was huge and the bed was comfortable. The wifi was a bit of a challenge. The rooftop bar and pool was so nice! I wish it was warmer outside so we could have jumped in. The cabanas had nice views and were comfortable.

The aesthetics of the property was nice. The WiFi was inconsistent, and the plumbing could use some work. I would have given this place 4 stars, but the staff didn't help us when the taxi drivers outside the front door got upset that we were using private transfers to go to the airport.

I will come back. Good location. Service was excellent. Internet was bad. They have to improve the installations Business center was so bad, no internet connection. Food in the dinner was no so bad, but can be better easily.

Hotel is in a very good condition. Local placed in Casablanca. Sightseeing by foot was possible. I appreciated Service and cleaness of the room. Extention of the stay and Arrangement in the Lobby worked pretty good.

column3: Very bad choise if you think abour a 5 star hotel
column4: bad connetcion wifi, bad service of breakfast and burned coffee if you thonk to stay ina Movenpick 5 stars you are wrong this look like more a 2 star hotel. Of corse the location is perfect with good coneection for business meeting all over the town

Very friendly and helpfull staff. (Gentleman at C/I and gentleman that assisted to the room). Overal beautifull hotel. + clean and comfortable rooms. + WiFi Connection - Room was a lot smaller than expected, with view ar a wall/looking into an office building. - High pricing compared to product received.

The location was not bad and we could walk to the Mosque, the port and the old Medina. The tram runs right in front of hotel. However, it needs a facelift and makeover. The staff were friendly and the rooftop bar is good but they could do a better job taking care of the guests. The bar staff tended to get snippy if you corrected them in any way. It has potential but needs some attention.

column3: Clean rooms, good staff, pleasant stay!
column4: My husband and I stayed at this hotel twice during our visit to Morocco a few weeks ago. Once when we arrived and once right before leaving, a total of 3 nights. The first stay upon arrival our room was a bit tight, but overall very clean and comfortable. The second time around the room was much larger and offered the same comfort. The sheets smelled great, the bed was perfect and the bathroom was very clean (which I'm very picky about). The only negative thing I would have to say is that the half glass wall in the shower was poorly designed and the water seeped out from under it onto the bathroom floor. This is very gross and messy to have to deal with every time someone wants to shower. Overall, not bad and will return if I'm in Morocco again.

First impressions really do count. The exterior is very drab and rather dirty. The same can be said of the staff uniforms - torn, dirty and a mismatch of colours. 3 people on front desk, only one working. Check in took 15 minutes despite having prebooked and paid. As usual, got asked to pay another deposit despite the hotel already holding a sizeable amount. Up to the room through a warren of dirty, old corridors and into an adequately sized area. All amenities are there, they are either of poor quality or tired (bar the TV and bathroom amenities). Example being the kettle which needed a serious decontamination before use. Wifi was not an issue - it works but a bit slow. The on site restaurant is not to be recommended. Sub standard fare and a limited menu. Breakfast was better…

A great spot in Casablanca! The staff, Ghizlane & Tanzia kept the room perfectly clean and tidy. The rooms are large and well eqiuped, and the hotel provides all the necessary services. It is ideally located a close to the city center and the old Medina.

I stayed here for work for 2 nights and left very underwhelmed. The staff were friendly and hotel reasonably clean. When you get to your room, you are greeted with some complimentary water. Good start. However, the wifi was abysmal. I was unable to contact my wife or daughter for 2 days because Whatsapp, Skype and FaceTime did not work. I told staff but was not offered any assistance. As I opted not to get my room tidied, I thought I would ask for more water on day 2. The reception said you only get it on the first day. While hotel was OK, it was nowhere near 5 star. 3 star at best, I have stayed at better 4 star hotels.

It doesn't look and give the service of a 5 star hotel, the staff members were not so friendly and also the rooms were not as expected. I do not recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking to experience a 5 star hotel standard

We spent 2 nights at this hotel. Rooms are well decorated, clean. Bathrooms good size and modern. Meals are well worth with big variety. Catering for vegetarian and others. These were included in our stay. Hotel is about 10 minutes walk from souk (medina) as they call it in Morocco. All in all good value, will stay there again if I visit Morocco again.

column3: Not working wifi, not what you can expect from a Mövenpick hotel -Avoid if you come for business!
column4: I stayed 2 nights in February in this hotel despite the mixed reviews. Please note the wifi problem mentionned by several previous reviewers still exists despite the Manager's feedbacks below. I asked the receptionnist to get some help, he looked at the sheet with a "process" to get another wifi with a name with letters and numbers (meaning he never tried the "Movenpick" network - implicitly admiting it doesn't work) and seeing it didn't work, he advised me to go to the mezzanine floor "because it perhaps works better". Sorry? Is this an answer by a hotel that is full of guests coming for business? I will not come back. The room was OK (a Deluxe for 1600 Dhs/night) but the bed is a bit hard (beds at the Hyatt or Sofitel are much better), it needed some renovation (it becomes…

The location of the is very suitable to discover Casablanca as we can take taxi directly from the door of the hotel and it is a 20 sec from the train station. room very clean only one problem with the sink, breakfast is very good thank you

column3: Cold customer experience coupled with frequent inaccuracies
column4: From the lack of soft skills expressed on the part of the front desk team to the billing inaccuracies which were not resolved, the experience was more like "death by a thousand cuts" than the relaxing experience that I had expected. This was a personal stay, so there was more time and opportunity to pay attention to the close details that separate an "okay" hotel from a "great" hotel...it's a stretch for me to even utter that this was an "okay" experience! If this hotel is your choice destination in Casablanca, approach it with a critical and keen eye for the details, voice your opinion strongly about the lack of service and/or errors that you experience, but be prepared for a lack of response in the end.

I was on a business trip - we were stayinf in a different hotel first part of our trip which was below any decent level. Movenpick is a very nice hotel in its price range - spacious rooms, friendly personnel, good food. Internet is a bit of an issue in the rooms, though int he public areas its very fast

good hotel with good leading, good employees and caring. good check in from the people i met, i would like to thank mr. Amr elkilliny and the receptionist Jawaher , Jalila and Khadija. also i would like to thenk the floor manager miss Hosna, and the employees in the breakfast , Khaled as i remember, also the good smile from mr. abdelhadi the food and drinks manager, in the bar there were good people mostafa, and egyptian person i dont remember his name. in the general this hotel is good and i advice every one

The hotel management should look seriously about the smell in the corridors The rooms are close to the main road - lot of noise Employees all are very helpful and always happy to help - might not consider for next time

column3: Great stay at Movenpick - Mostafa the concierge is the best
column4: We stayed Feb 13 - 16 2016. Location was central in downtown Casablanca, in walking distance of Old Medina, Place Mohammed, Twin Center Casablanca. Mostafa, the conciege, was brilliant. Super warm, friendly, and helped us book a last minute day trip to Marrakech. He was also incredibly helpful making restaurant reservations everywhere we went! Thank you so much!

The hotel is located in the central of business area. Very easy to access the public transportations. Comfortable and good services from the staffs. Facilities are very well managed, and I especially like the bar on the 16th floor.

always get pleased with my long stays in movenpick, nice service and welcoming all the time, very helpful stuff at what ever time you need anything... room are specious and comfy and the bar on the roof top has plays lovely music that goes very well wirh the lovely view

I felt a lot of work is required to train staff further more you cannot find a waste basket in the whole lobby. Needless to mention the breakfast selection was extremely poor & people in the restaurant have no idea about service. They stay one side & keep chatting without servicing their customers.

Aside from Internet inaccessible in lobby areas and same breakfast menu daily, hotel stay was quite decent. Prior to check out, I called for my ride to the airport via uber as I normally do (much easier for reimbursements from my company ).car arrived and the disaster began.
