Taxi drivers parked outside of your hotel decided to illegally interfere with my ride by surrounding the car with later the police to needing to get involved. Uber is legally allowed to operate in morocco but obviously some taxi drivers have an issue with them. Long story short Mövenpick staff refused to get involved on behalf of a guests whose right it is to choose whatever mode of transport chosen to ride to the airport with. Totally unacceptable experience and left me with feelings of displeasure with…

An excellent hotel. Only one issue, there's only a free WiFi connection that is completely useless! Please improve this or offer a resonablely priced pay for WiFi with a better connection & higher speed. Otherwise this hotel is much recommended by me. Superb.

Excellent stay in the hotel for the week. For business . Hotel is really in god condition, room was just perfect...clean. Make sure to request a quiet room because the noise could be an issue. Perfect for the business

column3: Great value for the rate you pay
column4: Friendly but overbusy front desk staff. Check in and check out can take long. Very spacious rooms. Comfortable beds. Average clean. Great lounge bar and small pool at the rooftop. Panoramic view. Decent food. Acceptable prices. Breakfast area overcrowded. Buffet variety is regular. Not the best breakfast. Helpfull staff. Overall a very nice hotel!

column3: Great experience!!!!! I am sure I will go back to this hotel
column4: This is my 3rd stay at the Movenpick in the last 2 months. The hotel is well situated, the rooms are very descent but the best of all is the service from everybody. Something rare and special to this hotel is the availability and the care showed by the General Manager and his team. I requested to meet Mr Amr Kallini, the General Manager to express some personal wishes. It was amazing to see him offering a meeting right away, where he took the time to listen and immediately responded favourably to my request. The other point that I should mention is the competency and the excellent service offered by Mrs Habiba Alaoui, the Room Service's manager and her team whenever I had to interact with them. I recommend the hotel to anybody visiting Casablanca either for business or leisure.…

column3: Nice and Friendly place in Casa
column4: Excellent Hotel with friendly staff. The restaurant is one of the best in the Area, with a variety of local and international dishes. Can be a bit noisy during the day time as its located in the heart of Casablanca.

Not happy with the service provided and hotel management ability to think out of box and too bureaucratic. The hotel is providing free pick and drop online only in actual they have excuse we have not been notified etc etc

the hotel is very good, the rooms are very nice and the staff is friendly and helpful. In the dining room they are fantastic and I enjoyed very much my stay In the Moevenpick and when I return to Casablanca this is the place to stay

Very good facilities, excelent employee service, top SPA with amazing Hamman, quite, good breakfast, good meals and enough gim. One of the best hotel experiences I had until today and great contribuion to the top impression that I keep from Casablanca...

We were impressed with the courtesy and efficiency of both the counter and restaurant staff. Rooms were clean and functional. We love the variety of fresh fruits for breakfast. A pleasant stay indeed.

Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and was pleased with my stay. The overall appearance of the room is comfortable but not luxury with decent WiFi and spacious rooms. The location is average, it is about 8 to 12 Moroccan Diram using a red taxi to Maarif district that has Zara, Etam, Burger King and great patisserie such as Amoud etc. The stuff are helpful and friendly. The breakfast room lacks variety as well as the dinner offered. Dinner is traditional dishes that are not well prepared.

I had short stay, only 3 days with my fyancee, got very nice room, very helpful staff, it was unplanned vacation but everybody on the front desk was so helpful regarding the places to visit and things to do in so short time. Will be back for sure.

Nice Hotel, very clean and neat, rooms very spacious and well decorated. Very centrally located, near centre ville and Port. Only lack is the parking space. Pool with nice view and Lounge Bar with a menu. A must recomend for others

column3: I dont like this hotel so much
column4: I stayed 1 week in this hotel with my friend. I booked half board. Every day it was the same menü in half board. chicken or fish set menü, 3 days we ate half board but it was the same menü . sorry but it looks like 3 star hotel we bored to eat same menü everyday. staff was friendly , room is old fashioned but big. wifi is horribble. wifi is not signal in the rooms , in the lobby sometimes it Works. this hotel never desirve this price. very bad service . it is 3 star hotel with my Money. no more.

We (a family of four) were offered a free upgrade on arrival to a (much) larger room. Very good service. The stay as such was absolutely fine. Location is not the most central, but there is a nice tram just outside.

It is one of the best place I have been. Good people and good atmospher.the location is good. I recomand the hotel. Easy access to the tram. I will dofintly stay there for my next visit to casablanca.

The hotel send you email of the agreed price when you arrive they don't consider what they send and insist of taking what they want. Overall it's not more than 4 stars hotel and not 5 star hotel and will not visit it again for sure

column3: Great rooftop pool, excellent tasteful rooms, great views
column4: Check In/Check Out Check in was very fast. Even though I didn’t do any online check in, I didn’t have to fill in a form (unlike Mercure). All I had to do was sign a print out with my details. I was also upgraded from the standard room to a deluxe room, which was on floor 12, and featured a larger sitting area. Check out was a bit slower, even though there were two receptionists handling it. A couple in front of me decided to chat about their travels, while another person was making queries about hotels around the Movenpick and hotel rates. Normally, this wouldn’t bother me, but as I was trying to make the train, I wasn’t too happy about this. Location This looked more like the business district of Casablanca, but it was still close enough to the tourist sights. It is also…

Ok hotel in.casablanca. good location. Nice view at the rooftop bar. Not sure about location as I didn't really explore.the city. Looks ok.for a business trip.too. about 5 mins fr Casa Voyageur and 30 mins fr the Intl Airport.

column3: Rooms ok but lack of English speaking staff an issue.
column4: Original room was very poor when we arrived. We complained and God a slightly better one. We asked ourselves-why would they give a customer a sub standard room in the first place? Lack of English speaking staff an issue for us. Breakfasts very good and service of staff in restaurant very good.

Overall the room was comfortable except that I the checked in process took a little too long in spite of prior arrangement. The hotel was centrally located and accessible via taxis and even tram service.

We arrived at this hotel very late and exhausted. The reception staff was nice and friendly, but the rooms were miserable! The view was literally blocked by an office building - so much for the panoramic view! We kept the curtains and blinds closed all the time. The bathtub is clogged. The mould is everywhere in the wet areas. The carpet in the room ( and in all corridors) is dirty and old , and needs serious cleaning or replacement. Towels look like they have been used for ages, there softness and colour faded. We slept like dead log, and checked out as soon as we woke up. Never coming back to this place again.

I regularly stay at Moevenpick returning from Central Africa, and I look forward to it. The hotel and rooms clean, modern, and well-maintained, and there is good water pressure. The staff offer great customer service. The location is good for walking to the bazaar, mosque, and restaurants. Great value for your money.

I just stayed recently for 6 nights The hotel facilities are amazing. Front desk staff were professional and helpful, Thanks a million for keeping my stay remarkable. At the restaurant we had amazing food and the meeting rooms are excellent and very professional staff at the hotel.. Will be back for sure

Good choice. Just be aware of weak WIFI conection. Rooms were very clean and spacious. All personnel very friendly. Some rooms can be noisy because of the road in front of hotel. I recommend to book room in upper floors.

I have stayed at this hotel several times, and I can safely say that this hotel does not live up to the Moevenpick hotels standard. First off, I arrive at 1:30 PM and I was told that my room is not ready, as the check-in time is at 2 PM !! I ask to be put into any other room, I get the response of we are fully booked ! After much debate and willing to pay more, I was put in a room on the second floor........Turns out trying to sleep in that room was almost impossible since the windows are very thin and you can practically hear everything going on outside, I had to eventually sleep with my noise-cancelling headsets !! On a different note, the hotel has a weird policy of only putting complimentary water once during your entire stay ! (I have never been to a 5 star hotel with…

Good hotel for one night or short time , food of hotel is not nice and expensive for the taste , I recommend this hotel for 2 night only , I didn't leave the room so I don't know if the location is good

The hotel is very well located and clean and confortable. I only stayed one night but it was perfect price and quality. The breakfast is excellent and worth the price. Service and staff very welcoming and attentive. The only problem was the internet, no access from the room.

Very nice room, oversized bed, good location, little desappointed by the breakfast but globaly a very good place to stay. we can see the bathroom from the bed which can be disturbing. Also you can t have visitors into your room which is weird

column3: Very nice hotel and value for money
column4: This is a very nice hotel. Good location too. Nice views of the city from the pool bar located on 16th floor ---fantastic. My only complaint is the size of the restaurant. Rather small for such a busy hotel.

My first stay at the hotel was great. I booked a second time but could not go because of a change in the schedule of my project, and they charged my credit card. Thats fine, as it was a non cancellable booking. I have been chasing them since August to simply send me a receipt/invoice for the charge so that I can regularise it with my company, but there has been no response! When I call they say we will look into it, but no status ever! It takes 5 months to give an invoice for money you have already charged?! And this after my company uses this hotel several times a month! Terrible!

Hotel was great - set back in a quiet neighborhood with quiet beach and excellent views. We had both ocean and mountain views which both were great. Don't think there is a bad view at this hotel. Service and cleanliness was great. Great breakfast and pool service.

The service was very good, the room is nice, the location and amenities are very fine because I could stand at the window of the room and enjoy the nice scenes around the hotel. we arrived at the hotel early but have to wait for a long time

Been here a lot of times and experience is always good due to location near the office and the new set-up of the 16th Skybar is nice. Spa was nice and the experience there as well is good, Riza the Manager was always helpful.

My stay was good. The bed was very comfortable and the room and hotel in general very clean. Wifi very fast and efficient-it never let me down. Breakfast was sufficient with very good Moroccan pastries. However, it is the hotel staff that make the difference. They were very nice. Price wise, I suggest that the hotel managers reconsider and re-evaluate the relation of service-price-quality.

Thank you Idrissi ! Very good service sense. The room was clean and modern. I will come back and try the spa. The hotel is located next to my company. So it is the place to be. Morocco is a great contry to stay.

This hotel felt luxurious and modern. Upon arrival, the staff was very friendly and welcomed us with an upgrade to a suite. Once in the room, it was spacious and clean. The bed was very comfortable and the bathtub was huge! We ordered a corkscrew and gentleman who brought it to us came back a second time on his own accord to bring us wine glasses and a plate of chips and olives. Another man was even able to run to the pharmacy for me and retrieve feminine products. Bless him! Will definitely stay here again if we are in Casablanca.

Stayed here in November 2015 for 3 nights and apart from the hotel car not turning up at the airport to collect me and then the front desk seeming to block my credit card more than once, had a very pleasant stay. They upgraded my room to apologise for the car issue but it was at the very front of the hotel so the noise from the busy traffic junction was very loud from 6.30am until around 8pm. Hotel room was spacious and the pool bar and Spa facilities were excellent and good value for money. Despite the initial issues, the Movenpick represents a good hotel in a central location and it doesn't break the bank.

Movenpick it has Been a Must hotel in Casablanca. Great situation in the business center Room it's clean and warm and overall very quiet Great staff , nice buffet at dinner time Outstanding bartenders and cocktails Specially mention to Idrissi and Zakaria in Seven lounge Bar It has been a pleasure to be treated as an important guest

column3: Movenpick at city center, close to business and excellent service
column4: Very clean and serice is very professional, very close to business city center and with very confortable rooms. I really like to have three options for meal services, the bar downstairs quiet and very private, the roof restaurant with very good sushi, and the lunch room at the reception level very good and clean but a bit too busy some times. The only regular experience was when I got a room very close to the elevators as it generates noises which are not very confortable.

I just stayed one night at this hotel but I could say that ; the staff are highly professional, the food quality is really great, rooms are well furnished with good facilities, the location is near to metro station but there is no good view to see.

Stayed at this hotel for a week. Faultless. My room was spacious, clean and sunny. Excellent quality bathroom amenities with argan oil. Maid service was superb, clean spotless room throughout the stay. Food was tasty and fresh, I basically ate mostly moroccan dishes but there is enough variety for others who want mainstream, for me if I am in a foreign country I eat the local cuisine so finding a hotel that answers to this is always refreshing. Otherwise whats the point! It was too cold to enjoy the 16eme bar on the roof though the view is worth it any type of weather. A must is Bar Seven, with its cozy arabian nights ambiance, for a end of day cocktail. The cocktails need improving though and there was no sushi and I had to have tapas instead. The staff at reception was very…

Excellent hotel with good location! Amazing, friendly and helpful staff and great guest relations team I always stay here when I'm in Casablanca! Tram station just outside the front door, very convenient! highly recommended!

The rooms are very comfortable and nicely decorated. There is a good variety offered in the restaurants. Staff responsive and willing to assist and help whenever required. I will stay again in this hotel.

Excellant location. friendly staff. Very capicious luxirious rooms. Exellant food quality. Good health club and indoor swimming pool. Near to city centre and railway station. Overall 5 star hotel good for business trips

The hotel in general is pretty good. -The rooms are very spacious and clean. -Breakfast could have a wider variety of options. -Gym is ok. -The panoramic restaurant on the 16 th floor has a great ambient. -Sushi bar is a great option for dinner. -Pool on the 16 th floor is good but you only have sunshine until 1230 noon. -Major staff of the hotel is very kind and helpful.

It's generally a good hotel, combining a good location, big rooms, nice swimming pool on 16th Floor with an excellent panorama of the city. However, during my stay there the first week of November 2015, there were some shortcomings which actually spoiled the impression. The hotel has problems with Wi-Fi on certain floors, thus in my room on 12th Floor there was none. The visit of the ICT specialist did not solve the problem, so I had to move to another room, on a different Floor. One of my colleagues experienced the same problem. Very regretful experience for a 5-Star hotel as it positions itself. Further, they started some maintenance or cleaning works in the main Cafe without notifying guests and with no Notice of Staff at its entrance. So, guests coming to the Cafe for…

column3: Good location, lot of great things
column4: The standard is really good ; room are big, for the noise of the street, be in upper level. real king size bed, really confortable ; wifi good ; breakfast good, could be busy at the main hours. no chance to go to pool, but seems great.

Overall the room was spacious and had a large bathroom with both shower and bath and everything worked OK. Only complaint was even though my wife and I were a couple there was only bath towels, dressing gown and slippers for one . The rooftop restaurant / bar with good view over the city was excellent and staff very friendly and accomodating . I would recommend this Hotel as staff customer service was excellent and any reasonable request was actioned swiftly .

column3: Great hotel in not so great location
column4: This is a city hotel next to a very noisy intersection of two main traffic arteries of Casablanca. I was on the 14th floor and the noise was still a nuisance when I had to work in my room. I suspect one of the window frames was skewed letting the noise in. I appreciated the good bed, the tea and coffee tray, the cleanliness, the helpfull staff and the selection in the breakfast buffet.

I stayed here Oct. and the hotel remains very good Spacious, clean room with good lights and electrical outlets, large closet space, free water and tea. Free Wifi Good selection of English and movie channels on TV. Large bathroom with good counter space, shower, hair dryer. Nice lobby, fitness centre, restaurant, good breakfast buffet.

Great location. Tram stop right outside taking you to all parts of Casablanca. We paid only £81 for superior double room and were upgraded to an executive suite for free. Everything about the room was super luxurious. Linens were superb. Soundproofed rooms. Free gym and car parking. Swimming pool. Several choices for eating. Reception staff so helpful. Highly recommended

I was ther for business and really apreciate it. The location is good, the rooms comfortable with bed of high quality, the service is excellent everywhere you go from reception to the main restaurant...SPA or Seven Bar...The 16ht floor restaurant and terrasse are just amazing... I would recommend it for leisure or business travallers since it's well located and its prices are attractive

Stayed October 2015, traveled on business The pool is located at the last floor, cool view! Breakfast has a lot if variety. The room was large enough to accommodate two. The area has a good variety of restaurants. The front desk staff is very helpful.

Thank you so much guys! You made my vacation, it was absolutely wonderful, thanks a lot to all the staff, you are the best! very delicious moroccan dishes especially the moroccan crepes! see you very soon Nadine abdellah

column3: Good choice if you want to stay in the new part of the city
column4: I stayed here overnight en route from Marrakech for a morning flight back to the USA. I stayed long enough to have room service, shower, and sleep before getting up at 6 AM for transport to the airport. Check in was a mixed bag for me. The staff wasn't very friendly. Admittedly, I didn't look my best having just come off a 5 hour train ride where comfort was more important than style, so my chosen travel attire of a t-shirt, cargo shorts and flip flops probably was the cause for the reception desk's attitude. However, they did quickly find my reservation, complete the check out process, and help me bring my bags to my room. So at worst, this is a minor quibble. I can't comment on the many of the hotels amenities, but the spa and pool certainly did look nice, the reception…

Nice hotel, amazing skybar, rooms could use a little renovation (for 5 Stars), but overall would recommend it. Pool on the rooftop is always good and staff was eager to assist with problems. Breakfast was amazing

column3: Terrible Experience - DO NOT STAY HERE
column4: This place claims to be a 5 star. It is a 2 star at best. The bathroom walls had urine stains, the sheets were dirty and the smell in the room was horrible. DO NOT STAY here unless you are willing to pay a lot for a little and take a big risk.

Beautiful site, from the main entrance i was greated with chocolate never seen this before amazing people with smiles in their faces at all time, my room was in the 9th floor a great and confortable bed, room service was quick delivery of my club sandwich my stay was for 1 night not enough to experience the spa and the Hammam, the pool is on the 16th floor small but very usueful along with the bar.

Beautiful site with great peolpe, i have stayed for one week for our bank annual meeting the food was just awsome, i did appreciate that the hotel was a non smoking permises so all of the smokers among my group were obliged to go outside nice initiative from the management, overall very welcoming place, Internet not very fast connectivity to be reviewed.

Hotel well located very cosy with a modern design, little noise due to traffic jam but the service is excellent staff are friendly and very welcoming me and my husband we enjoyed the rooftop swiming pool good music and cocktails not to forget the BURGERS !! delicious The aerea is very safe we higly recommend this place. Tullia

Beautiful hotel in a Iconic city, first time at the moevenpick Casablanca, room was spacious with a view at the main boulevard, service at the diner was really friendly Thai buffet just awsome, thank you Idrissi for your kindness and thanks to all staff at the reception. See you all in December

Just want to share my opinion about the good quality services this hotel has. The excellence of the stuffs.as soon as you enter the hotel you will be greeted with smiles and help from everybody.i want to thank a special person Fatima el Hamri the room service girl,for her kindness and devotion to her job.Fatima is always smiling asking what she can do for you.Fatima is a big add to movenpick.God bless her.we returned to america with a beautiful souvenirs from this beautiful hotel and the competent stuffs thy have.we will certainly come back.mounia and marcelino

Be very careful if you choose this hotel, the staff will steal and the hotel management will cover it up. Police would just get paid off and no one will do a thing about it. Even their central office in Europe will do nothing about it. Very intimidating and scary situation. Rooms are nice, restaurants and food are good, shuttle car to airport is comfortable. Nothing interesting near by just a busy business area but probably safer at night outside than inside. You've been warned.

Quality of Service is Very Good, the staff is experienced and welcoming, they speak different languages Rooms are good and clean, the breakfast is average the pool bar is good with a nice view to the city

On the positive side - friendly staff - very good breakfast buffet - nice (but small) roof top pool + chill out area On the negative side - although staff is generally motivated, they often seemed not well trained. Examples: the concierge told us the guided tour at Hassan II mosque starts at 2pm but it was actually 3pm. One morning at 8:30am a maid just came into our room without knocking while we were still in bed. - bad windows, hence some street noise - hotel generally seems a bit run down. As far as I know, Moevenpick just recently took over the property. There is still a lot of work to be done if this should become a real 5* house I have the feeling that this location is a victim of Moevenpicks rapid worldwide expansion strategy. They should have taken over a more modern…

very noisy ... and expensive If you want to stay awake all night because of works during the night in the room just near yours .. go to Movenpick and it will cost you all lot The restaurant is not good and prices are 3 x higher compare to the rest of the city

The swimming pool was closed for maintenance during my stay last day without notice or even apology I know may be silly problem for you but for me BIG PROBLEM.but hounstly the staff were helpful,they extended my checkout to 1.

Well worth a look at,if going to Casablanca.quality room. an interesting breakfast..Morrocan dishes available.very helpful staff ,always seemed to want to do more.we came for a family wedding and unfortunately did not have time to fully view the many interesting sites .would have stayed 2 or 3 days extra if we had known

column3: Good hotel for a decent price
column4: Although the hotel is situated in the (noisy) centre of the city, it is a quit and pleasant envieronment for both business and private stay. The people are friendly and helpfull and I had a very good sleep at the excellent (long) bed.

column3: Best Movenpick Hotel I have Stayed At !!!!!!!
column4: Overall one of the best Movenpick Hotels I have ever had the pleasure of staying at. Defiantly a 5 star hotel in all the aspects required. Defiantly servicing of all the praise a 5 star hotel deserves. Excellent.

column3: A Wonderfull stay at Meovnpick Casablanca
column4: It was a first time to visit Casablanca, we were looking for excellent 5 Star hotel as well as with good location and comfortable stay , we had many choices but we found the best one who meet our satisfaction " Meovnpick Casablanca" Really it worth a lot than we had paid, since you reach hotel door man with nice smile, front office staff are very helpful, they makes you feel at home. Room decoration are very nice comfortable bed , house keeping were fast and helpful. food were delicious and taste it was a wonderful food , staff at restaurant are very pleasant serving you likes you are at home , they are really a very nice people. We had our dinner in roof top , it was great view on swimming ball and we had a very taste Italian dinner ..... our guests was enjoy their meal as much…

column3: Good for Business. Staff is not efficient
column4: I spent a few days un this hotel for a business trip. were very correct, large and confconfortable, wi fi included. The is really averageaverage quality, and breakfast un the morning is as well really average but very crowded. Service is frequently deficient, like an IT person that was supposed to help me with wifi and who never came, receotion staff are average welcoming and nice.

Always eager to assist. If we approached any staff member that was not able to understand much English, they would quickly locate a colleague to help. Special thanks to the lovely housekeeping ladies, Ms Hamri Naima and Ms Fouzia for such prompt and pleasant service. Beautiful smiles troughout the day! Classy restaurant where we ate b'fast, lunch and dinner with good variety. We stayed here 1 night before heading south and currently staying another 2 nights. Highly recommended. Walk left and you will reach the medina, right and you will reach the upscale area. If you're on a higher floor, you get a nice view of the city. Rooms are spacious, well designed (as expected of any Movenpick), some rooms comes with a sofa seating area, A travel companion got a wheelchair accessible /…

From the early moment of arrival , I realized that I will like this facility . They offered a welcome drink " Moroccan tea" with dessert and the check in process was quick.The room is spacious , the A/C is working excellent and the design of my room with a dressing area behind the bed was magnificent. . Mr Mostafa in the concierge was EXTREEEEEMLY polite and helpful and always .smiling.The buffet was much satisfying for me with varieties that was really tasty. What I didn't like : The man at the door picks up taxi with double or even triple prices . There is a receptionist named "Kaawtar" that don't know how to smile Otherwise , I recommend this hotel for everyone . P.S.There is a nearby Tram station in-front of the hotel

We stayed at this hotel in August during our business trip to Casablanca. First of all, it's not a 5-star hotel, not even a 4-star, according to the value of customer service, accommodation in general and design, as it doesn't reflect the qualities of a 5 or 4 star hotel. During our three nights stay we had more than a few unpleasant incidents with the staff. The housekeeping staff managed to enter our room without knocking for more than three times, they entered even when there was a "Do Not Disturb" sign on the door, they entered with same sign on again the next day after we had spoken with the management about this issue. Anytime we would call the reception for any kind of request (water, matches, cigarettes etc), it would take more than 40 min to be delivered. Some other…

column3: 48 years after, first real time in CASA
column4: Had terrible problems getting from Munich via Barcelona to CASA with a delay of 6 hours. Front Desk wonderfully and cheery at 5:35 a.m. Morocco time. An excellent room w/too big a bed for a single. Only complaint, closet filled with ironing board and iron, hardly any room to even hang up my clothe bag. Other part filled with other practical items. Restaurant for breakfast, excellent service, but nowhere was the price given in advance of what the breakfast buffet would cost or what other choices or a reduced menu might involve. After Euros 24 for my small needs I learnt to announce whatever small things I needed and was priceless accommodated. The area, while by CASA standards probably central, did not sport any obvious breakfast alternatives. Only other thoughts, one concierge…

This hotel is situated in a busy junction of the city. The noise from the traffic can be heard even from the high floor. But it is quite at night. This factor will not be of concern if you are a business traveler with a busy day. Although the picture of the swimming pool is nice, it is actually not that nice. Service is good and staff is friendly. The staff at the breakfast area actually remember the drink ordered the day before, which is very awesome.

This is a nice, clean hotel with good size rooms. The location is fine and the staff are friendly. The breakfast was very good. The only thing I didn't like was the persistent smell of cooking on the third floor where we stayed.

Decoration is poor, furniture was old. Room was not clean,dusty. Bathroom was a disaster. The hotels location is good but so much traffic causes too much noise so be ready. Hotel deserves a 3 star instead of 5. Spa and gym is so small. They put few dumbells and call that a gym.

column3: Reception and Concierge service was not as pleasant as expected
column4: Reception staff was slow. Left my passport on the side and simply left the counter for 20 minutes with no notice. Had to request another reception staff to take over and handle my check in. 2 Concierge staff brought up our 3 luggages. Didn't leave immediately once bags were delivered but rather, went further into the room to where my mother was resting and lingered around for tips. Was already planning to tip but their impoliteness made us a little disappointed.

column3: Expensive but nice if you're happy to spend the money
column4: Pros Decent location Wifi is good Lovely rooftop pool Decent food Beautiful rooms Nice in room complimentary shampoo/body wash etc. (Argan oil) Supplied towels for the pool Spa isn't too overpriced Cons I asked about breakfast and they said it wasn't included, then in the menu it said continental breakfast was included. Their buffet breakfasts costs 280 dirhams. City tax isn't included in the fee. Small things expensive (bottle of water was €5, so was a single serve tub of yogurt) Would stay again if I wasn't concerned about money, as I was on a budget this trip, the small surprises added up. If you do stay buy your water before hand.

column3: Good hotel option but for the price should be flawless
column4: Good hotel but flaws like others. Slow free wifi, slow meal service like in many Moroccan places. The beers were mostly warm on many occasions. As far as the stay and location it's a very nice hotel good options to eat inside (although sushi wasn't served on Thursday, Friday nor Saturday day time) there are several restaurants to choose from. The hotel location is great with the tram across the street.

I was there for business trip and I had few day to look around as well. Nice central place. Hotel workers are very helpful and sincere .. I had wifi problem in my room that I asked the reception to move me to other room. Mr Sinan at reception was helping to me. Even the hotel was full he made sure that I moved to a new room very next day. He was incredibly nice and helpful and very sincere. You can see he was really naturally wanted to help rather then as like duty. Highly recommend.

I decided Moevenpick for the simpliest reason. I did not wanted to take any risks in my first place in Morocco after an overseas flight. You can´t go wrong with them. Smooth as it should be. Great choice in Casablanca.

column3: One km to Twin Towers shopping district.
column4: We have stayed there totally 3 nights before and after Marrakech trip and tried 10th floor classic front and 6th floor deluxe back rooms of the hotel. The latter is very large. Conditions of the guest rooms are good enough. There were some scratches on the walls of the corridor. İt should not be in Mövenpick quality. I have just learnt that the hotel was formerly of Husa chain hotel. Breakfast is open buffet and delicious. Dried walnuts were not so fresh on our first stay. Three kinds of Moroccan qurabiye were always tasty.Twin towers area is cafe & shopping zone where Zara&Mango are situated. Taxi to the airport 300 MAD, Train from Casaport or Casa Voyageurs 40 MAD per 2nd class ticket. Petit taxi to train stations roughly 40 MAD. My special thanks to the reception intern Sinan…

column3: Ideal Business and leisure hotel in the heart of Casablanca
column4: Recently changed from Husa to Movenpick. This hotel tends to strive for excellence and guest satisfaction. Not yet to the Movenpick standards that I knew when i first tried a Movenpick chain hotel in Geneva but I think it will get there. The guest host director (directeur d'hébergement) that I met, does seem like the man for the job . Accurate and with his attention to detail, I'm sure he will be bring a positive change to the hotel.

It was a perfect stay, the staff were lovely and very helpful, the room sizes are great and good central location. Pool on rooftop was great , a little noisy with traffic, but this comes with the location. Definitely recommend

Friendly & polite staff who speak French well & can mange English too. Well equipped for meetings & has a nice ambiance too for families. It offers a wide selection for breakfast. Most remarkable is the beautiful scent once you are in the lobby ....hotel location is central & nearby to many restaurants. Housekeeping needs a daily call to make up the room & bathroom!!

The Moevenpick Hotel was a great experience and the staff was always there for any needs that you may have . The Moevenpick is a beautiful hotel and the rooms are comfortable .The Hotel is in a nice location where many shops and easy access to transportation. The Moevenpick is the type of hotel that I would look to stay in for future travel s

column3: Comfortable hotel located in the centre of the city
column4: Stayed here recently for 3 nights, first time at a Movenpick, I was impressed. Very big room with everything that you could need. Hotel has many facilities like lobby bar, restaurant, pool, taxis out the front etc. Very polite and efficient staff, nothing was ever a problem. Located in the centre of town but not the easiest city to get around unless you know where you are going. Red 'petit' taxis were plentiful and inexpensive. Overall I enjoyed the stay and would recommend it.

Disapointment for a five star. I was not happy that I was asked to leave the breakfast table as time was up! It's not too bad as location is central. Near the mosque and souk. Pool is small and pedicure was very basic.

My first time at the Movenpick Casa, I found this hotel basic content of the other from the chain much better. +++: very good service and friendly staff, bedding especially for business travelers ---:quality of the room too small. Especially the height of the bath. which can be difficult for some people and dangerous (risk of slipping ...)

Carpet was gray and all stained, bathrooms not clean at all, sinks clogged, rooms black, red and white all over reminiscent of 70's tacky ... Missing a disco ball! On the plus the staff were friendly.

column3: confortable hotel in the Center of town
column4: We stayed in this hotel as part of a tour group for 3 nights. very nice hotel with great breakfeast and dinner. the room is spacious and the shower strong. Everthing seems in tip top shape although the outside is not very jaw dropping and the loby not huge, the hotel is luxurious and very confortable. Recommendation, do not miss the pool at the very top floor with awesome view of the city.

I used to be in Morocco for business during the past 2 years. Recently I accommodate again in this hotel after it changed to Moevenpick and the change is very noticeable. Staff is very friendly than before specially at restaurant, they used to welcome us there and do the best efforts for our comfort. The location of the hotel is amazing close to city center, quite calm and relaxing for business trips. In my personal opinion there are some point of improvement to be done there like breakfast it shall be more rich with variety of food. After all this hotel will be my first choice during my coming trips to Casablanca Morocco

Stayed 2 nights. Hotel was okay but service was poor. Room hadn't been made up properly; no soap in bathroom or the complimentary water. Phoned reception twice to be told it was being sent but never arrived. In the end went out and spoke to someone at front desk on return who said he would send and sure enough he did. Just can't understand why something so simple couldn't be done. Room wasn't made up on the 2nd day until the evening as we were still in the room when housekeeping came and they didn't bother coming back when we left to go out. 4 lifts but still took ages arriving as 1 seemed permanently out of service. Parking is advertised as available but there is only a limited amount of hotel parking so really you will need to pay for parking at the nearby car park. I…

column3: Very good Hotel in good location
column4: All the instalations were really nice, the room service is very efficient, some emploees dont speak english but this is a problem in all Moroccos. Locacion is also nice close to downtown, I recomend it.

Fantastic Piano Bar Cigar Lounge A great live music, with unique mix of Classical and Jazz piano music! Superb Cigar humidor. The best place for a after work relaxing moment. Light snack and tapas menu, with great Moroccan wines and good drinks.

Quiet, clean,in the city center close to Maarif street, friendly staff specially Fatma and Idris, I enjoyed my stay there realy good place to stay in during your stay at Casablanca the city of everything !

Long story short, don't pay in cash, the entire hotels electricity went on the day I was checking out.. Had to walk down 8 floors with luggage, baby and her essentials, at check out they didn't know if we had paid or not and were delayed by 10 mins... Their system wasn't working, I never goty deposit back which I paid in cash as they had no access to their own records! I had to write off near enough £100 in deposit, if I didn't leave I was going to miss my flight, apart from that my stay was ok, I asked for a Cott at check in, at 00.30 am I had a knock on the door and somebody came with a full size adult bed! 6 hours after I requested a Cott!

column3: "Wonderful Internet service with 5 star hotel experience"
column4: Mövenpick Hotel in Casablanca was easy to book, was great value for money, and had an excellent Internet connection. My room-service meal was very tasty and the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was modern, sleek and the only complaint was the size of the bins! The toiletries were OK.

column3: Lovely hotel, spots of poor service
column4: The concierge was fantastic, helpful and considerate. One of the ladies at Reception however was not helpful at all, and made changing money at reception a regretable experience. The same lady made very little effort to atone for the fact that the pool was closed, while the staff running the spa upstairs were keen to direct us to the pool that the hotel had arranged as a replacement. The staff made the best effort to get us there when we asked.

I reserved a room that I instantly fell in love with and when I get to the hotel I find that the room had nothing to do with the picture !! There was no pool and they didn't notice that neither in their website nor in booking.com ! the breakfast was aweful compared to the very high price !!!! and the lighting of the toilet was awefull, in addition to all of that : the toilet seat was not sterile, there was and old bathrobe, the fabric was harsh for the skin ! no additional pellow and last but not least no bed sheets !!!!

I like the hotel and what you get for the price and the location is excellent...only small thing is that the beds could be a bit more comfortable, beside of that everything is great...so i can recommend a stay there....breakfast and spa are amazing

column3: Pool closed for renovation and overall poor service. This is not a 5 star hotel!
column4: This is not a five-star experience... We stayed at Movenpick hotel in Casablanca from the 17th-19th of July 2015. My husband and I chose the hotel based on the fact that they had a stunning pool on the roof top. At checking in, I asked about the pool and they just responded that it was closed for renovation. They offered beach access to a public beach instead. For me this is not an option, to sit in the car with my 1 year old daughter to a beach quite far away from the hotel. We chose the hotel based on easy access to the pool for my daughter. As compensation they upgraded us to a junior suite. The mini-bar was never stocked, after several request, I gave up. I changed into gym clothes and went down to the reception, I enquired where the gym was and they directed me to the…

After realising we were short on money, we attempted to change some at the desk. The lady that assissted us was very dismissive and unhelpful. In the end we exchanged some money. I checked the interest rate and it appeared that she had short changed us by 40 dirhams. And of course we were quite trusting at the time of purchase so did not ask for a receipt. I should expect at least that the staff in the hotel that I am paying for would not attempt to rip me off. To top that off, in was is arguably the busiest season of the year, the pool is closed. I've just looked and of course there is no mention of this on the website or at check in. Absolutely ridiculous.

column3: Not Bad for a Moroccan Hotel
column4: This appears to be an older hotel which is well kept. We stayed only 1 night and was given a room on the 6th floor, which was a relatively lower floor in this hotel. The room was nice and comfortable. The air conditioning works well. Overall, the room is quiet. The buffet dinner and breakfast were by no means international standard. They contain quite a bit of Moroccan food. However, compared with other hotels, they are actually among the better ones. There were fruit juices available at the buffet dinner. We ordered a 1L bottle of water and it cost MAD 60 (just over $6) There aren't much in the immediate vicinity of the hotel, but plenty of banks.

The hotel was amaizing, lovely decode and they cared of the details, the only thing I faced was the sound coming from the upper floors of running something all night, and then later they in the morning, they started digging and hitting, there were constructions works while the guest still there!!!!

column3: Comfortable stay , pleasant staff , enjoyed my stay
column4: Enjoyed my 10 days stay which I spent in the Mövenpick Casablanca, convenient service, upscale treatment, calm, permanent staff smile .. The dinner is another story, the buffet was full of different country's western , eastern cuisine, Moroccan , and even Japanese Sushi .. I'v had dinner at many 5 stars hotels in the city, and I've always attributed to my restaurant at my Hotel .. really . Finally , I really enjoyed my stay at the Mövenpick , thanks for those in charge and the management , certainly I will return to stay here again when when I am back to Morocco 😊 Roger Mofti

This hotel has the best food in the city.the staffs are very helpful and attentive to the Guest needs.great location, the rooms are big with a panoramic view of the city.very clean and prices are very reasonable prices. The staffs are very professional and they have variety of food :sushi, marrocan and Mediterranean food.

People very helpful. Well located and good taxi service. Ramadan dinner was really excellent, large variety of different kind of food, good quality and warm attention from all people. I recommend to use this hotel in your next trip to Casablanca.

Hotel does not stand for a 5 stars as it says. The room is spacious but with old and ugly carpet that needs to be cleaned and replaced. Pool and spa closed for renovation without any previous notice prior to my reservation. Do not recommend it unless the price is reduced 50%.

We have used this hotel a number of times for business and it is a real treat. The staff are so friendly and helpful in every way, whether in the restaurant, at reception, cleaning your room or even at the roof top pool, everybody does a wonderful job! The hotel is clean, the food is lovely and the roof top is absolutely stunning. will not stay anywhere else in Casablanca - looking forward to going back.

The staff were helpfull and nice. Very good breakfast. Very nice housekeepers Samia and Fouzia. They took very good care of the room. The room was very clean. Good job! The hotel is located in a busy area. It's a descent and well organised hotel. There is tramline which takes directly to the seaside.

Very nice hotel close to everything . The rooms are spacious and comfortable . I had a problem with the no smoking rule . The cleaning staff are extreamly friendly and helpfull . Breakfast is good but does not have a lot of varieties . The spa is good but not with morrocan bath . All in all a good hotel for buisness

This is hotel is hard to find, all taxi drivers were not able to take there. I had hard time to reach the hotel, and I thought the name sounds but it is not in Casablanca. The Hotel doesn't look like 5 starts it is hardly 4 stars. the food's variety is very poor. the room was clean but the furniture and the bathroom seemed old. The hotel is far from the airport and far from the areas of shopping or sight seeing. Unless you are in a business trip and just need a place to sleep over, I do not recommend this hotel.

column3: No way this is a 5* hotel!
column4: This is NOT a 5* hotel. Not in any way. I travel regularly and I don't usually post any bad reviews. I used to believe that any random bad reviews had to be aggrieved customers or similar but in this case it is genuinely just a bad review! It wasn’t so much that when I went to check in they tried to bump me to another hotel as they had overbooked or even the way that I was kept waiting for half an hour at 10.00pm at night when I refused to be moved, it was the staff attitude when they said that, quote, "its not our fault. We have 183 rooms and we have bookings for 200" that really aggravated me! Having to argue that it WAS their fault is not pleasant! On checking in to the room the 1970's black and red 'disco' themed colour scheme was interesting but the condition was poor.…

Our room was comfortable and breakfast, the only meal we had, was good. However, I could not possibly recommend this hotel to anyone because of a major security issue which I do not feel has been adequately resolved. We spent one night here in February 2015 at the beginning of an extensive tour of Morocco. Shortly after midnight I was woken by 2 people coming into our room. When I called out, they left and closed the door. A few minutes later our phone rang but the caller hung up when we answered it. I am sure the two incidents were related. I was very shaken by this as I had always understood that the key cards were unique to a guest and that it would be impossible to enter a room. After a very worrying night wondering whether the intruders were going to return we discovered…

I read most of the previous reviews, bad internet, noisy at the front of the hotel, staff that's unfriendly. It made me think twice. I'm glad I went anyway. Non of those remarks I read we're true. The connection was stable all the time at good speeds, Netflix was possible. I was at the third floor at the streetside, where about 5 big streets converge, I'm a light sleeper, I slept like a baby. Staff was friendly, I even had a liitle chat with one who had family at my homecountry. To keep it short, nice stay. Very nice rooms, ask for a kingsize bed. My honest opinion, I'm a business traveller, so I've been around, it's a go for me.

The reception staff although professional were extremely unfriendly and aloof. When I was unsure of where I should enter the wifi logins and asked I was given a look as if I was stupid and still had to work it out for my self with no help from the female receptionist. On my last night while I was out to dinner after 9 in the evening someone had entered my room and had moved articles around. I had used the safe for any valuables and nothing was missing but I felt my privacy had been invaded. I was very upset about this but did not report it as I did not want a scene and didn't want any confrontation. On check out at 7am the following morning the male receptionist spoke above me and seemed very annoyed that I wished to review my billing before payment. With my booking through an…

column3: Not really a 5 stars, but good anyway!
column4: Lobby is too small for this kind of hotels receiving many groups. In addition they have a big table with flowers, that looks nice, but it takes plenty of space from the entrance. Rooms are confortable and tidy, but some details need more maintenance. Breakfast price and restaurant service are overpriced for being Morocco and being nothing special. Service is very good. They are customer minded and helpful. Enjoy terrace around the swimming pool in 16 floor. View is great. Unfortunately you can't see the sunset, but sunset ambience there is great! Hotel is place in a quite centric place, to go by walk to the old medina, twin center, etc. But this square is very noisy because of the traffic and despite you are in a upper floor and windows are not too bad, the noise from 7am is…

The hotel is in an excellent location with a tram stop just a few meters away that will take you to most places worth a visit. The hotel is located in a busy intersection but not as chaotic or noisy as the area surrounding the medina. Casablanca is a wonderful city that can be well explored from this base. The hotel amenities are above standards with large and comfortable rooms. The breakfast and room service are expensive but it offers good food quality. The staff is attentive and helpful. Overall, we had an outstanding experience during our two night stay.

you can get to city center by walk,the lobby is small,internet just in lobby and its speed is average,breakfast is good enough but dinner is just OK,rooms are good and clean,friendly staff,its location is good just short walk to bazaar ,restaurants are near

We spent 1 night here before flying home. The reception staff were very friendly, helpful & spoke good english. Our room was spacious, clean & comfortable. We were on the 11th floor facing the street but didnt find it noisy. We enjoyed the pool on the roof but didnt eat at the hotel so cant comment on breakfast, although it was expensive. The hotel is in a good location, if you follow the street with the tram it takes you down towards the port & city centre, along with the medina. After spending time travelling around Morocco we didnt like Casablanca & would recommend only spending a night there before flying out. Having said that though im sure it has its hidden treasures we just didnt have time to explore.

Nice and relaxing place to stay at with friendly staff and wonderful atmosphere. definitely the place to stay at Casa. I have tried the Spa bit but that will be my next definitely.. The breakfast was awesome and everything was presented in an excellent manner

You would think that you pay for what you get. Not for the Moevenpick Casablanca. I usually stay at the Sheraton Towers Hotel Casablanca but it was fully booked in this particular week I was in town. So, for the difference in price, where the Moevenpick is almost double the Sheraton's rate, I was very disappointed. The staff were not friendly, customer service was at its lowest, my guests were insulted, breakfast was poor - food quality was below average for the rates they charge. I had to live from my luggage for one week because the cupboard only had room for my suits and shirts! You'd think at the rate you're paying that they would have double glazed windows to cut down the noise from the traffic & the neighboring streets. Overall, the only good experience was the spa…

I know this hotwl since longtime and the licatiom is very conveniente. The service improved and for local standards is good. The common areas are ok. Food its ok. Rooms from 4 to 9 (termination). Parking available. Reception improving...

We had a pleasant stay at Movenpick hotel.The staff was very helpful and friendly- their english were sometimes a it poor though. The rooms were very clean, spacious and well air conditioned! I think the cleaning lady was coming 2-3 times a day! The breakfast had a wide range and also some local choices. The pool was clean ,great view, and with space to sit, although it was a bit small. The location is good enough, the area safe.. it is a bit loud outside from the streets, and you can hear it in the room- but this is Casablanca! There is free WiFi but is keeps logging off.. In general I would go back again, thinking of the services and good price.

Hotel well located in the center of Casablanca. Very comfortable and very helpful staff . Breakfast very varied . After testing several hotels in Casablanca as part of business travel , I have never yet been disappointed with the Movenpick

Im not so satisfied with my stay in tht hotel staff needs note training , renovations , and they have to work on their english ( i had to order omllete aroun 2 times bcz everytime the waiter says i understod sir an bringing it now and bring something else at end i googled it and showed him the pic, they need to work on the restraunt food regarding the diversity,staff should be more showing more interest into their guests , i remeber the incharge person in the restraunt was pointing at me as i was wearing a short during breakfast that is not appropriate and i have to go and change although the lady in front of rest let me in with no comment and there was no clear instructions at door front stating such thing it was a very bad way, , overall below expectations :(

My wife and I stay at the hotel with our ten month old daughter was quite pleasant. The check in was quick but the lights in our room did not work so we were upgraded to a bigger room which was nice. Pros about our stay: Room was spacious for all three of us. Very modern design with clean lines. Breakfast buffett was good but needs a bit more variety. Cigar lounge was great as was the Casablanca Cafe. They brought in chefs from the Movenpick Phuket for Thai Fest and we were served the best Thai food we have ever have. Service staff is fantastic. Always helping and playing with our daughter as well as going out of there way to look after us. Convieniently located next to the tram. Cons about the hotel: Located next to a busy intersection so you can hear traffic throughout the…

column3: Great stay in Casablanca, thanks to the Hotel staff
column4: Hotel was great, rooms clean and staff super-friendly. My only beef was that the safe didn't work, the Thai restaurant was a little lacking in variety and the breakfast was quite expensive. Otherwise it is a first rate hotel in a fabulous location.

A very pleasant stay on passing through Casablanca for a few nights. Clean, friendly and lovely presentation throughout. Very central with the trams just around the corner. Great little corner shop just across from the trams, just make sure you have money for your fair as this little shop is tormented with people looking for change. Great little ice-cream place as you turn the corner from the hotel just two minutes down the street that opens very late. My only negative would be from the traffic noise outside.

Good, pleasant hotel in Casablanca. After travelling the country for a while, I must say I found it quite comforting to arrive in this modern environment (meaning both Casablanca and the hotel). The hotel is more of a business hotel, but we still managed to create quality vacation time for ourselves at the side of the rooftop pool where they would serve you your highball and beer at the right temperature or something that comes close to it (during our trip we had experienced that in Morocco alcoholic drinks - if available - are almost always served way too warm). It probably was also the one hotel in Morocco that we had booked which came closest to the standard that it promised (which is nothing extraordinary, but it lived up to the expectations that you can reasonably have in a…

My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights. On arrival around 1am, we asked why we were not placed in a quiet room as requested. Soon came along the manager on duty, I believe his name is Mr Omar who kindly upgraded us to a junior suite room. The room was quieter and well laid out with all one needs for a comfortable stay. We did not eat at the hotel as we wanted to experience local food from local spots but had a peek at the menu and food lay out which looked tasty and delicious though for our Western palate. If you have an adventurous stomach like us, you may want to skip this as there were nice local spots around the area. If you have a great appetite or want to play it safe and stick to what you know then opt for their well stocked buffet breakfast. My husband used the…

column3: Good Hotel, but mostly for Business
column4: We stayed at this hotel because we were hoping to experience a little bit of City life as well as still be able to get to some sites. This is definitely a business hotel BUT is still good for relaxation. They have a great view of the city from the rooftop where there is a pool. They also have a massage parlor on the rooftop. On the rooftop,there is a server to take your order if you want to order food or drinks. The room was a good size. We had wi-fi that worked in the room, but stopped for a about two days.It was clean and spacious. It also had a great view of the city. What gives this a 4 is the minibar and room service. $5 for a can of soda. I know it's a business hotel, but that is just ridiculous. Buy your drinks on the street. The Room service food was so so and wasn't…

column3: Great stay thanks to a fantastic staff
column4: I had an excellent stay at the hotel especially thanks to the great staff with special thanks to Miss Karima and the gouvernant they have been lovely. Food was great as well. Staff has been very helpful and responsive everytime i needed something like taxis or recommendation

column3: We have felt very comfortable and can only highly recommend this hotel
column4: The welcome was very warm and professional. The rooms quite big and very clean. Could have been a better choice of german channels and also would have been nice if the window could have been opened - at least the possibility to tilt it for some fresh air. The staff was very friendly. We felt very comfortable in this Hotel.

My friend and I treated ourselves to a luxury stay on the last night of our epic 2 1/2 week tour of Morocco by staying at the Movenpick Casablanca - and we were treated like VIPS. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly (going out of their way to ensure that there was an English speaking person available to help with any queries...and booking of airport transfers). The food was DELICIOUS and well worth the money we spent The hotel is easily accessible from Casa Voyageurs Rail Station, with the Hassan II tram station right outside It was a fantastic way to end our trip!

I stayed 2 nights. initially, I was allocated a room facing the 4 lane street and the noise was extraordinary! Every few seconds car horns peeped, motor cycles revved up- straight through the night. Sleep was impossible. The next day they re-allocated a nice quiet room, which was lovely . Do ask for that! The pool on the roof top I beautiful- albeit the toilet and shower facilities need a facelift. It is a 20 minute walk to the main attractions.

When we arrived at the hotel we were greeted by two staff members who were warm and helpful. Our room was on a convenient level. The room was clean and neat. The food at the hotel was expensive but good. The breakfast was excellent. The business centre needs to be improved. I could not print an important letter. The shower is not fantastic. The restaurant needs re-decorating. Overall we found that the hotel was a good choice and I will recommend it to other travellers.

We spent a night here on our trip around Morocco in order to visit the mosque. After staying in riads for the rest of the trip, this hotel felt quite luxurious. The bed was huge, and the room very comfortable with all the facilities you'd expect from this type of hotel. We had great views from our 11th floor room, and didn't have any problems with noise (although the hotel is next to a very busy road junction). The hotel is in a decent location, with a tram stop next door. This was really useful for getting around the city, and to Casa Voyageurs station. There is not a lot around the hotel itself, but the city centre is a 15 minute walk or 2 stops on the tram. We didn't have breakfast here, but found a nice cafe a few minutes walk away that served a much more reasonably priced…

Friendly and efficient service, and received a room upgrade. Comfy bed. Breakfast was great, but a little expensive. There is nothing special about the room itself but certainly nothing wrong with it either. Very nice modern bathroom. The staff are friendly and helpful and have good English. I would recommend this hotel - it was great value.

Lights didn't work, was told a technician would come and repair - no one showed up... was told my passports would be sent up in 15 minutes after registration - had to call and remind them after an hour... expected A LOT more from Movenpick :(

The hotel staff were attentive, our room was clean and modern, in the upper level of the hotel. We enjoyed relaxing by the pool, but as it was mentioned the hotel is on a very busy corner of Casablanca and the noise of traffic (mostly honking) could even be heard from the rooftop. Our room was quiet enough though and I didn't have a problem with the WIFI speed. The staff we encountered were all friendly and the service was quick when ordering food or drinks.

column3: Not at all a five star.
column4: What a disappointment this hotel. It starts at arrival. A bunch of locals hang around the entrance. Supposedly cab drivers. Reception desk could not find my prepaid reservation. All elevators rattle and shake like an airplane on turbulence. WiFi does not work decent (except in the lobby). Room furniture is worn. Rented meeting room was not ready. Internets speed still way below acceptable despites all management promises (even on this website comments). Continuously being chased by hotel staff to sign for already paid bills. Shower flooded bathroom every time. And checkout again was a total disaster requiring 4 attempts before finally the correct bill was printed. This might have been a grand hotel ages ago but now it is by most a 3 star. Food in buffet is good.

My rooms was a King Room, not a standard one but, however, it was not so good: forniture were ruined and curtain dirty. Not as good as many 5* hotel i have been in my life! Rooms are clean and quiet, staff is kind and polite and help you in everything you need

column3: Excellence Hotel in the Heart of the City
column4: Tram just in Front of the nice hotel located on a busy Place. ( Noise During Rush Hours, quiet during Night) wonderful Design of the hotel facilities. Very friendly employees in the Rezeption, in the Bar, in the restaurant etc. good Qualität of the kitchen. We had a beautiful Room in the 12th Floor with two King Size Beds. Very clean. Exzellent Service Every day. Only Internet was Weak, much better in the Lobby. Recommened: the Bar with Mohameds Service and an exzellent selection of cubane cigars in the well functioning humidor.

On the whole we found this a great place to spend three nights for a visit to Casablanca. The location is great, easy to get to by train and tram from the airport and convenient to the city. Very comfortable room, well kept and clean. We were on the 12th floor, and the room was quiet with no intrusion from the noise of the street. The decor was attractive and the room had plenty of space with a large walk in wardrobe. Very good bed, and we slept well. The breakfast selection was very nice, and we particularly appreciated the chance to sample Moroccan specialities. The breakfast service was not so good however, as it was hard to get the attention of the staff to ask for coffee, and empty plates weren't cleared. The main fault for us was that wifi in the rooms was very poor, with…

We stayed five days at the Mövenpick Hotel in Casablanca, and we enjoyed the stay. There was a welcoming athmosphere and the service was excellent. The rooms spacey and clean and with a safe. The only reason for not giving five stars is that the hotel is located in an area with very much traffic - it was not annoying to us, but if you look for tranquility, this is not the place.

so happy I did not pay more than USD 100 horrible place, a mystery how it got any decent reviews grotty carpets in the hall with dirty wall hangings sink drain was stuck with water in it when I went in room you can hear every automobile pass on the road

A former Holiday Inn (tell that to your taxi driver or he may not know where it is) located in a business section of town but no decent restaurants nearby. Hideous striped painted hallways and inconvenient room layout. Staff sent us to the wrong train station far out of town when we checked out and we almost had to stand for three hours. If we had been sent to the in-town nearby station we would have been able to get first class tickets. Instead we almost had to stand with our luggage in second class for a three hour ride. Fortunately we were able to get seats after a few stops.

I have been there during March with a group of 35 rooms. Check in was easy although 4 rooms were delayed but not too much. Rooms are very clean & spacious & well equipped with free access to internet allover the hotel. Breakfast was delicious & have many varieties. Casablanca meeting room wasn't that good as the data show wasn't good at all & it need some time to fix it to the best available picture. Reception is spacious with many corners & seats. The front office staff & all the other staff were always smiley & are the main reason of our satisfaction specially Mr. Omar the Front office manger. one of the disadvantage that there weren't enough cash for money exchange most of the time. Allover, we have good experience in this hotel.

It's ok I don't mate any trouble during my staying in movenpick hotel Thank you every one here in movenepick and every persons in casasblanca And I enjoy my trip in morocco I hope to see you during nexet days

This hotel is in a great location in Casablanca and is good value for money. I recommend it and will stay there again. There were small issues with the internet but we were given universal access while it was being fixed. The hotel restaurant is excellent.

Great service, clean hotel and room. Very comfortable beds but our room was close to the elevators so this made it a little noisy at times... Service was amazing and all the staff very pleasant. Location was practical Thank you

the room was fine, and breakfast really nice - staff with some exceptions due to inexperience we reckoned, really nice enough - a bit too proud in a way! but serviceable - no feeling except from some of staff of warmth.. the kicker was to leave our car with their valet service who lost the key! we had arranged social events so at least the hotel drove us there and back, and next morning drove my daughter in law to hotel to try to collect her car: key seems to have gone home with one of staff! he had also forgotten to sign it in or out. a real trauma - whew - we won't forget that soon - and some front desk staff sure manifested lack of sympathy (they chased us in foyer of hotel in front of other guests to get 40 drmaas back - after their horrific treatment night before, we…

column3: Best Service and Staff in Casablanca!
column4: While we were unable to actually stay in this property, the superb staff, led by Mr Omar Ech-Cheddadi, moved us to an acceptable alternative hotel when the Royal Family's staff had to take a large block of rooms at this hotel. Mr Omar was a most gracious host, extremely apologetic about the circumstances, and went above and beyond in ensuring our stay was the most pleasant possible despite the situation. As part of his apology, we were treated to a complimentary meal at the Moevenpick's restaurant buffet. It was outstanding, and as expected, the service by the wait staff was divine. This is the number 2 rated hotel in Casablanca on TripAdvisor--based on the impeccable service alone, it should be number 1. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone thinking about staying…

This hotel was actually really nice, I just thought $50 for breakfast for two was expensive for a buffet. I think we paid the same amount for sushi for dinner in the hotel. The wifi was terrible, and the ride to and from the airport seemed overly expensive as well.

I know this hotel since the time it was called "HUSA". Movenpick management has added value improving a lot the quality of the services. The hotel is well located close to the center of the city, The rooms are fine, clean and well equipped. The hotel's restaurant offers a large choice amid Moroccan and international cuisine. Courtesy and assistance are always available. No matter if you are traveling for business or for vacation, that's a very good Hotel where to stay during you journey in Casablanca.

column3: Close to excellence, but not quite there
column4: Excellent location in many ways, but especially since next to a tramway stop. This is a big plus, since the tramway is clearly the best means of transportation in Casablanca. The rooms and public spaces are neat (though a bit noisy), and the pool (and spa) on the roof a superb feature, whereas the level of in-room wifi and service in general dragged behind. The staff was polite and helpful, but just not as professional as one might hope for at this level. Still recommended, and good value for money.

column3: Lovely hotel but a few big issues
column4: Firstly a little bit of background. I arrived at the hotel around 5pm. Having been travelling around a bit I was happy for my last stop in Casablancs where I would have a few days to relax in order to rejuvenate myself on the last part of my holiday. I had recently been ill with a chest infection. I arrive at the hotel where they couldn't seem to find my booking. Anyway, I was told that I couldn't stay there the night and that I needed to sit down in the lobby to wait for the manager. I went to the toilet and on my return. The manager was waiting for trying to offer me peppermint tea etc. I just wanted to get to my hotel room that I had already prepaid for, and relax. I was told that unfortunately the King had made a last minute booking and that his staff had filled up most of…

column3: Nice rooms but noisy and terrible wifi
column4: I am spending 6 weeks in the Movenpick Hotel in Casablanca for a business trip. Plus: Very nice hotel, rooms are spacious and brand new, the bed is comfortable and quite large. Employees are pretty nice on average. Minus: - Noisy: half of the rooms face the boulevard and the sound insulation is execrable: I do not think they changed them during the recent renovation. I asked to have a room on the quiet side but, surprise, they were making renovation work on Saturday morning at 9! The noise was unbearable and it was impossible to stay in the room, let alone to sleep. I called the reception but they told me it was normal and proposed me to change rooms, without any apologies... I left a complaint because I do not consider it normal not to be able to sleep during the week end in a…

column3: good, let down by the attention to detail
column4: + good central location , friendly staff, large comfortable rooms - we booked three rooms together but were put on different floors even though i had booked well in advance, breakfast was average good selection of fruit but very little in the way of hot food, the scrambled eggs looked like runny porridge, i have stayed at movenpick tanger and that breakfast was a class apart maybe this hotel should go take notes what a proper breakfast buffet is, i was lucky as the breakfast was included, if it is not for £25 a head go have breakfast somewhere else

Its the ex-Husa. The location is central and great. Tramway at 1m walking. 15m driving for the main atractions. Tha brealfast is good. The staff friendly and professional. The rooms are good but better in terms of noise the ones finishing in 4 to 9.

The rooms are kind of average but the staff is very friendly and cooperative . Everyone tried to go a step ahead and accommodate us . Lovely experience . The room I booked was pretty small and we had to accommodate a extra bed in it , the person at the reception tried his level best to upgrade us to a bigger room but unfortunately he couldn't , however we are again staying in the same hotel for 3 nights starting 23 rd feb , hope he is able to sort it for us

I stayed here for five nights last week on a business trip. Exeriences Highs and Lows. the Highs first. Staff were very helpful and particularly not being Arab or French, language was a challenge. But the front desk staff knew enough to make me comfortable. Room was neat and crisp, aalthoughh bathroom could have been cleaned with more detail. Wifi fantastic! and its free. i was located near the lifts on the 9th floor and had great connection. You remain on even in the restaurant and lobby. The restaurant was brilliant, food amazing mix of Swiss and Moroccan. The downside was that we arranged an airport pick up with the hotel. After conecting through Dubai the entire journey from South Africa took more than 18 hours....the pick up was not there when we arrived. I called the…

Stayed for business, excellent service, the rooms are large, spacious and quiet. The location is great for business, the breakfast offer a wide selection of hot and cold meals, the service is prompt. Highly recommended

Stayed for 1 night at the hotel, it is more business hotel, staff is helpful, they offered me late check out upon my request, they provided guidance to major attractions in the city. The room is small but clean and well equipped, room service menu was outdated belonging to the former operator. I recommend this hotel for business travelers.

The property is located in the center of town so is a very convenient business hotel. The staff is professional, courteous and try to help although not many apart from the front desk staff speak very much english (I do understand that I am in a arabic/french speaking nation) The rooms are small but expected as the location is downtown. The lighting in the room is terrible, especially in the bathroom. This made shaving pretty difficult as I was unable to see much of my facial hair due to the dim lighting. The food at dinner was very bland and mediocre, the breakfast buffet was terrible. The eggs were cold and the pastries were stale. If you have a quick stay and need to be in a central location, I would recommend this property but don't expect to be thrilled.

column3: Advice : ask for a quiet room !
column4: Being Swiss myself and being used to Swiss hospitality and quality, I would give a 5 star rate to the hotel staff, who since the beginning of your stay is making you feeling at home. A special distinction goes to the restaurant’s staff. A very nice, friendly and helpful team. And now comes the bad rate for the quality. Even if the room was elegant and spacious, I have been given a very, very noisy room, just on the big avenue. All day and night long with traffic noise, horns, sirens,… Sincerely, I wouldn’t have expect it from a 5 star Swiss owned hotel, especially when you look for some relax and peace after a long day of meetings. It seems it is a real problem at this hotel, especially for all the rooms situated on that side of the building, by the comments I have read (if…

It's in the center of the city good location, very pretty and organize staff, rooms are good and comfortable the pool area you can get a city view and the food and desserts were good. Friendly staff one thing if you have to leave early the next day and you stay includes the breakfast make sure to call so they can bring it to your room if not they won't.

column3: Quality five star stay. Let down in a few minor areas.
column4: Right from our entry through the double doors, we were really impressed with Moevenpick. Despite the fact that no taxi drivers really recognised the hotel name, we made our way there from the airport in peak Casablanca traffic, feeling 300Dh lighter thanks to the Grand taxi driver. On entry to the beautiful lobby, we were greeted by a pianist playing in the corner. Check in was smooth and we were taken to our room with two king singles. There was a large complimentary bottle of mineral water.
