The bathroom was roomy enough with the shower over a bath and a half screen - very European - luckily not too much water spillage over the side. The AC was great and we stayed warm throughout the night. At dinner time, Concierge were great and hailed a taxi for us and ensured the driver…

Had a 14 hour layover. Airport pickup started with an Audi A6! Nice touch. I think we had a thirty minute ride. The room was clean and modern and the bathroom was excellent. Modern stand up shower and modern bathtub. There was also a separate partially private toilet area. The bed was comfortable. Most importantly, the staff was very friendly. French is the main language but there is enough English spoken so you can manage with some basic French mixed into your English. I would recommend.

column3: Excellent service for organizing an ad hoc wedding night
column4: Can you imagine an ad hoc wedding evening away from home with no dinner or any party arranged? Sounds like a fiasco, but not with the Mövenpick Casablanca staff. We got married on the 31st of December in the morning and were supposed to fly to Marrakech the same day. However, our flight was cancelled and our witnesses and us got stuck in Casablanca and happened to stay in this hotel. As the night manager spotted my bridal bouquet, upon arrival, gave us immediately an upgrade to a suite with welcome sweets and free massage in the spa which I really considered a nice gesture. Furthermore, even though we got to the hotel late and did not make it to the restaurant before 11 on New Year's Evening...., we still wanted to give it a try and have a nice dinner and evening. The…

I had the pleasure of staying here and was very impressed with the staff and the room. The room was HUGE (and I didn't pay for an upgrade so not sure if I was given one or if all of the rooms are that big).

column3: Nice hotel and a good break from this city
column4: Had some issues at check in, however they were great and made everything right. We booked the family room on Expedia and expedia screwed it up. The staff was very helpful and I find no fault in the service they provided. Rooms were nice sized and well equipped. We were only 10 minutes from the main train station, 10 minutes from the mosque and 35 minutes to the airport. Good bar on the lower level, over priced, but we were well taken caremof and it was a nice environment.

Thats my first visit to casablanca. Lovely city and country The hotel by itself was located at the heart of the city. Its a business hotel. So don't expect a 5 stars lobby and many restaurants. The room was nicely fitted and clean. I choses 8th floor to be away of street crowd The restaurant is nice. I have tried it couple if times and food was good with plenty of hospitality Concierge tried to help in several instance. But they lack of professional Though they are extremely friendly as most moroccan people

This hotel seems to have it all, It has a great pool on the roof, a huge breakfast and nice rooms for a good price. However service (not from everyone though - the concierge was amazing) is very, very slow (as most of Casablanca it seems). Internet proved to be a big challenge here. It depends on what room you get. My room was in a bit of a corner and the concrete walls might have obscured the signal, but being on a business trip not having decent internet was a big problem. The restaurant is VERY pricey and service is abysmal. Food is so-so all over but is nicely presented. One very good meal was the classic tajine, but you can get this for about the third of the price at any good restaurant in town and at the same quality.

We had pre booked, ideal location. The hotel is OK with a great swimming pool with views accross Casablanca. However when we went to book out we were shocked to find out that the average breakfast was £25 extra although this was never mentioned on booking in. They showed the very small print on pre booking in. My point is they should make it clear at reception. We did offer to pay half but they refussed. The fact also is we spent a fortune on the very exspensive drinks in the hotel bar. Very poor service and attitude.

This is an "okay" hotel. Location is excellent - close to city centre. Rooms and bathrooms are nice. Breakfast selection and variety is average. Wifi was excellent and available all over the hotel. Check-in was poor; staff were not very friendly and were quite slow. Overall, it was an "okay" experience. Expected better out of a Moevenpick.

Excellent Hotel. Easy access by tram from Hassan II street direct from Casa Voyageurs train station which is linked to the airport by train. Checkin poor, staff not confident. Great room with super king bed, very comfortable. Lovely bath. Very Nice roof pool. Good breakfast. Great cocktails, especially the Mojitos. Very nice prawn tajine. Kind staff caring.

Decent hotel and very close to city centre - business hub. Renovated rooms with couple of restaurants and bars. Nice breakfast and food quality is good. Friendly staff and courteous service. Need to mention non-smoking rooms while doing check-in.

One of the best hotels i've ever been! This hotel has a nice location, and all the facilities. The rooms are awesome,they have everything you need in them, iron included, nice beds, i do thinks there is something thermic in them. I had a wonderful night of sleep here. Smells good and looks good! The rooftop is also one of the best i've seen, with gym, pool, spa, and a nice view over the large city of casablanca. Definitely the best breakfast I ate, it has everything you can imagine!! International and moroccan food! It's difficult to look for negative points here, however i could sugest more electricity points to link chargers, ours only had 2 free, and neither of them mear the bed. (However my parents one had plenty of them). We stayed at the 9th floor, however i supose that…

Aside from the staff, who seemed very confused by our group (they couldn't wrap their heads around the fact that several couples travelling together had different last names), and who actually tried to check me into a room that was already taken by someone else, this hotel was very nice. I loved my room (as a result of the confusion, I got somewhat upgraded to a smallish suite with a king bed and a sitting area), and it was a shame my group only stayed for one night. I would have preferred one night in Fes and two nights in Casablanca. Very well located near the tramway, but quite a walk to the medina (at least 500m, I'd say). I found the hotel itself quiet but it is on a main street, and traffic in Morocco is definitely not for the faint of heart, so expect lots of road noise.

column3: Needs improvement ! Lackluster hotel and staff
column4: I guess smoking is a Casablanca thing because the hotel smelt like smoke, the entrance, the corridors, just about everywhere you went people were smoking. The water fountain outside the hotel doesn't work. What kind of 5 star hotel can't even keep up the appearance of their hotel. The hotel couldn't find our booking even though I had proof of booking from booking.com, so check in was a nightmare. We did eventually check in about an hour after arrival. The area in which the hotel is located looks fairly ok but we didn't venture out as it was almost 9 pm when we were eventually checked in. The hotel rooms are a decent size. Very modern and well decorated, although a bit on the dark side. The restaurant is very nice and they serve tasty food. There was a delightful gentleman Amid…

What a weird place. There's nothing awful about this place but there's also nothing great about it either. The rooms are also strangely cold. Black paint, thick curtains. Not very welcoming. Even the rooftop seems haphazardly decorated. Lounge chairs are crammed up against one another. While there are several food options, the prices are through the roof for what you get. Staff seems nice enough but also inexperienced. Located in a neighborhood with not much character and very few restaurants. Some of these things could be chalked up to the fact that the hotel has undergone new management and could improve in the future.

column3: One ot the best business hotel in Casablanca
column4: This hotel is very well located in one of the major roads of Casablanca and in front of a tramway station, near the business center of the city. The hotel is expensive regarding the structural conditions of the building, especially in what concerns the acoustic comfort. The staff is very the staff is very nice but they have a lot of difficult to handle with the management rules and internal procedures. The reservations and invoicing system of the hotel is often with problems and it's normal to have clients complaining in the reception. The restaurant is good but a little expensive regarding other restaurants near the hotel with superior offer. Although, the breakfast is the best of all the hotels I have been in Casablanca.

column3: A mediocre hotel with inexistant customer service
column4: First of all, I've stayed in Movenpicks all over the Middle East and they've been sensational, especially the one in Petra. That said, the Movenpick in Casablanca is a joke. First of all, they refused to move my reservation when I reserved under the wrong date so I lost my payment of one full night, when all they had to do was change it to the following day. After I arrived, it took them a full hour to check me in. The man at the front desk was nice but absolutely clueless. When I asked if the hotel could offer me a complimentary drink due to the wait, he told me there was water in my room even though I didn't yet have a room. Later when I asked him for a converter for my US plug he said they had all been given to other guests yet when I asked the concierge a little while…

column3: This is now the Movenpick Casablanca, but could be Fawlty Towers
column4: Well, where do I start?... I know... "Fawlty Towers" really sums it up.. It's a well meaning hotel with good intentions but fails to deliver at evey corner... but it is amusing! This hotel could be an excellant hotel, but somehow the Movenpick ethos "Ordinary things in an Extraordinary way. Attention to detail..." seems to have been badly translatted here or simply not to have actually been communicated to the local management team! I am sure if you are allocated a room to your liking (the rooms are an exccalnet size, with good amenaties.. but be aware, they are all diiferent layouts, and if you want a view, ask for a room on a high floor preferably above floor 12) and you don't hit any problems, then you will enjoy staying at Movenpick Casablanca. However, if you hit a…

column3: Good hotel now part of Movenpick group.
column4: Well located hotel for seeing Casablanca which is worth visiting. We had requested a quiet room and we're allocated a good sized room on the quiet side. Very clean. Good restaurant onsite. Terrific roof top pool area. Staff were professional, friendly and helpful with local advice. It's a good choice for accommodation in Casablanca.

column3: Good location, unhelpful staff, weird shower heads
column4: Full disclosure: my first impression of the Husa hotel was marred by the fact that our suitcases got lost (my first time) and we had a stressful time getting to Morocco (our flight reservation from Brussels to Casablanca got mysteriously canceled and we managed to get on the plane to Casablanca in the last minute, after having almost accepted that we weren't going to make it). With this preface in mind, the Husa is very conveniently located just off of one of the tram stops. After you get off the airport train at Casa Voyageurs, you take the city tram for a few stops, and the hotel is right off of one of the tram stops. The reception staff was smug and had a dismissive attitude both at check-in and check-out. The next morning when I called the hotel reception and asked them…

column3: All Fur coat and no Knickers
column4: Stayed here with The Dumball Rally Rooms were wonderful but not the service unfortunately asked for a drink twice at the bar and got ignored probably because I was a woman on my own.Twice disturbed in my room too.It's a shame the restaurant service was poor as this hotel has the capability of being a really good hotel.

This hotel is quite handy to most of the highlights of Casablanca. The room had a previous smoker which was not that great for us being non smokers. There was some street noise as no double glazing. The staff were very helpful and breakfast was great too.

This was just a stopover for our flight home from Morocco the next morning. Although they knew there were 3 of us in one room, we got up to our room and there was no cot for our daughter and towels for 2 people only. They advertise a sushi bar/restaurant, it was closed. The only restaurant open was the international cafe. The 3 of us ordered beef tenderloin medium rare. All 3 came well done. We sent them back. They came back almost raw. Definitely not a 5 star hotel. Room was spacious but sparsely decorated. Bathroom was updated and clean. Okay for one night but nothing special.

My husband and I were flying out of Casablanca airport after spending a week in Marrakech & Essaouira. After reading reviews on Tripadvisor we pikced Hotel Usa Casablanca Plaza for the nice looking pool. When we got off the bus from Essaouira, we hopped into a petit taxi and it costed us about 30 dirahm to get to the hotel. From the moment we approached the front desk until the moment we left for the airport, we could not have received better service. When we were checking in, we asked for an extra quiet room as we were tired from the long bus trip and we wanted to get up relatively early to check out the mosque first thing the next morning. They made sure that we were given one of the rooms in the back of the building, away from the main blvd. For dinner arrangements the staff…

Friendly helpful loverly rooms central heated bathroom floor great for drying washing would stay again great coffee shop opposite amazing cheap breakfast however room service food delicious and plentifull

I stayed 2 nights for business purposes. Well located next to tramway station, wich is easy as trafic by car in Casa is terrible. Nice room, Good bed. Very good breakfast buffet, including large choice of fresh fruit. Restaurant/bar serves Good food. Internet correction was not stable in the room.

column3: Bad service will leave a bad taste.
column4: Service is quite bad here. It took me multiple emails and follow ups to get a confirmation that a van would be waiting for an airport transfer. Hotel room is decently sized and clean. My main complaint is that they tried to charge an extra $75 USD for a guest when I mistakenly booked a 1 person room (even though this was a king bed room, and extremely spacious). All rooms in the US are double occupancy, so I admit that there may be local customs I am not aware of. When I challenged them on this matter, they initially tried to extract an extra $75, which would have made this a $200/night room, which it is not of that caliber. Ultimately they came down to an extra $25.

average 4 star hotel but a real 4 star. Very Good for business stay. Good service but sometimes slow in reception. Bathrooms sometimes get flooded... could be improved finishings and materials. Average breakfast. Good location near tramway.

column3: Nicely renewed hotel and pleasant stay
column4: The hotel was renewed relatively soon, I think it opened somewhere around mid 2012. I was pleased to find a very nice and comfortable hotel in the heart of Casablanca, easy to find and with access to all main sites in the city. Also the tram station is just in front of it. Polite staff, clean and proper rooms, good service. Beautiful view to the city from the roof where the pool is situated. Overall my stay in Husa Casablanca Plaza was a very pleasant one.

good location, very clean, excellent breakfast (fresh fruits and good bread), very good wifi, kind staff, reasonably priced, i would go back again. my friend who was traveling with me didn't like his room view and he was immediately given another one

I was impressed with their building architecture, very unique, my sister’s an architect and she made a lot of notes and was inspired by their features. The room had the usual and the basics of every hotel. The facilities included a fitness center, a pool and spa services. All in all their services were nice. I don’t have any complains at the moment but something was just missing. Maybe it’s just me. The breakfast is standard and good. Very relaxing terrace view with the pool

We spent only one night in this hotel, but the staff managed to show us their lack of attention and courtesy. Besides this, the room was spacious and clean and the bed was very good. Did not have breakfast, so can't evaluate.

Stayed there for a week for conference Located at busy intersection, but quite close to everywhere I needed to go. Walking distance to old medina, Hassan II Mosque, Habous quarter. Tram station is just in front of it, perfect option to get to the Corniche. Unless you're used to traffic noise, re-consider for staying here. It can be really noisy around 6-7 pm. Room size is okay, felt less spacious because it has a sofa in it, but eventually I liked having the sofa. Cleanliness was a bit of a problem, perhaps in 1 or 2 days I found my room wasn't really tidied up (only the bed was made), and cleaning service missed a big spot in the bathroom. Other days were clean enough. Breakfast was so-so. Lunch was really good. I never got bored with 7-day of having lunch there. Staffs…

We stayed here for one night as part of a tour and it is Moroccan 5 star not a Western 5 star hotel. The reception staff dont speak English very well and I wouldnt exactly say the service was 5 star. Our room was good, very large king size bed. The room was on the 6th floor and faced the road so I thought it was quite noisy. The breakfast was very average and they dont provide water which I thought was odd. All n all a good hotel and I would stay here again.

Husa Casablanca Plaza was a fine place to stay for a night before heading to the airport and home. Staff were helpful and reasonably efficient. The room had attractive, chain hotel decor and was both clean and comfortable. Not a place to linger and relax but served our purpose well.

Stayed here as part of a tour. The room we were initially given reeked of cigarette smoke, we returned to reception and were given a new room key. The next room had not been cleaned since the last guest had checked out, third time lucky we were moved to a nice modern clean room with a king bed on the 10th floor. All three rooms were modern and spacious, free WIFI in the room and lobby. Great fresh buffet breakfast. Impressive roof terrace with a pool, basic gym and city views.

The hotel is of average quality - the room was comfortable but not special. The service at the hotel was not good, but they did arrange for airport pick-up that worked out well. The roof top was the best part. It has a nice view of the city. I do not recommend ordering room service.

We stayed in Husa Plaza for two nights in November 2013, well located business hotel, good facilities, decently decorated interiors, helpful staffs only negative is that it is too much close to the road, but a walking distance to the main centres. food was okey., overall enjoyed the stay.

column3: Poor service and a noisy location
column4: My friend and I picked this hotel for our arrival to Morocco and we choose poorly. As two women arriving into Morocco on separate flights and times, we emailed the hotel before leaving home to ensure they could arrange taxi transfers for each of us. Even though the cost was more that a normal taxi we wanted to have an easy arrival and were happy to pay the hotels additional charge. We even telephoned them before leaving home to make sure all arrangements were in place. How disappointing it was to arrive at Casablanca airport to find that NEITHER of the taxis turned up.While this was disappointing, it was the attitute of the reception staff on arrival that was infuriating. They couldn't have cared less, and actually seemed annoyed by us asking why they didn't turn up. My friend…

Stayed in room on side of hotel which faces the main road. Even with windows shut on 10th floor, the windowa do not seal 100% so loads if traffic noise, car and truck horns, emergency sirens and of course Call to Prayer. I'm a heavy sleeper and I qoke probably 20 times due to the noise. Breakfast is a huge rip off. When I went there was no hot food or fresh bread available yet despite pointing this out Iwas charged 250dhs (£25 $40) for the privilage. I wont be staying again.

Great rooms, design, very clean and nicely furnished with a very comfortable queen size bed! Have an amazing roof terrace with pool & gym with a stunning view on the city. The spa is tiny and ok... Food is ok... Though breakfast rather expensive (if not included in rate) .. All in all really excellent value for money! I will be back! (only a bit annoying thing is the slowlynes of Check in personnel... But all is relative ad pretty rapid compared to most other Moroccan places...)

My travel partner and I spent the last night of our Morocco trip here. At check-in, the desk did not tell us of our free breakfast the next morning when we were waiting for our cab. Dining room staff were excellent; we had a wonderful tapas. A former Holiday Inn, the re-do is well-done, chic decor! My bed was so comfortable I fell asleep in seconds (would like to know company who made the mattress)! We left at 7am in an "airport" taxi; this trip was 35 - 40 mintues WITHOUT traffic.

I was looking for a comfortable hotel to land in after 30 hours travelling from Australia and the Husa Casablanca Plaza definitely ticked the boxes. It's a little isolated if you're looking for somewhere nearby to eat in the evenings, but the hotel restaurant serves tasty (and pricey) food. I did draw the line though at the 20 Euro breakfasts! My room was large, clean and quiet, and the rooftop pool is simply wonderful. My only gripe is that my non-smoking room stank of cigarette smoke...

Someone did a fabulous remodel recently, very chic, very deco. The staff was helpful but confused. We were offered the free breakfast as we were waiting for the taxi to the airport, but not before, and then the offer was withdrawn. I suggested to the manager that a room that reeks of cigarette smoke is not actually a non-smoking room, but he didn't understand. When we asked to call Air France to confirm a flight and it took 3 people a lot of time to come up with a phone number, as if this request had never been made before.

This hotel was great. I stayed here with a friend for four nights. The pool is so relaxing. The Madrid restaurant was fantastic with great food and good service. Throughout our stay the reception staff would give us a big wave and a smile. Rooms were very spacious and clean. May be a little noisy but that is too be expected as casablanca is very busy. All in all would stay there again.

column3: A little loud, but otherwise excellent
column4: This westernized hotel had every amenity. Our room was several floors above the road and was a little loud as we could hear the traffic below. The manager was friendly and great. We ate dinner and breakfast at the hotel restaurant, and both were delicious! Other than the noise, this was a great hotel!

start with an insignficant reception where I am been obliged to carry my lugage alone. The porter present in front of the door, was watching me carryng luggage from taxi withount help. Then i did not find the reservation I made by phone from airport. The price was that most hight one, the one published, withount reduction being in the weak end. Then I spend a fortune just drinking a soft drink and a cofee. The given room was not ready and I had to wait more than one hour. just correct the room (not really a 5* one!) The ony positive thing is the tramway just in fron of the hotel.

column3: the true definition of "home away from home"
column4: I've spent about a month it that hotel and I have to say that it was amazing. The location, facilities room and staff are impeccable. Always there to give you any kind of assistance, the staff is extremely kind and professional, they would do anything to help. The room are spacious and comfortable, clean and elegantly decorated. It has been a real delight, I will certainly go back.

column3: Good business hotel. Love the roof terrace
column4: Very clean, nicely decorated hotel and rooms. When checking in try to ask a room on the backside, this to avoid being woken up by beeping cars. The best of the hotel is the nice small pool and terrace on the roof. Perfect to have a drink before going out to a restaurant in the evening. Breakfast is basic, but the always have really nice seasonal fruit. You can ask for personal omelettes, not really indicated it's an option, but just ask them. Internet is of decent quality for Casablanca. Some nice restaurants walking distance from the hotel: hippopotamus, maison blanche, kaiten, ... One day we tried the Spanish restaurant in the hotel, was quite disappointing, so never tried it again. Heard the Moroccan one is better.

Great Hotel, nice beds and spacious rooms. The service is excellent, the staff was very helpfull every time you need them. At arrival the shower didn't work, but after a fast phone call somebody came to our room to fix it right away. The roomservice is fast also with fine meals or snacks.

This is a 4 star business hotel ...nice pool on the top of the hotel with panoramic view, re ally comfortable bed, and a nice bathroom. The price for a night is quite expencive but we were lucky to get a cheap offer. Over all nice stay

We stayed just one night here, but it was very comfortable. Staff were friendly and helpful. The room was big enough as was the bathroom. They provided extra sheets so we could make a bed for our young daughter on the sofa. The breakfast was very good, though we had to sit next to a table of smokers which wasn't nice first thing. The pool was lovely, though it was too windy to relax outside the pool itself. The location is central, the tram stop is very near and the hotel can help you to get taxis.

column3: Attractive hotel in the modern part of Casablanca
column4: The Husa hotel is a step above the average four-star hotel one encounters in one's travels through this part of the world. [Maybe that is why it has five stars] Elevators are about twice the size of those in most local hotels, the rooms are of average size but more attractively and tastefully furnished and with good lighting. The bathrooms also are modern and well lit and provide good water pressure. Service in the main dining room is attentive and professional and the food is well prepared and nicely presented. This hotel should satisfy any finicky world traveler. global New York City

Stayed only one night but could not have asked for a better experience. Room was spacious and clean. Very hip, modern style to the hotel and the staff was excellent and fluent in English. Would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to/through Casa for any length of time.

The comment of one traveler about the noice at the roundabout is absolute true. Just request a room with view of the medina and you will have a quieter room to the side. Service was good, but a litte more knowledge of the english language would help a lot. Our room was very spacious, clean and most comfortable!! Breakfast is plenty, but the service who is supposed to care for coffee and tea is slow. Over all we were very happy with our stay, direct at the tram but everything could also be reached by a good walk, even the Habous.

Stayed here at the end of March. We woke up very early due to the traffic at the Hassan II roundabout just outside the hotel. Constant beeping! The hotel itself was so comfortable though, and although we didn't use the rooftop pool it looked lovely and relaxing. The staff we came across were quite pleasant also. I wouldn't recommend the city of Casablanca for tourists. We didn't feel comfortable walking around as there were NO tourists at all, and we got a bit of hassle.

Beautiful hotel central Casablanca The center of the city and is located directly to him tram station. And you can navigate through it to many parts of the city Hotel features an excellent location, excellent services and proximity to some of the attractions., Such as the Great Mosque and the old city

I stayed here one night due to the hotel that I actually booked was overbooked. So they arranged a room here. I didn´t see that much from the hotel. I arrived late and left early morning. Seems typical 5 star business hotel. Designed to keep people comfortable western style. It could be in any city in the world. As long as you stay in the hotel you might totally forget where you are. The style is dark. Long dark hallways. Decent sized quiet typical 5 star rooms. With lots of bedding, options and luxury bathroom. Typical hotel food and hotel-food prices but of good quality. Breakfast also typical for the class of hotel. They do have some local options like for example local mint-tea. Location is in midst of down town. Easy to find a taxi.

After a trip to Marrakech, I went to this hotel in casablanca. What a disappointment!! Impossible to sleep after 7AM because the hotel is near a roundabout and drivers do not stop honking the horn. Windows have are not doubled. In addition I rarely saw the staff smiling. Never again I will go to casablanca for tor tourism nor for work. Burk :(

column3: A very nice hotel in downtown Casablanca
column4: Nice modern rooms. The hotel has also a very friendly staff. Modern bathrooms. The beds are somewhat hard if you're used to high-comfort matrasses. Great view on top terrace, with a refreshing swimming pool. NIce hammam/sauna facilities.

The hotel has been refitted since HI days. Rooms are very elegant and staff are friendly and helpful. Great view from the pool, but too cold due to the weather on my visit. Moroccan restaurant is good. Breakfast quite expansive.

We stayed at this hotel for two nights and because our departure time was very early in the morning, we booked two different reservation (one night with breakfast and the other nitht without breakfast). The reception did not understand well the reservation and they tried to give us two rooms for mywife and myself!? and even after we explained, gave us two different room type for each day as the rate was different. After explaining many times that the room should be the same and difference is only breakfast, they understood. We booked a king-size bedroom and we asked for it to make sure at the time of check-in but when we walked in to the room, the room had two signe beds, and we needed to go back to the reception to change the room. The English level and quality at the reception…

This was a very adequate hotel, clean and in a good location. We arrived fairly late at night and left early the following morning, so we cannot comment on all of its facilities. The bedroom had a good view over part of the city. It would have benefited, however, with more power points for our electronic equipment.

We had an unpleasant experience in this hotel, which is currently called "Husa Casablanca Plaza" and managed by the Husa Group. Actually the bad feeling already started when booking through their own group website booking system. I made a mistake with the booking dates and tried hard to get in touch with them several times via emails and phone calls which they never replied, chasing them for days. The double room we booked through their website cost Euro 118.-- (including taxes). When we checked-out and had to pay the bill, the receptionist asked us to pay 132 Euro! We showed him our reservation but he justified that with the exchange rate difference (which is not specified anywhere in their website nor in the reservation page). We had a terrible argument and left frustrated…

column3: Good for business travelers but not a 5 star
column4: Couple late 30's, stayed for 1 night We stayed there before taking the plane back to london. arrived from the train station - 50 dir, tourist price for any taxi drive in the city without the meter... The hotel is modern, very clean, centrally located, 5/10 min to the mosque, 20 dir with the meter. rooms are really nice, ample space, good beds and very modern with all the usual items. however we were a bit disappointed because - the outside pool is actually not heated - sauna is not included in the price (gym is) - spanish restaurant was not opened - you can smoke in the main restaurant area (european food was fine btw) - they made us pay at check out before realising we had already done so when we booked otherwise, the mosque tour is one hour (120 dir) and well worth it The…
